Recognizing Jane's efforts, the Juvenile Welfare Department elects her as the new warden.
The story concludes with Jane and the boys transforming the Reform House, an abode that prioritizes compassion and education.
Jane evolves into the "Angel Warden,' commanding the respect and admiration of not only the reformatory boys but also the city.

title: Hidden Hearts (2023 film)
synopsis: The story unfolds with a picturesque view of Wall Street's towering skyscrapers, where our protagonists, Madison Carter and Noah Mitchell, are immersed in complex financial reports.
The scene transitions to display Madison and Noah at the heart of Two Peak Enterprises.
Their relationship, albeit business-oriented, is a vital component of the firm.
Despite the demands of their high-pressure jobs, the two manage to cultivate a budding romance.
Suddenly, a transaction of unprecedented proportions starts to shake the foundations of Two Peaks.
This billion-dollar deal begins to dominate the conversation, raising stakes across the financial landscape.
Madison and Noah's covert relationship comes under scrutiny.
There's a simultaneous tension between their fear of exposure and the stress of the impending billion-dollar deal.
In their analysis of the gargantuan deal, Madison and Noah identify a discrepancy that raises alarm bells.
They launch a secret investigation, delving furiously into the labyrinth of deception that infects the higher echelons of Two Peaks.
Their once-familiar office morphs into unwelcoming territory as unknown adversaries send chilling threats in response to their probing.
Their interpersonal bonds are tested further as they wrestle with a moral quandary surrounding their loyalty to their employer and their duty as conscientious citizens.
A new roadblock appears; an unexpected internal audit is announced at Two Peaks.
Madison and Noah escalate their investigation.
Their actions lead to an earth-shattering revelation: the very person they respected and emulated, their boss, is the puppeteer behind the corruption.
Upon the discovery of their boss's puppeteering, retaliation is swift and vicious.
A gripping chase ensues with Madison and Noah racing against time to secure irrefutable evidence of the crimes.
They manage to secure the valuable evidence necessary to expose their nefarious boss.
They take a moral stand, choosing their ethical responsibility over their coveted careers.
Armed with damning evidence, Madison and Noah confront their colleagues at Two Peaks' annual gala, unveiling their CEO's unscrupulous activities to an astounded audience.
Amid the chaos, a physical altercation erupts.
Madison and Noah courageously battle the onslaught to protect their evidence.
After the ordeal, they hand over their evidence to the authorities.
The downfall of Two Peak Enterprises sends shockwaves across Wall Street.
Madison and Noah, hailed as righteous heroes, decide to distance themselves from the aggressive world of finance.
The narrative closes with the couple embarking on a new life in a bucolic setting.
A note of suspense strikes as hints point at an omnipresent surveillance.
The screen pans to a computer monitor, with Two Peaks' now-defunct website displayed.
The narrative ends leaving a lasting sense of suspense.

title: Suburban Scholars: The Saturday Class
synopsis: The movie curtains rise to reveal a sweeping, picturesque scene of Elmwood, a sophisticated, well-manicured suburban enclave ensconced in the heartland of Naperville, Illinois.

Stepping into Elmwood, we are introduced to five discernible, distinct teenagers who come from different walks of life, each with their own unique characteristics and challenges, forming the nucleus of our story.
First, we are introduced to Jake, a rebellious teen recognizable from his worn, tattered leather jacket and wild hair.
Crossing town, we enter the practice grounds of Naperville High, where we find our next character.
Matt, the school's adored quarterback, is practicing under the sun.
From the muscular football player, we shift to Grace, engrossed in perusing "A Brief History of Time" by Stephen Hawking.
Moving to Elmwood's local thrift store, Violet, the town's identified eccentric is found exploring the rows of vintage records.
Next, the narrative takes us into the school's state-of-the-art gymnasium, where Emily, the school’s perceived embodiment of perfection and cheerleader captain, is seen practicing her routines.
The plot twists when each of the main characters receives a cryptically ominous note from an unexpected courier - the steely eyed and often intimidating Frank, the school's janitor.
The subsequent Saturday unfolds within the confines of a seemingly mundane detention classroom.
The first interaction amongst them rings with undisguised hostility, animosity bristling through their terse exchanges, and acerbic observations.
However, as they spend time together, the surface-level discussions of why they have landed in detention evolve into poignant stories of their personal battles and unseen tribulations.
Jake reveals his unruly behavior is a mask for his challenging home life.
Following suit, Matt provides insight into his life off the field, revealing the burden he carries to maintain his status as a leading athlete.
Grace reveals her constant battle with being intellectually superior in an environment where this makes her a target.
Emily uncovers the relentless pressure she experiences in maintaining her position as a popular cheerleader.
Lastly, Violet sheds her quirky facade and admits to the often stifling loneliness she experiences as a non-conformist amidst a crowd of predictable patterns.
Finding common ground through their individual struggles they decide to band together to outsmart their rigid principal, Mr. Chandler.
In a strategic whisper, each member contributes to an elaborate scheme, crafting a meticulous plan to escape the stifling classroom of detention.
Displaying tangible audacity, they stealthily maneuver through the unfamiliar maze beneath the school, evading patrolling janitors.
As they navigate their way to freedom, they realize their experiences have kindled an emergent friendship, undermining their earlier misconceptions of each other.
They slip back into detention just as the imposing thump of Mr. Chandler's steps reverberate ominously through the quiet hallways.
The shared adventure fosters a deeper, more understanding dialogue about their dreams, fears and secrets, strengthening their nascent bond.
Solidifying their new friendship, they shake hands to seal an agreement, promising respect, understanding, and support to every member of the group.
This pact induces an emotional catharsis, where they accept both their and their peers' flaws and imperfections.
The narrative returns to the ensuing Monday, where the newly formed clique confidently strides through Naperville High.
Together, they challenge inherited norms and expectations, refusing to be boxed into their preconceived characters anymore.
As the final bell rings, amidst astonished gazes, a haunting voiceover crowns them as “The Suburban Scholars”.
The story reaches its climax, cataloging their journeys of self-discovery, acceptance and the solidification of a solid camaraderie.
The movie ends leaving viewers with the potent message of breaking societal norms and acknowledging authentic friendships above all else.

title: Ocean Lessons
synopsis: The film opens by introducing us to Richard, a highly successful wall street executive.
Despite showing an image of power and prestige, one could not overlook the undertones of discontent that shrouded Richard's polished exterior.
Following the dispersal of the board meeting, Richard finds himself alone in his sleek, minimalistic office.
An urgent call from Martha, their old family housekeeper, informs him about his father, John’s serious health condition.
This devastating news prompts Richard to embark on an unexpected journey back to his roots, although done with considerable reluctance.
Richard soon finds himself in Wick, his quaint Scottish hometown, a stark and unsettling contrast to his fast-paced Manhattan life.
The film's narrative enthralls audiences with sepia-toned flashbacks, providing glimpses of Richard's grim childhood.

A consequential incident from his past where an enraged John hurls young Richard into the tempestuous waters of the North Sea amplifies his bitterness towards John and lays the foundation for his deep-seated fear of the ocean.
Back in the present, Richard grapples with the haunting memories of his harsh upbringing.
Richard decides to confront his ailing father about his questionable parenting methods.
John, caught off guard by Richard’s severity, reveals a shocking truth about a life-altering shipwreck incident he survived as a young man.
Armored with his tough upbringing, John expresses his intentions behind Richard's harsh childhood.
Despite the surprising revelation, Richard remains skeptical about his father's intentions.
Overwhelmed by his father's revelation and the heartfelt letter, Richard decides to confront his childhood nemesis - the unforgiving North Sea, his training ground under strict parental supervision.
Noticing Richard’s steadfast resolve, John seizes the opportunity to pass on his maritime wisdom, creating a fragile yet significant bond with his estranged son.
Father and son experience fleeting afternoons, sailing in an old fashioned fishing boat named ‘Stella Maris’.
Now armed with his father's nautical knowledge and emboldened by his own determination, Richard decides to embrace nature's might.
He sets sail alone in Stella Maris, ready to confront whatever the unpredictable sea might throw at him.
As the raging ocean threatens to swallow him, Richard is faced with a terrifying decision – surrender to the brutal fury of the storm or summon every single ounce of courage and fight.
As John's words reverberate in his mind, Richard takes the decision to face the storm head-on.
The battle against the furious sea mimics his inner struggle against the bitterness he held towards his father.
After a hard-fought battle, Richard manages to survive the storm, symbolizing his acceptance and understanding of his father's teachings, and marking his journey towards personal enlightenment.
Having braved the storm and conquered his childhood fear, a transformed Richard returns to his father, his expressions no longer clouded by anger but replaced with newfound respect and understanding.
Richard sits by his father's deathbed, expressing his gratitude for the harsh lessons he was taught, the difficult experiences that turned out to be his savior.
Seeing his son's transformation, an emotional John breaks down, realizing his harsh love has indeed shaped the resilience he yearned to instill within Richard.
John eventually drifts away in his sleep, leaving Richard alone with newfound wisdom in that same old granite cottage by the sea they once shared.
Following the demise of his father, Richard makes the radical decision to abandon his Wall Street lifestyle.
He decides to embrace simplicity, returning to his roots in Wick.
As months morph into years, Richard wins the hearts of people with his humble demeanor and his efforts to protect the town's maritime tradition.
Richard teaches his five-year-old son, Liam, to swim in the same waters of the North Sea that held such prominence in his own life.
Unlike his experience, Richard guides Liam into the water holding his hand, the warmth in his actions demonstrating a gentler, more compassionate approach to teaching life’s critical lessons.
Richard underscores the importance of understanding and respecting the sea's raw power and unpredictability.
The close of the film parallels the opening – Richard presiding over an important discussion.
However, he now sits by the sea instead of an office, planning for the upcoming town festival.
He utilizes the hard-learned lessons from the North Sea to educate those around him about the threats and beauty it holds.
The concluding scene of the film captures Richard's content and wise expressions, starkly contrasting from the apprehensions of the opening scene.
The film ends with a heartwarming silhouette of father and son by the sea's edge at sunset.

The final frame of the film underscores the transformation of Richard, a resentful urban boy indoctrinated by maritime lessons, into a compassionate father and respected leader of his coastal community.
Richard's life comes full circle as he carries forward his father’s steadfast legacy, passing down a wealth of marine wisdom to the next generation.
As the screen begins to fade, viewers are left contemplating Richard's transformation, the impact of John's strict parenting, and the relentless might of the North Sea.
As the credits start rolling, the sounds of crashing waves and distant cawing of gulls fill the silence, a reminiscent echo of the unforgiving ocean and its profound life lessons.
And so concludes the poignant maritime saga of a resentful son's transformation into a grateful father, an emotional and gripping narrative that vividly asserts the victory of wisdom over wealth.

title: Connection: Survival Mode
synopsis: We meet our six friends, Sarah, Lauren, Ava, Emily, Madelyn, and Max, in varying snapshots of the mundanity of quarantine life.

Today's session starts off as it always does – a mix of quarantine trivia, reminiscing about lost experiences; closed movie theaters, canceled trips, and just the profundity of the blameless world they missed.
Amidst the chatter, an alert pops up on Lauren's screen; the computer science whiz has received an email from an unknown sender.
The email contains a link to an online game named 'Survival Mode'.

Presenting this peculiar finding to the group during the call, Lauren breathes quiet excitement into an otherwise monotonous day – an online multi-user game promising adrenaline-fueled escapism from the tedium of quarantine.
After an extensive discussion, during which the desire for excitement battles the caution of internet safety, the friends decide to dive into the unknown and play the game.
With strange enthusiasm, they begin their journey into 'Survival Mode'.
However, their initial excitement is slightly dulled as their screens begin to flicker with strange pixels and indecipherable glitches.

Static distorts Lauren’s webcam and among the chaos, horrifying glimpses of faceless entities briefly appear on her Macbook before disappearing, Ava and Max, hear eerie, unexplainable sounds of whispers and far-off thunderstorms.
Despite these unsettling occurrences, they attribute it to game ambiance and decide to play on.
The game, now truly underway, directs them to perform tasks that need to be accomplished within their respective homes.
The tasks start innocuously, merely causing minor disruptions to their households like turning off lights or rifling through papers to locate an old yearbook.
Yet as time ticks on, each task intensifies in danger, creating an environment of pervasive tension, a stark contrast to the safety they previously found in their homes.
Emily, the daring athlete amongst them, stumbles during a task involving retrieving a necklace from her dark, unsettling basement.
The failure takes an immediate toll on Emily, as her lively personality begins to fade toward a terrifying unpredictability, and her usual flush of health drains from her face.
Alarmed by Emily's transformation, the friends start to question the invasive effects of this supposed game.
Their doubts only grow as the game continues to unfold, dishing out darker and more personal tasks; forcing them to confront their deepest fears.
Soon, Madelyn, Ava, and Lauren follow Emily, falling victim to the game which now preys on them, escalating the horrors they each experience.
In a desperate attempt to regain some semblance of control, Sarah, who studies psychology, and Max, a literature major, try to pull the plug on the game.
Their efforts, however, prove pointless, with the game resisting their frantic attempts at uninstallation.
'Survival Mode' wields an iron grip over their lives, turning their once safe homes into a perpetual house of horror.
Recognizing the looming threat and with no escape in sight, Sarah proposes a solution – they must beat the game.
Now on the precipice of desperation, the group, though fearful, accept Sarah's proposed strategy as their last remaining lifeline.
Armed with a plan, they get back into the game, analytically dissecting the rules and patterns underlying their personal ordeal.
As they delve deeper, the game bears the full extent of its teeth, revealing a terrifying game-scape filled with each player's worst nightmares.
Their resilience is continuously tested as the challenges escalate, featuring physical threats and psychological trickeries designed to erode hope.
With each breath, they uncover layers of trauma deeply embedded within themselves, and their survival hangs by these very revelations.
The climax is a brutal psychological battleground where they are forced to confront their deepest, darkest fears.
After countless spine-chilling confrontations and drained of emotional energy, only Max and Sarah stand defiantly against the horrors of the game.
Utilizing all the patterns they've analyzed and exploiting weaknesses they've identified, they successfully navigate to the game's final stage.
They've survived the terrifying journey imposed by 'Survival Mode', but at a cost that weighs heavy on their souls.
Eventually, Sarah, Max, and their remaining friends slowly try to pick up the pieces of their pre-pandemic lives.
The terror they endured is seared into their subconscious, leaving each of them with deep psychological scars that may never fully heal.
Their world is forever changed, having lost friends, confronted unspeakable horrors, and endured traumas far worse than their darkest nightmares.
Their eventual return to virtual college life manifests a fragile return to normalcy, even as the specter of 'Survival Mode' looms relentlessly over their lives.
Their bond deepens in this shared tragedy as they grapple with residual nightmares and endure the healing process together.
Just as they dare to dream of recovery, Sarah's peace is shattered; she receives another email, ominously introducing a new update of 'Survival Mode'.
The film concludes with a zoomed shot on Sarah's taut face suggesting that their nightmare may not have reached its conclusive end.

title: Academic Anatomy
synopsis: Dr. John Collins, a renowned anatomy professor at Harvard University, dutifully spends his days teaching the next generation of medical experts about the wondrous complexity of the human body.
His in-depth lectures and ground-breaking research papers focused on neurological functions earn him a well-deserved reputation in both the medical and academe's intellectual society.
However, despite his scholarly accomplishments, John battles intuition and emotion in his tumultuous relationship with his fiancé, the enigmatic Liz Hathaway.
Revered for her chilling, profound depiction of Lady Macbeth in Shakespeare's classic tragedy, Liz stands out as a remarkably gifted, albeit peculiar, theatre actress.

Delving deeper into his academic pursuits and their intricate personal relationship, John starts drawing eerie parallels between intricate anatomical illustrations in his lecture notes and Liz's macabre stage settings.
A profound chill runs up his spine when he recognizes realistic depictions of human hearts and lungs that serve as props in Liz's grim productions.
Soon, the quaint Boston townhouse they reside in starts to feel more like a haunted house, fraught with strange noises originating from Liz's basement rehearsal studio.
Alarmed by this unsettling transition, one night, John gathers his nerves and descends into Liz's world, her mysterious rehearsal space.
Instead of a traditional theatre workspace, he stumbles upon a realm that resembles a sinister anatomy lab, commandeered by a rogue surgeon.
Strewn about are haphazard anatomical sketches, uncannily realistic stage props, and an array of surgical tools, all hinting at a chilling narrative.
His grim discovery seeds in him suspicion of Liz and her theatrical team engaging in unspeakable activities, shaking him to his core.
As he spends more time in this dreadful environment, John discerns an appalling pattern woven through the madness.
Several of his brilliant anatomy students have started to disappear, each leaving a traceless absentee letter behind.
Struggling to make sense of this inexplicable correlation, John realizes his emotional turmoil over Liz is impeding his judgment, preventing him from unearthing the truth.
However, the blindfold of love is ruthlessly ripped away when the horrifying reality dawns upon him.
Liz, the woman he was meant to wed, has been stealing organs from his missing students, using them as morbidly accurate props in her grim productions.
This macabre truth sends ripples through his disillusioned perception, leaving him in a state of shock and dismay.
Liz's nonchalant confession that her vile acts are merely committed in the name of theatrical innovation renders John absolutely speechless.
Torn between shock and deep-seated fear, John can only watch as Liz meticulously creates a fortress of lies to protect herself and her secrets from the intellectual community they both belong to.
Deftly exploiting his vulnerable state, she convinces John that his recent revelations are hallucinations induced by stress.
This cruel manipulation launches a civil war in John's psyche, wrestling him between accepting a fabricated reality or fighting for the truth.
Despite the all-encompassing mental strife, John refuses to surrender to Liz's gaslighting.
Adhering to his scientific background, he meticulously starts gathering empirical data in secret, cataloging every sinister revelation as an indisputable fact.
A fierce struggle of truth and deception unfolds, tackled behind the veil of their decorated facade.
John, shouldered with immense love for Liz yet duty-bound to protect his unwitting students, resolves to confront her.
What ensues is a near-apocalyptic clash, closely resembling a Greek tragedy, unfolding within the confines of their townhouse.
This battle is not just for John; it's a desperate struggle for the lives of his unwitting students.
In a heroic act of academic and moral integrity, John stands against the world he knew, revealing Liz and her team's inhuman activities.
His initial revelations shake the porous grounds of the Harvard community; however, the subsequent police investigation serves as a disheartening validation of John's claims.
Though vindicated in his quest for truth, John remains emotionally battered and struggling to comprehend his victory over the woman he once hoped to marry.
In the drama-filled aftermath, the prestigious university sets on a path towards recovery and redemption.
To fill the void left by John, new appointments are hastily made as he withdraws from the stressful academia, opting for a quiet period to heal emotional wounds.
Just when the University begins its steady climb back to normalcy, the arrival of a new drama professor launches them into a tumultuous state.
The opening act of his maiden production eerily mirrors Liz's distinctive theatrical style, leaving the audience shaken.
This haunting similarity sends cautionary ripples through the community, leaving everyone who survived Liz's reign in a tense apprehension.
This suspense-laden atmosphere marks the end of the movie, leaving the audience on a nail-biting cliffhanger.
The unanswered question regarding the new faculty member's motivations looms harshly, making everyone question whether the University is doomed to relive its horrific past.
In the post-credit scene, the camera follows the new drama professor stepping into a rehearsal room that oddly resembles the one previously commanded by Liz.
As the echoes of Liz's notorious past rise again, a chilling teaser is set in motion about the horrors that might revisit the Harvard community.

As the screen dissolves into a foreboding darkness, the audience finds themselves ensnared in the chilling possibilities of the future, questioning the fate that awaits the students under the new professor's supremacy.

title: Swim to Destiny: The Endurance of a Female Athlete (film)
synopsis: Opening in 1980, the film establishes the resolute character of Helen, our protagonist.

She is introduced as a 12-year-old virtuoso of swimming, hard at work as she trains to attempt an extraordinarily grueling aquatic endeavor - an unprecedented 110-mile swim starting in Cuba and ending in Key West, Florida.
Providing a glimpse into her invincible spirit, we view Helen dedicatedly pushing her boundaries in training.
As someone who breathes, lives, and dreams swimming, Helen is steadfast in her commitment to accomplishing this seemingly insurmountable task.
The historic day eventually dawns, but contrary to the usually welcoming Caribbean sunshine, the sky dons a brooding grey - ominous storm clouds converging.
Yet, undaunted and embodying the spirit of true sportsmanship, Helen plunges into the troubled waters.
Her courage and endurance are concessionaire, but coupled with the escalating severity of the storm, they become insufficient.
Unlike her unyielding spirit, her body hinders her from proceeding, and she's forced to abort the swim midway.
An engulfing sense of fatigue, disappointment, and dashed dreams meet her as she returns to the Havana shoreline.
Jumping to 2010; a tremendous shift sees the once indefatigable child athlete transformed into an eighty-year-old, lively grandmother.
Helen is now a master storyteller, narrating her youthful adventures to her eight captivated grandchildren.
On one such afternoon, her words weaving another tale from the past, she accidentally locates old goggles gathering dust.
Gripped by a wave of nostalgia, she revisits her unfinished journey.
Feeding off her grandkids' relentless cheer and unyieldly faith in her capabilities, Helen contemplates an extraordinary decision: to pick up where she left off thirty years ago.
Her decision, understandably, invites varied reactions - shock, worry, and admiration from different corners of her life.
Even against explicit advice, Helen remains immovable, resolute about realizing her dream.
Armed with renewed determination, Helen immerses herself back in training; her mission carrying a profound meaning: personal redemption and fulfillment of a long-forgotten pledge.
In her audacious pursuit, she comes crossways with a group of ambitious athletes.
A special bond forms with a fiery 25-year-old triple Ironman champion.
The young athlete's grit feeds Helen's diligence, fueling her effort, their camaraderie serving as a consistent source of encouragement to constantly push her limits.
The night preceding the swim bears witness to a nerve-racking confrontation between Helen and her worried son.
The son's concerns heighten as he pleads with Helen, underlining the potential threats she is likely to encounter amidst the fickle ocean tides.
Conflicts intensify as Helen and her son bicker over her decision, exposing deep-seated family issues that have lain dormant for too long.
The day of her audacious attempt arrives, and without flinching, Helen immerses herself in the vast stretch of the Atlantic.
Her strokes lead her against the current, fighting the intimidating waves across 110 miles.
Hour after hour slides by as if stuck in an infinite loop.
As tensions wax and wane, Helen, undeterred, continues to slay her burdens, one determined stroke at a time.
The climax approaches.
A weary yet unwavering Helen is seen nearing the Key West shore.
Utterly drained yet fueled by an insurmountable will to compete, Helen powers through the last miles.
Then, the moment they'd all been waiting for arrives.
Although breathless and worn, Helen finally reaches her destination, her fingertips grazing the sandy beaches of Key West.
Stumbling onto the shore, she's swept up in a warm, ecstatic embrace by her grandchildren.
Clasping her grandchildren in a victorious hug, Helen stands strong — a hero, basking in the glory of her brave journey.
Her quest unites the family, long ridden with strife and misunderstanding.
Their hearts swell with respect for their matriarch who proved that nothing is unattainable, even at her advancing age.
Overwhelmed with emotions, Helen chokes up, her heart resonating with pride at the sight of her loved ones looking at her with admiration.
The dream she nurtured has finally been realized.

title: Cagefighter: Worlds Collide
synopsis: Reiss Gibbons is the greatest fighter to ever participate in the MMA promotion Legends.
He is a 5-time champion and has just come off a win which has him and his manager Reggie (Elijah Baker) feeling on top of the world with waves of endorsement deals and movie offers.

Legends owner Max Black (Gina Gershon) wants to book another fight for Reiss where she reveals to MMA talk show host Stephen Drake that she has decided to put Reiss against pro wrestling star Randy Stone (Jonathan Good).
Drake and the whole MMA community including Reiss and his wife Ellie think this is a publicity stunt and that Stone will not succeed like all wrestlers who transition to MMA too soon.

The hype however attracts a large audience with professional wrestlers Matt Hardy, Tommy Dreamer, and Bubba Ray Dudley defending Stone and professional wrestling organisations claiming Stone will beat Reiss and prove everyone wrong.
A press conference is held but ends in disaster when Stone's trash talk against Reiss and his wife angers Reiss and nearly starts a fight.
The fight begins the next day and the two finally collide.
Reiss proves at first to be the better fighter due to his experience and techniques where as Stone throws wild punches and is too inexperienced.
Much to everyone, including Reiss' shock, Stone proves to be tougher than he looks and Reiss' overconfidence and showboating gets the best of him.
Stone is able to get Reiss up on the cage using dirty boxing techniques his trainer Danny Thickett (Leo Fafard) used in his heyday and easily picks Reiss up for takedowns.
The match ends in a huge upset and after hitting Reiss with one punch, Stone delivers a devastating uppercut which knocks Reiss unconscious.
Reiss awakens but is concussed and confuses the referee for Stone attempting to wrestle him.
The referee stops him and informs the match is over and Stone has won the title.
Reiss is humiliated by the match with many of his fans now making memes of him crying during the loss and even having his movie deals revoked.
Angry and wanting revenge, he makes Reggie ask Max for a rematch, but Max states she can't.

Due to Stone having difficulty cutting weight for the Light-Heavyweight division, Max has moved him to the Heavyweight division instead to challenge for the title, but she offers Reiss to fight young and hungry newcomer Nightmare.
Reggie along with Reiss' trainer and friend Marcus (Chuck Liddell) refuse the fight due to the danger of Nightmare's size and Reiss' impatience.
Reiss decides to take the fight anyhow and abandons Marcus to train with LA trainer Tony Gunn (Luke Rockhold).
Training proves difficult, with little time to prepare and difficulty cutting weight Reiss ends up two pounds over the limit and has to forfeit 20% of his fight earnings for violating weight cut.

The fight begins and Reiss loses again to Nightmare in a embarrassing manner angering Tony with the crowd and Stone who was in attendance during the fight laughing at Reiss for his lackluster fighting.
Reiss decides to retire having his confidence destroyed and his desire to fight having been quashed.

He attempts to live peacefully with his wife but his bank accounts are in the red due to his frivolous spending, bad endorsement deals, and paying for Tony's training camp which he wasted losing the fight.
Humiliated and at rock bottom, Reiss sells one of his championship belts to stay afloat.
Reggie returns to offer another fight but Reiss declines having now become afraid to fight again and emotionally breaks down in front of his wife.
Reggie tracks down Max where he begs for a rematch but Max again refuses, not wanting to waste money or damage Reiss' reputation any further.

On Drake's podcast while being interviewed about who's going to fight Stone for the title after his opponent was forced to retire due to brain damage, Max gives in and says she will arrange a rematch for Reiss and Stone.
Reiss and his camp are happy to hear this and after making amends with Marcus they start training again.

The rematch begins and Stone is dominant most of the fight, even tearing Reiss' groin during a failed triangle choke on the latter's part and swelling up Reiss’ left eye after performing an illegal headbutt.
Refusing to give up and wanting to prove he's not afraid anymore and that he can still fight, Reiss holds out till the final round.
He finally gains momentum when he catches Stone in a guillotine headlock leading to a rear-naked choke on the ground.
Stone refuses to tap and Reiss won't let go resulting in Reiss winning the match after Stone passes out from the hold.
Reiss is the new Heavyweight champion and he and Stone earn each other's respect with Stone offering to buy him a drink during their next rematch.
Reiss celebrates with his wife and friends while Max gives an interview about Reiss' victory and future.

title: The Silencing
synopsis: Alcoholic Rayburn Swanson is the owner of the Gwen Swanson Sanctuary, named after his missing daughter.
The sanctuary is an act of penance, both because Gwen disapproved of his trapper lifestyle and because she had disappeared from his car five years earlier while he went into a store to buy whiskey.
Rayburn keeps hunters out by using surveillance cameras.
Sheriff Alice Gustafson is the sister of a troubled young man, Brooks.
While examining the body of a young girl found by a lake, Alice notices a scar on the girl's throat, along with the point of a spear-head (marked with an “MB”) buried in a tree.
After learning about the body, Rayburn arrives to make a positive ID, but it is not Gwen.
Alice learns that the spear was used with a rare weapon known as an atlatl.
Rayburn sees a man in a ghillie suit stalking the woods; when Rayburn attempts to confront the man, he is wounded by a thrown spear.
While fleeing, he comes across a black pickup truck with the license plates removed.
He marks the truck by scratching a small 'x' on the fender.
After returning home and stitching his wound, he reviews his surveillance footage and observes a girl being hunted in the sanctuary by the same man.
Rayburn returns to the sanctuary and rescues the girl, Molly, then keeps her safe in an unused spike trap overnight.
She was rendered mute, having a throat scar similar to the one on the dead girl.
They make it back to the cabin the next evening but are ambushed by the hunter.
The hunter injures Rayburn and stabs Molly with a spear.
Alice arrives and, after seeing that Molly has been stabbed, immediately suspects Rayburn, until the hunter appears behind her.
Still disguised, his mannerisms cause her to believe it is her brother.
Alice shoots Rayburn, wounding him, and causing him to flee so that her brother can escape.
Alice searches for Rayburn and steps on a bear trap he had set, injuring her ankle.
He escapes in her patrol car and calls an ambulance for Molly; Alice calls for Rayburn's arrest.
He flees to the home of his former wife, Debbie, and her husband, Karl Blackhawk, Sheriff of the local Indian tribal police.
They take him to the "Factory", an abandoned mill where the homeless stay, and call Dr. Jon Boone to treat him.
Brooks coincidentally arrives and is arrested by Karl, although he has an alibi to establish his innocence.
Alice, realizing her moral failure, promises Molly, now hospitalized, that she will catch the killer.
She also noticed the same throat scar on Molly.
Rayburn decides to clean up and throw out his liquor, except for the still unopened bottle he bought on the day Gwen had gone missing.
He remembers the marked truck and locates it.
After breaking into a house, he finds the same weapons and clothes worn by the killer, along with a trove of "missing" posters, including one for his daughter.
After finding a still-living girl under a sheet with her throat surgically cut open, the killer appears and captures Rayburn by knocking him unconscious.
Alice notices issues with the autopsy report by Dr. Boone.
While waiting for him in his office, she sees a photo of the doctor with his daughter Melissa wearing a necklace with the initials "MB".
Alice realizes that Boone is the killer and immediately calls for backup to raid Boone's home; the same home Rayburn had found.

Boone explains to Rayburn that while grieving his own daughter, who had been killed by a drunk driver, he began kidnapping and killing teen girls to "save" them from bad parents, including Rayburn; he operates on the larynx so they cannot call for help while being hunted.
Boone takes Rayburn to the wildlife sanctuary and forces him to flee so that he can be hunted.
Alice sees Rayburn on the surveillance.
Rayburn overpowers Boone and is beating him severely as Alice arrives; she attempts to stop Rayburn, but he ignores her and throws Boone into one of the spike traps, mortally wounding him.
Alice looks on as Rayburn closes the doctor in, telling her that they are even (he had lied earlier, saying the intruder shot him instead of Alice).
She later sits in a patrol car, listening to the radio about the ongoing manhunt for Dr Boone.
Rayburn and his ex-wife have a funeral for Gwen, which Molly attends, providing him closure.
He then empties his last bottle of whisky into the lake in memory of his daughter.

title: Californian Struggles
synopsis: The story unveils the life of Jane Smith, a 36-year-old single mother residing in San Diego, California.
She is a strong-willed mother who has dedicated her existence to her daughter, Ava, a vivacious eight-year-old girl whose life is marred by epilepsy.
The narrative sensitively weaves the details of Jane's taxing daily routine.
Despite her work's exhaustive nature, Jane does not allow her tired body to overshadow her love for Ava.
At the school, Ava faces a lonely corner.
Her peers label her as the 'epileptic girl', openly excluding her from their gatherings.
The mother and daughter duo live in a small handmade house in a garage, which is a part of Jane's estranged brother Mike’s property.
Jane's life takes a dramatic turn as Ava's epileptic spells become more severe.

Determined to help her daughter, Jane dives into exploring every avenue concerning epilepsy, consulting several renowned neurologists and experimenting with varied treatment options to ensure Ava's wellbeing.
However, this hope dies down almost as quickly when she discovers the jaw-dropping price of the drug.
Jane's spirit shatters further when she realizes that this miraculous drug isn't covered under their current health insurance policy.
Driven by her motherly instincts, Jane dares to challenge her 550 credit score, attempting to secure a loan for Ava's treatment.
To her dismay, her poor credit rating slams the doors of every bank she approaches.
Meanwhile, Ava’s deteriorating health adds fuel to the fire of her schoolmates’ bullying.
Ava, in a bid to save her mother from more stress, decides to bear this insult in silence.
A chance overhearing of Ava relating a bullying incident to her friend over a phone call forces Jane to confront the school administration.
Amidst the whirlwind of her life, an unexpected opportunity presents itself.
A local singing competition, 'San Diego Sings' announces a cash prize of $50,000.
Jane decides to gamble on this competition.
She throws herself in to chase this opportunity, even at the risk of losing her evening job, driven by the zeal to better Ava's condition.
A few days into her decision, her commitment to the competition results in her losing her job at the laundromat.
The loss of income exacerbates her financial troubles, locking her and Ava in a deep pit of desolation.
Amid Jane's career struggle, Ava suffers a terrifyingly large seizure, worst than any they've experienced before.
This unfortunately well-timed incident fuels Jane's determination to win the competition for Ava.
A heated argument ensues between Mike and Jane after this incident - Mike advocates for practicality, insisting on a cheaper, affordable treatment for Ava.
Jane, however, is adamant about securing the new drug - a situation that strains their previously neutral relationship.
A fallout follows their argument, the disagreement driving a wedge between Jane and Mike.
Channeling her resolution and energy, Jane dives into rigorous vocal training, giving the upcoming singing competition her all.
Ava's suffering becomes her driving force.
Seeing her mother’s relentless efforts from the sidelines, Ava gathers the courage to confront her bullies in school.
The thought of not adding more problems for Jane empowers her resolve.
Witnessing Jane's ferocious efforts from afar, Mike is hit by a wave of guilt.
Baffled by his realizations, Mike steps up, offering to help with Ava's care responsibilities.

Together, they ensure Ava is well maintained and taken care of, freeing Jane from her constant worry about Ava’s wellbeing and enabling her to concentrate solely on her preparations for the competition.
The day of the 'San Diego Sings' competition arrives, with Jane's fate and Ava's future resting heavily on her performance.
Against various seasoned competitors, Jane sings her heart out on stage.
Her voice rings out with courage and raw prowess, charming the judges and ultimately winning her the competition.
The victory promises more than just solving Ava's medical needs.
Her voice earns her a full-time position as a music teacher at a local community center.
On immediately receiving the prize money, Jane procures the revolutionary 'Epilexir' for Ava.
The drug starts to work its magic, showing an immediate effect in controlling Ava’s seizures.
With an stabilised financial situation and Ava’s consistent health, Jane’s previously riddled life appears to fall into place.
Ava’s physical improvement leads to her social improvement.
The reduced seizure frequency allows her to form friendships and significantly improve her social health at school.
With a steady income flowing in and an effective treatment plan at hand for Ava, a new chapter of hope and happiness begins in their lives as they leave their nightmarish past behind.
Jane is seen indulging herself in her music teaching job, juggling between her work and efficiently managing Ava's medical needs with ease and satisfaction.
Mike, along with Jane and Ava, forms a perfectly integrated family unit, nurtured through shared struggles and successes, fostering unbreakable trust and love.
Their journey even spurred change in Ava's former tormentors, their transformation indicating the impact of empathy and kindness.

title: Epic Odyssey (2022 film)
synopsis: Jerry and Hassan, two top-tier students at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, stand out among their peers due to their brilliance in their chosen fields of physics and maths.
In their quest for knowledge, they delve into the deep-seated lore and traditions of MIT.
They unearth details about the long-forgotten "Mythical Expedition" — a test of mental agility and strategic acumen.
Captivated by the challenge and novelty of the expedition, Jerry and Hassan decide to embark on this intellectual adventure.
They meticulously engineer a strategy, tracing the shortest possible pathways on campus maps and synchronizing their navigation between the sororities down to the last minute.
Sigma Phi, the first sorority house on their list, stands as grand Victorian-style house.
Jerry and Hassan impress the sorority members with their brilliant minds and engaging personas, attracting praise and admiration.
Their confidence is high until they reach the stately Beta Xi sorority, where they unknowingly reignite a dormant feud between the residents of Beta Xi and a rival sorority house.
A casual remark about a controversial historical event sparks a fiercely heated debate between the members of the two groups, transforming their evening adventure into a fiery confrontation.
Jerry and Hassan, taken by surprise, are unable to pacify the escalating conflict they inadvertently ignited.
Amidst the escalating discord, MIT security steps in, escorting the duo off the premises while raising concerns about their motives for kickstarting their expedition.
Overwhelmed by the unforeseen repercussion of their adventure, Jerry and Hassan retreat to their usual study nook to engage in a deep and introspective reflection.
They critically evaluate their hasty decision-making and explore the genuine reasons for embarking on such a demanding test of their intellect.
An unexpected ray of hope shines their way when Claire, the diplomatic peacemaker from the feuding Beta Xi house, approaches them.

Understanding the complex situation they've found themselves in, Claire uses thoughtful words of encouragement to convince Jerry and Hassan to continue their quest, but with a more refined sense of empathy and compassion.
Inspired by Claire, Jerry and Hassan, armed with a renewed determination, return to the feuding sororities with intentions to rectify their mistake.
They use tactful negotiation and carefully chosen words to mediate the dispute between the rival groups, slowly soothing the tensions and restoring peace.
Their genuine remorse fosters respect among the previously offended sisters, facilitating their continued progress on the expedition.
With newfound humility, Jerry and Hassan confidently proceed with their quest, ensuring they respect each tradition and preserve harmony throughout the night.
After an exhaustive but enlightening night, Jerry and Hassan finally arrive at the renowned Kappa Omega house.
As they cross the finish line, a jubilant celebration erupts.
Each cheer from the jubilant crowd serves as a testament to the epic journey they had bravely undertaken.
Their story reverberates around MIT, being shared as a modern rendition of the "Mythical Expedition."
In the following academic years, tales of their quest become integral parts of the freshmen orientation, narrated to inspire each new batch of students about the value of unity.
Humbly acknowledging their impact, Jerry and Hassan take time to reflect on their journey, appreciating their failures, and admiring their triumphs.
As they stand on the podium amidst thunderous applause from their fellow students and faculty, the magnitude of their achievement begins to sink in.
What started as a curious exploration of an old campus tradition, transformed into a pioneering initiative which bolstered unity across the diverse campus community.
In the aftermath, the MIT campus experiences a newfound sense of harmony.
The past rivalries and feuds amongst the seven sororities are nothing more than folklores now — replaced by mutual respect and understanding.
As they survey the campus from their watchtower on Massachusetts Avenue, they realize that their actions fostered respect and unity in an intricate blend.
The students of MIT, inspired by their relentless perseverance, chant Jerry and Hassan" as an affirmation of their admiration.
As they stand against the backdrop of the Great Dome, they overlook the transformed campus with a sense of pride and a hint of responsibility.
The movie concludes with the echo of their hopeful laughter rippling through the campus, symbolizing a bright future for every student at MIT, where unity and mutual respect reign supreme."

title: Quest for Survival: The Dawn Seekers (2022 film)
synopsis: Our film opens on the majestic panorama of the ancient land of Nowanus, a vast, desolate desert; so barren that life is little more than a struggle, yet resilient in its refusal to bow to the harsh elements.
The camera finds a family, a band of six hominids, living amongst this rugged land.
We are introduced to the eldest amongst them, a rugged individual named Tork.
The tribe has traditions, one of which we see during an elaborate ceremony under the clear night sky.
This vision details a grand journey, one leading towards the coy blush of the dawn’s horizon.
Encouraged by this great prophecy, the tribe sets forth, venturing from the familiarity of their home, placing their unwavering trust in their leader's revelation.
Their journey is a grueling one.
After days of relentless travel, their journey ends as they come upon a landscape that is as stunning as it is unexpected.
But their joy is short-lived as they notice something out of place upon this beautiful beachfront - an enormous, ancient fossil.
They aptly name it 'The Leviathan', the fossil of a sea creature so large and fearsome, they could only imagine it as a beast of cataclysmic proportions.
Their initial jubilation swiftly gives way to anxiety as they begin to fathom the complexities and potential dangers their new home presents.
Yet, they persist.
They may have arrived with uncertainty, but they resolve to make this unanticipated land of golden sand and limitless water their home.
They brace themselves for the unknown, armed only with their experience and instinct.
They acclimatize themselves to the coastal life, building sturdier shelters from driftwood, and making a collective effort to settle into this new land.
However, the peace is short-lived as they uncover the existence of another tribe living beyond their sight, beyond the horizon.
Soon, strange occurrences persistently plague the tribe.
These unsettling happenings slowly transform their serene beachfront life into a haunting riddle.
Confronted with these mysterious occurrences, Tork and the wise elders put their heads together.
With this revelation, the tribe is faced with two choices.
Flee and risk meeting another beast of unknown terror, or confront their fears and claim their future.
Tork, standing tall and resolute, suggests brokering peace with the unseen tribe.
He proposes that by facing this threat together, they have a better chance of surviving.
With survival as their common goal, the tribes put their differences aside and look towards a future of unity.
Together, they engineer an intricate strategy to confront the sea beast and reclaim their lives.
The day of the decisive battle arrives, and Tork leads the charge against the monstrous Leviathan.
Tork, drawing upon every ounce of his strength and courage, plunges his stone spear into the leviathan.
Their tribal chants shift to triumphant cheers as the formidable sea creature recoils, thrashing about in confusion and pain before sinking back into the sea's dark expanse.
The euphoria of victory is jarringly interrupted as the monstrous creature resurfaces, causing uproar and panic.
But the beast, shell-shocked by the attack, retreats into the deeper waters, shying away from the land.
It becomes evident that the Leviathan is more of a startled herbivore than a macabre predator.
It was a creature of survival, much like themselves.
The tribes, having gained a semblance of understanding of the Leviathan, decide to replace confrontation with coexistence.
They choose to live in harmony with the Leviathan, marking a significant step in their survival journey.
Both tribes accept and decide to inhabit the land together under the principle of mutual respect and unity.
Tork and the leader of the unseen tribe come to an understanding, agreeing to refrain from provoking the Leviathan and to live harmoniously in their newfound home.
The two tribes, initially rooted in basic survival needs, now transition into a life of collaboration and shared community responsibilities.
Amidst this newfound unity and peace, the sound of children's laughter and shouts of excitement fills the air, painting a lively tableau of everyday life along the serene coastline.
With the dawn of each day comes the humbling realization that their journey towards the rising sun was symbolic of their societal evolution.
Tork comprehends that his prophecy was about more than mere survival.
It was a pilgrimage towards unity, coexistence, and progression as a societal unit amidst trials, hardship, and fear.
The tribes have now evolved from a hardy survivalist lifestyle and graduated into a compassionate community, strengthening bonds and nurturing shared dreams.
They were now more than hunters.
They were lovers, friends, family.
These shared moments of joy, laughter, and camaraderie sculpted their society into a robust, unified tribe.
The sun rises from the horizon, its radiant dawn kissing their land with the promise of a new day.
The sun, which once guided their desperate search for a better home, now signifies the enduring unity and harmony achieved by this resolute tribe.
The tribes now understand that unity not only ensured survival but also paved the way for peace, prosperity, and societal progression.
Together, under the wide azure sky, they vow to live peacefully, fostering shared happiness and residing harmoniously amidst the picturesque landscape.
Their unity turns into a footprint for what was to be followed by the generations to come.
The tribes, once fractured by the struggle of survival, now present a united front.
They had not just survived but thrived amidst the trials, fear, and adversity.
The film concludes on an uplifted note, leaving the audience with a sunlit landscape resonating with laughter and celebratory dances.

title: Amulet (film)
synopsis: Ex-soldier, Tomaz, unearths an amulet at an outpost in the woods.
It becomes apparent that this is where he was stationed in his former country, which he eventually escaped to make it to London.
Tomaz periodically has flashbacks to this time and Mirian, a woman who took shelter with him after he spared her life when he caught her trying to pass the border.
In London Tomaz works as a day laborer while sleeping in a derelict building with other refugees.
When the building is set on fire, Tomaz is forced to flee suddenly in the night.
Unable to breathe from the smoke, he collapses in an alley way and is discovered by Sister Claire, a nun.

After visiting him in the hospital she suggests a better way of life for him and takes him to a house, explaining that a woman living there, Magda, needs help with the house upkeep as she cares for her dying mother.
As she walks away, she is seen throwing Tomaz's money (which he thought lost) into the sewer.
Magda makes it clear she doesn't want Tomaz there and he too is reluctant to stay.
However the two grow accustomed to one another and Tomaz tries to perform repairs.
When trying to fix the water pipes Tomaz discovers a live albino bat clogging the toilet.
He kills it, but not before it bites him.
Tomaz eventually sees Magda's mother, whom she keeps imprisoned in the attic.
Though she is extremely ill she attacks Magda in front of Tomaz and he becomes protective of her.
He takes her out on the town, fulfilling her wish to go out dancing all night if she was free.
Later on, returning home Magda and Tomaz see her mother giving birth to one of the bat like creatures he sees on the toilet.
Tomaz goes to consult Sister Claire, and she tells him that the mother is a demon and that she and Magda have been charged with keeping it contained for years.
Tomaz returns to the house, determined to kill the demon and save Magda.
However after stabbing the demon in the throat it bites and attacks Tomaz only to be stopped by Magda.
Tomaz then flashes back to his time with Miriam.
Developing a crush on her he urges her to stay with him until the end of the war and protects her from fellow soldiers.
However after discovering her trying to leave in an attempt to reunite with her daughter, he chases her and rapes her.
Awakening in the house, Tomaz, determined to protect Magda, returns and attacks the demon.
Once he beheads it he realizes that the host body was actually that of the previous occupant of the house, a man who murdered his wife with the intent to marry one of his own children.
Sister Claire explains that he is now the new host and asks him who he wants to be his guardian.
He demands that Magda watch over him.
Later, Tomaz is sick.
As his stomach begins to move, he too gives birth to one of the creatures.
Later, Magda drives up to a convenience store where Miriam is working the counter.
After making sure that Miriam is all right she drives off and throws some food in the back where Tomaz is hiding under a blanket.

title: Good Burger 2
synopsis: 26 years after the events of the first film, Dexter Reed has quit Good Burger in the hopes of becoming a successful entrepreneur, but his invention ideas turn out to be failures.

His latest invention, a spray that can make any material flame-retardant, backfires as he attempts to showcase the material on his own house in a demonstration for investors, including Mark Cuban, that ends up burning it down.
Left without a home and business, Dexter looks to move in with his sister Charlotte, but she refuses as she is one of his investors.
He then calls Ed, who still works at Good Burger and agrees to let him stay at his home.

Dexter visits Good Burger to find numerous new employees: two twins Cindy and Mindy; the elderly Ruth; Ed's son Ed 2, who looks and acts exactly like Ed; and Dexter's niece Mia, Charlotte's daughter who wants nothing to do with Dexter.
The restaurant has a new manager named Mr. Jensen.
In addition to working as the cashier, Ed is now the owner due to his love of the restaurant.
The only familiar employee is Fizz, whom Ed had accidentally left in the freezer for 22 years and is thawed out.
At Ed's home, Dexter meets Ed's family: his wife Edie and their numerous other children who look like Ed and are named after condiments.
Dexter is shocked to find that Roxanne, who previously tried to seduce Ed for the recipe for his sauce for Mondo Burger, now works as their nanny.
Dexter decides to work at Good Burger again while considering his next entrepreneurial venture.
When he pitches his permanent ice idea to Mia, she laughs it off.
Meanwhile, Ed has been hounded by Cecil McNevin, a lawyer for the conglomerate MegaCorp, to turn Good Burger into a global franchise, but Ed is uncertain.
MegaCorp sends a pair of goons to force Ed into signing the agreement, but Ed's natural clumsiness gets them hurt.
Cecil tries to appeal to Dexter, explaining their intent is to expand Good Burger but not to take it away from Ed and are planning to give the employees big raises.
Dexter considers it based on the financial benefit and then brings Ed to lunch with Cecil to explain the deal and they both agree to sign.

At the franchise launch party, Cecil reveals that the flagship store is being shut down with their employees being fired as mandated by the contract, which Dexter and Ed had failed to read before signing.
With everyone turning against Dexter, he takes Ed to MegaCorp headquarters to demand they reinstate the flagship restaurant and rehire the employees.
They meet with the CEO Katt Bozwell, the sister of former Mondo Burger owner Kurt Bozwell who wants revenge on Good Burger after sending Kurt away to prison.
She is planning to rebrand the restaurant Mega Good Burger and has plans to replace all employees with robot versions of Ed.
After destroying the Good Burger car, MegaCorp sends them home in a self-driving delivery car which Katt sends out of control to get rid of them.
Dexter forces the car to drive in a circle until it runs out of power.
Lamenting his failures, Dexter gets Ed to rally the Good Burger employees to stop the launch of Mega Good Burger.
They plan to infiltrate MegaCorp headquarters so Mia, a computer expert, can shut down the machines before the launch.
While Dexter, Ed, and Mia infiltrate the building, the other employees create a distraction, but their ruse is uncovered.
Dexter and Ed get separated from Mia and find the control room while Mia is trapped on a conveyor belt.
Dexter goes off to find Mia, leaving Ed to shut down the restaurants.
Dexter saves Mia, but they are captured and taken to the control room where Ed is also taken.
As Katt gives the first demonstration on national television, the robotic Ed throws food at her, followed by the other machines shooting food at everyone at every location around the world.
Ed had decided reprogramming the machines to go haywire would be better.
In the aftermath, MegaCorp is shut down and Ed is given back ownership of the original Good Burger.
Charlotte comes to visit Dexter and Mia and Dexter is allowed to apologize to her.
Ed and Ed 2 reveal to Dexter that they figured out how to make permanent ice and Good Burger successfully sells it to Mark Cuban, making $10,000,000.

title: Big George Foreman
synopsis: A young George Foreman lives in poverty in Houston, Texas with his siblings and his religious mother Nancy.
Foreman, however, is riddled with anger issues and violent outbursts.
As a young adult, Foreman barely evades arrest for mugging and decides to join the Job Corps as a last-ditch effort to turn his life around.
There, he befriends his roommate Desmond Baker, however his violent outbursts nearly get him expelled.
However, the Job Corps' chairman Doc Broadus, a boxing trainer, encourages Foreman to take up boxing and channel his rage into the sport instead of fighting.
Foreman proves to be gifted in the sport and after one year of boxing, he wins the gold medal for the United States against Jonas Čepulis at the 1968 Summer Olympics.

He moves to Oakland, California to train, where former champions Dick Sadler and Archie Moore join his team as trainers, and he meets journalist Paula, whom he starts a relationship with and eventually marries.
Doc, Paula and Desmond are by his side as Foreman's career flourishes, ultimately winning a fight against Joe Frazier in 1973 and becoming the heavyweight champion.
Following his win, Foreman hires Desmond to handle his finances.
Foreman's career enables him to live lavishly, however he regularly cheats on Paula with other women and he is dismissive over his mother's attribution of his successes as blessings from God.
Foreman is heavily taunted by Muhammad Ali, whom he fights at The Rumble in the Jungle in 1974, where he loses his belt due to Ali's rope-a-dope strategy.
Foreman fires Sadler and Moore, and Paula divorces Foreman due to his infidelity.
Following an embarrassing Foreman vs. Five match where he is further mocked by Ali, he is called to the hospital where his sister Mary's newborn baby is in poor health.
Witnessing his family praying for the baby, Foreman goes outside and angrily prays to God for a sign, offering himself instead of the baby's life.
The baby is miraculously saved, and Mary names her son after her brother.

After losing to Jimmy Young in 1977, Foreman suffers from a heatstroke and collapses from exhaustion, having near-death experience where he finds himself in a place of nothingness and says that he finally believes before waking up.
He becomes a devout Christian and disavows boxing to become a full-time preacher, much to the delight of Nancy and the disappointment of Doc.
He makes amends with Ali and Paula for his past behavior towards them.
At church, he meets and pursues a relationship with fellow believer Mary Joan Martelly.
Years later, Foreman has married Mary Joan and started a family with her.
He is a preacher at the Church of the Lord Jesus Christ, and opened a youth community center to help troubled youth.
However, in 1985, he realizes the center is in danger of being closed down after finding out he is in debt due to Desmond mishandling his funds.
Nancy tells him that despite losing everything, all he needs is already inside him, and he decides to forgive Desmond after confronting him.
Foreman's attempts capitalize on his earlier fame is not enough to save the center.
He reluctantly decides to return to boxing to earn money, and with Mary Joan and Doc's encouragement, he trains to get back in shape and decides to start his career again from the bottom.
Rejecting his prior rage for a more positive outlook, Foreman manages to win several fights and enters a match against Evander Holyfield.
Although he loses to Holyfield, the payments from the fight - as well as a profitable deal involving grills - are enough to pay his debts and reopen the center.
He works his way up to a match against reigning champion Michael Moorer, which he wins and regains his title as heavyweight champion of the world.
Foreman reflects that he had to be knocked down to the bottom to realize everything he was searching for was already there.

An epilogue shares that Foreman had become close friends with Ali; Doc was inducted in the World Boxing Hall of Fame in 1998; and Foreman continues to preach at his church and run his youth center in Houston.

title: Kids vs. Aliens
synopsis: Searching for a place to host a Halloween party, teenagers Billy, Dallas, and Trish bully young friends Gary, Jack, and Miles while the kids film a homemade fantasy movie with Gary's older sister Samantha in a barn.
Billy only stops harassing the boys when he seemingly takes an interest in Sam, who becomes enamored with Billy.
Gary breaks his arm while recording a wrestling scene for the movie.

Due to Gary getting injured on her watch, the duo's rich parents ground Sam before leaving the siblings home alone  in the movie so she can start pursuing a more adult persona that might impress Billy.
Billy harasses the three friends once more when he comes to see Sam.
Secretly wooing her so he can use the house for his party, Billy pretends to appreciate Sam's interests in action figures and wrestling.
Sam and Billy start making out on her bed, but are interrupted by the boys when they burst in to harass Billy.
The boys are then interrupted by a loud noise and lights outside, which Sam dismisses as another one of Gary's pranks.
Sam calls her brother a loser and tells him to “grow up.” Billy convinces Sam to host a Halloween party while her parents are away by claiming he wants to show her off as his new girlfriend.
While Gary, Jack, and Miles secretly spy on the festivities using a drone camera, Billy and his friends intentionally trash the house.
Sam tries to kick out the disrespectful partygoers, which causes Billy to become physically threatening with her.
Gary, Jack, and Miles interrupt the party by hijacking the TV to broadcast a message calling out Sam for changing her personality to appeal to Billy.
Gary also shows footage of Billy making fun of Sam to Trish before urinating all over Sam's bedroom, which brings Sam to tears.
Billy grabs the boys from their hiding spot and brings them out to be beaten in front of everyone.
Alien creatures previously seen attacking three fishermen aboard a boat suddenly burst into the house.
Partygoers flee while Gary, Jack, Miles, Billy, Dallas, and Trish are captured.
Sam avoids capture by barricading herself in her bedroom.
Once the coast is clear, Sam dons a scuba suit that she uses to swim underwater to the alien spaceship submerged in the lake behind her house.
After sneaking into the craft, Sam witnesses the aliens using a slime pit to melt Trish, which Gary later theorizes is how the aliens create fuel for their ship.
Another type of slime mutates Dallas into a creature with bladed claws.
Armed with an unusual sword she found, Sam slays several aliens to rescue her brother before he can be slimed.
With Dallas pursuing him, Billy steals the scuba suit to save himself and return to the surface.
Sam still escapes with the three boys by having everyone hold their breath before resurfacing.
Sam, Gary, Jack, and Miles return to the house to discover Billy locked himself safely inside.
Dallas still breaks through a window to resume his pursuit of Billy while Sam and the boys escape on their bicycles.
In between more alien encounters, Gary and Sam reconcile.
Sam, Gary, Jack, and Miles seek shelter in the barn where they had been filming their movie.
Billy, who also went to the barn to hide, suddenly takes Sam hostage with her sword.
The three boys attack Billy so Sam can get free, but Billy gravely wounds Jack by thrusting the sword through his stomach.
While Miles tends to Jack, Dallas's sudden arrival scatters Billy, Sam, and Gary.
Dallas ultimately kills Billy before the siblings finally defeat Dallas.
A tractor beam from the alien ship starts pulling Gary into the sky.
Acting on a suggestion from Jack, Miles lights a fireworks rig that the friends built for their film's grand finale.
The rig gets sucked into the sky too, and its subsequent explosion destroys the ship and saves Gary.
With Jack barely clinging to life, Sam, Gary, and Miles start rushing him to safety until more aliens surround them.
Armed soldiers from an unknown organization suddenly kill all of the creatures with automatic weapons.
Unexpectedly, the soldiers then retrieve the sword, take the kids captive, and transport them to a secret location where they are put in stasis, until another spaceship arrives.

In a post-credits scene, Another alien came into Sam and Gary's destroyed house until their parents came, with no knowledge of what really happened, The alien comes from behind her and attacks her using the same slime that mutated Dallas.

title: Silk Road (film)
synopsis: The film begins with Ross Ulbricht's arrest in San Francisco in 2013.
It then delves into Ross's background, portraying him as a well-educated aspiring entrepreneur living in Austin, Texas.
Ross comes up with the idea for Silk Road as a way to challenge government control and regulations, believing in the idea of taking back liberty.
He starts the website to allow anonymous buying and selling of illegal goods.

The movie introduces Ross Ulbricht, a charismatic and tech-savvy young man who creates the Silk Road, an underground website that facilitates the sale of illegal drugs and other contraband using cryptocurrencies.
Ulbricht adopts the alias "Dread Pirate Roberts" to operate the site anonymously.
Ross meets Julia, a student who becomes his lover and partner in crime.
As Silk Road gains popularity, Ross makes millions by facilitating the sale of illegal items such as drugs, weapons, and identity information.
However, when a Gawker article about Silk Road brings unwanted attention, law enforcement begins investigating the darknet marketplace.
DEA agent Rick Bowden, who has been reassigned to the cybercrimes unit after rehab, is tasked with investigating Silk Road.
He enlists an informant to teach him about darknet activities, leading to clashes with fellow agents and strains in his personal life.
As Silk Road thrives, Ross becomes increasingly isolated from Julia and his friend Max, who express concerns about his illegal activities.

Ross, operating under the alias Dread Pirate Roberts, becomes a sensation on Silk Road and engages in various interactions with sellers and buyers on the website, all while maintaining a sense of invincibility.
DEA agents, including Rick, work tirelessly to track down the owner of Silk Road, leading to a sting operation orchestrated by Rick.
The film portrays Ross's eventual arrest and the dismantling of Silk Road.
Throughout the movie, the personal struggles of both Ross and Rick are depicted, shedding light on their motivations and challenges.
Ross's arrest has a profound impact on his relationships and the lives of those affected by Silk Road.
The film touches on themes of hubris, greed, and the clash between individual freedom and law enforcement.
It also explores the complexities of Ross's character and the blurred lines between the moralities of the law and the actions of its enforcers.
As the Silk Road gains notoriety, law enforcement agencies become determined to shut it down.
Rick Bowden, a DEA agent, takes on the case and begins investigating Ulbricht.
Bowden is portrayed as a dedicated law enforcement officer who is intent on bringing down Silk Road and its elusive operator.
Ross Ulbricht continues to manage Silk Road, amassing a substantial fortune through the illicit marketplace.
He forms alliances and confronts threats from both law enforcement and rival criminals within the dark web.

In the end, Ross Ulbricht is arrested and faces the legal consequences of his actions, highlighting the significant impact of Silk Road on the world of online criminal enterprises and the ongoing debate about the boundaries of individual liberty and government intervention in the digital age.
The film reaches its climax when Ulbricht is finally apprehended by law enforcement, and his true identity is revealed.
He is arrested and faces a lengthy trial for drug trafficking, money laundering, and other charges related to Silk Road.
During the trial, Ulbricht's defense team argues that he was framed and that he is not the true Dread Pirate Roberts.

title: Shadowed Fear
synopsis: Nestled in the heart of Massachusetts is the idyllic suburban town of Oakville.
In its serene maze of picket-fenced yards and quaint, colonial-style houses, lives a thoughtful teenager named Sarah Thompson within the tender embrace of her doting parents, Mark and Laura.
Unlike many teenagers, Sarah's unique prowess lay in her deep introverted character and voracious curiosity for mysteries.
Each free hour she found was lost in the riveting pages of detective novels like those by Agatha Christie and Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.
As the calendar marked December, Oakville transformed.
But, within these harmonious happenings, Sarah was beginning to notice a strange pattern.
Trivial things like moderate relocations of furniture or sudden appearances of cutlery in strange places started raising unsettling questions, sowing seeds of doubt and concern in her mind.
As the nights grew longer, Sarah began to sense an unnatural thickness in the air.

In disturbing interruptions of the night silence, she would hear cryptic whispers of miscreants, she noted the subtle displacement of household items, and most disconcerting of all, an uncanny feeling of being watched by an unknown entity.
One clear December night, Sarah discerned a hazy figure through her bedroom window.
With fear nestling in her heart, and curiosity fuelling her resolve, Sarah decided she couldn't let this masked intruder become a threat to her family.
She chose to challenge this unknown terror.
Determined, Sarah embarked on a journey to the Oakville police station, riding her faithful old bicycle under the chilly winter sky.
To her dismay, the local police dismissed her allegations, attributing them to an overactive imagination which they believed was induced by her excessive indulgence in detective literature.
This setback, however, did not dishearten Sarah.
Her resolve hardened, and she decided to conduct her private investigation, much akin to the detectives in her novels.
Sarah invested her considerable energy into observing the neighborhood through her wide-rimmed glasses and found shocking similarities in her neighbors' experiences.
Combining the various shreds of gathered information, Sarah made a shocking connection.
The disturbed homes had a shared history with a tragic fire that engulfed a part of Oakville four decades ago, claiming lives and properties.
One fateful stormy night, amidst the crashing thunder and lightning flashes, Sarah had an unsettling encounter in her own warm living room with the very intruder she was seeking.
The masked figure left a hastily scribbled warning note for Sarah, meant to deter her pursuit.
Terrified yet defiant, overcoming the overwhelming fear, Sarah unearthed a newfound courage within herself.
She continued with her investigative pursuits more determined than ever before.

Tracking incidents at various locations across Oakville and connecting the cryptic clues left by the stalker, Sarah was successful in unveiling the man behind the mask – a woman named Martha Green who was purportedly a victim of the deadly fire.
Undeterred by the grim reality and potential danger, Sarah, impelled by her belief in justice, confronted Martha, face-to-face, unmasking her and her deeds.
Martha confessed to Sarah that she had no intentions to harm.
She was, in fact, targeting these houses as her silent protest for all the injustices she had suffered.
With wisdom and empathy surprising for her age, Sarah convinced Martha to give up her discreet protests and to seek justice in a legal manner.
Martha agreed and vowed to surrender, leaving a wave of anon her decision.
The two then traveled to the police station on a chilly morning, leaving the officers aghast and feeling regretful for soundlessly dismissing Sarah's plea.
Keeping their word to Sarah, the police took Martha into custody while apologizing to the brave teen.
Gradually, the town of Oakville found its way back to the peace and tranquility it was known for.
However, Sarah's reputation had undergone a significant transformation.
The once reticent teenager was now celebrated as a brave detective, and her name was whispered with respect and admiration whenever mentioned.
In a cinematic contrast, Martha, the once-dreaded entity, was seen being driven away in a black and white police vehicle.
The replays of her tear-streaked face in the rearview mirror added a touch of finality to this incredible tale, marking the end of the sinister wave that had shaken the town of Oakville.

title: American Underdog
synopsis: A young Kurt Warner watches Super Bowl XIX.
He then makes a lifelong commitment to becoming a Super Bowl and MVP quarterback.
Several years later, Kurt is playing his fifth year for the University of Northern Iowa (UNI) Panthers with coach Terry Allen, and nothing is going Warner's way.
Allen threatens to bench him after repeatedly not heeding his coaching, which would effectively end Warner's NFL dream.
After a brutal practice following the coach's orders, Kurt continues to be the starter and his numbers climb to where he could have a chance at the Draft.
Meanwhile, Kurt becomes interested in a woman he sees dancing at a country bar, so decides to learn how to dance to impress her.
Her name is Brenda, is a single mom with two kids and is a nursing student struggling financially.
Even though she doesn't think it will work out, Kurt is persistent, walking three miles to her house to get her number.
He finds out she was a Marine corporal and that her son is disabled.
Kurt instantly bonds with the children, convincing her to be together.
With his last season of college football over, Kurt anxiously awaits the draft.
He doesn't get picked and wonders why God gave him a dream that he would never obtain.
Later, the Green Bay Packers give him the chance to try out, but it goes badly and Kurt goes home dejected.
Becoming homeless, he moves into Brenda's basement.
He takes a job at a Hy-Vee grocery store, working nights stocking shelves.
He discovers success is not found on the football field, but how one acts when confronted with disappointment.
Brenda's parents sell the house and move to another state, putting them in a tough situation, and the couple continue to struggle.
At one point, their car runs out of gas and Kurt walks several miles in a blizzard to get gas.
Kurt gets approached by Jim Foster, who offers him the quarterback position for the Arena Football League's Iowa Barnstormers.
Kurt agrees after discovering no one in the NFL is interested in him.
Arena football is different.
The field is smaller and the play is much more fast-paced.
He loses his first game but wins the next.
Kurt and Brenda's relationship is strained from the long commute, and they briefly break up.
