Leaving them yearning for more such ventures, it keeps their excitement ignited even in its conclusion.

As the tale of Evelyn and her bustling ant kingdom concludes, the audience exits the theatre with a warmed heart and a lesson etched in their minds; offering a fitting end to an enlightening subterranean adventure.

title: Vigilant: The Dark Side of Recovery (2021 film)
synopsis: The protagonist, Jane Doe, is introduced.
Her portrayal is a seasoned one; a courageous retired Army healthcare professional.
However, the unyielding spectre of opioid addiction, a struggle from her past, continues to cast a sorrowful shade over her life.

After leaving the harsh battlegrounds for a more peaceful existence, Jane now walks the hallowed halls of Harvard University, garbed in the uniform of a safety officer, swapping her combat boots for measured footsteps and assault rifles for trusted keys.

With a profound twist of irony, Jane's prime responsibilities include ensuring the safety and wellbeing of Harvard's students and safeguarding its distinguished premises from any potential threats or dangers.
But beneath her stern demeanor and steady composure lurks a perilous secret.
Once everything has settled into a quiet stillness, Jane takes advantage of her position and stealthily breaks into Harvard's well-equipped labs, stealing the in-demand opioids.
It starts on one eventful night when Jane's clandestine operation is severely compromised.
A chemistry student, Ben, accidentally stumbles upon her illicit activities as he sneaks into the lab for some late-night research.
Jane, trapped under Ben's wide-eyed gaze, is forcefully reminded of the consequences that would follow if her secret ventures get exposed.
Her professional reputation would spiral down in an unstoppable nosedive, leaving her personal world in shambles.
In a desperate bid to salvage the situation, Jane sees no choice but to rope Ben into her secretive world.
With an awkward smile, she throws a mentoring offer on the table, promising Ben academic guidance in chemistry and personal support, hoping that he would agree to stay silent in return.
As their mentorship journey begins, Jane steps into the role of a surrogate mother for Ben, a socially awkward genius.
She understands his inhibitions and nurtures his academic growth while sharing the pearls of wisdom life has gifted her.
Time quickly passes, marked by the changing seasons and the steady transformation of Ben.
In the meanwhile, Jane finds herself forming an unexpected bond with Ben and grows to trust him with her secrets.
For Ben, Jane was not just an academic tutor.
She was also a personal moral compass who accepted him with his quirks and shortcomings, providing him companionship he greatly missed in his life.
As Ben becomes an integral part of her life, Jane starts questioning the choices she's been making.
She starts wondering if the thrill of her nocturnal adventures outweighs its grave moral repugnance.
But as their peculiar bond strengthens, their world is tossed into disarray when Jane learns about an imminent federal inspection of Harvard's pharmaceutical labs.
This sudden turn of events places her at a dangerous precipice, threatening to shatter the intricate bond she built with Ben, the only stable amid her chaotic existence.
After days of heart-wrenching turmoil, Jane finally decides to take the plunge.
She confesses to Ben about her opioid reliance during her days as an army nurse and her current clandestine pharmaceutical heists.
Even though the confession exerts an emotional toll on Jane, she bears it willingly, hopeful that Ben would understand her plight and unravel the rationale behind her daring actions.
Ben's initial reaction is shock which soon gives way to understanding.
His empathetic acceptance towards Jane's complex situation shows a maturity that defies his years.
Displaying unbelievable resolve, Ben chooses to stand by Jane in her difficult time.
He decides to assist Jane in disposing of the stolen medication before the inspection, reducing her burden appreciably.
Jane gratefully accepts his offer, moved by his unwavering loyalty and support, signifying a tight thread of trust that had become inseparable.
The duo embarks together on the precarious mission of disposing of large volumes of stolen opioids.
With every vial they dispose of, their stakes rise exponentially.
As the inspection day looms closer, the suspense nearly palpable in the air, Jane and Ben persist resiliently, growing stronger and more reliant on each other with every passing moment.
With the clock ticking ominously, the duo miraculously manages to dispose of all the stolen opioids.
They complete their task just in the nick of time, as the federal inspection team steps onto the serene Harvard campus.
Provoked by the intensity of the recent events, Jane finally acknowledges the need to turn a new leaf and reshapes the direction of her life.

She establishes a support group specifically designed for ex-military personnel, providing them a safe space to narrate their experiences, cope with their traumas, and assimilate into civilian life effortlessly.
Surprisingly, her initiative receives a warm response, acting as a beacon of hope to many retired soldiers who managed to find solace, thereby healing their troubled minds.
As the narrative unfolds, Ben, who was once a bystander in Jane's life, evolves into a prominent character, marking a remarkable progression in the storyline.
Inspired by Jane's transformation, Ben decides to channel his enthusiasm into providing mental support to others after his graduation.
Embracing his newfound role with grace and determination, Ben becomes a mental-health counselor at Harvard, where he guides others just like Jane guided him.
The film reaches its final act, where Jane and Ben are now seen leading a group therapy session in their support group — a far cry from their troubled pasts.

In an emotionally-charged scene, Jane, while addressing her audience about her journey, sends a look of heartfelt gratitude towards one individual — Ben, a chemistry student turned counselor who played an unintentional pivotal role in her life's transformation.

Jane, who was once lost in the complex web of opioid addiction and unlawful activities, is now seen walking confidently towards a promising future, with Ben by her side, ready to face whatever comes their way.

title: Orphan: First Kill
synopsis: In January 2007, Estonian psychiatric patient Leena Klammer, a 31-year-old woman with a rare hormonal disorder called hypopituitarism that gives her the appearance of a 9-year-old child, orchestrates an escape from the Saarne Institute by seducing and killing a guard and hiding in the car of an art therapist named Anna.

After breaking into Anna's house and killing her, Leena looks up missing American girls and finds that she bears a striking resemblance to Esther Albright, a girl from a rich family who went missing in 2003.
Later, posing as a lost girl, Leena is approached by a Russian police officer and introduces herself as "Esther", claiming that her parents are in the United States.

In Darien, Connecticut, wealthy artist Allen Albright and his wife Tricia, who has since come to terms with the disappearance of their daughter, are informed by Detective Donnan that "Esther" has been found.
Tricia travels to the U.S. embassy in Moscow where she is "reunited" with Esther.

Tricia brings Esther home and immediately starts to have doubts when she notices that Esther has forgotten about the death of her grandmother or that her painting skills have increased enormously compared to before she disappeared.
Leena falls in love with Allen after they both start bonding over their painting skills, and tries to separate him from Tricia.
While Tricia and Allen attend a charity gala hosted by Tricia, Donnan arrives at the house and steals a vinyl record from Esther's room which has Leena's fingerprints on it.
He takes it back to his house, unaware that Leena has followed him, and analyzes the fingerprints to find it is not a match.
Leena attacks Donnan and stabs him with a knife repeatedly, before Tricia arrives, having followed Leena.
Instead of stopping Leena, Tricia opens fire on Donnan with a gun and kills him.
Tricia reveals that she knows Leena is not Esther, who died four years earlier during an altercation with her older brother Gunnar, which Tricia covered up without Allen's knowledge.
Tricia explains that she is only welcoming Leena to make Allen happy again and that if she refuses to cooperate, she would report her to the authorities for "murdering" Donnan.

Leena reveals her true identity to Tricia, and the two then dispose of Donnan's body in a cellar hatch where the real Esther is buried and frame his disappearance as a vacation trip by forging an email to the police station.
Tricia eventually terminates the deal but realizing that it would be too suspicious if "Esther" were to disappear again, Tricia and Gunnar pretend that Leena is still "Esther" in Allen's presence.
Later, Tricia tries to poison Leena during dinner but Leena retaliates by feeding Tricia with a dead rat smoothie (the rat having died from eating Leena's poisoned food).
She also attempts to push Tricia and Gunnar onto the railway tracks but is stopped by an incoming passenger.
With Allen away at an art gallery exhibition, Leena tries fleeing by stealing Tricia's car, but she is soon found by a police officer.
That night, Leena is brought back to the Albright house and Tricia and Gunnar finally decide to kill Leena for good.
Tricia tries to stage a suicide, but Leena fights back and flees before Gunnar throws her down the stairs.
Distracted by a phone call from Allen, who is returning home, Tricia and Gunnar search for Leena when she disappears.
Gunnar eventually finds Leena in the art room but Leena shoots Gunnar with a crossbow and then stabs him to death with his fencing sword.
An enraged Tricia and Leena fight in the kitchen, inadvertently setting the house alight in the process, and the pair flee to the roof as Allen returns home.
Tricia and Leena both slip and end up clinging to the roof, begging Allen to save them, with Leena claiming Tricia attacked her, and Tricia trying to reveal the truth about Leena.
Unable to save both of them, Allen chooses to help "Esther", causing Tricia to lose her grip and fall to her death.
Allen then checks Leena's face, which causes her fake teeth to fall out.
Realizing she is not Esther, Leena tries to defend herself by saying she did it for them and also confesses her love for him.
Allen calls her a monster, causing an enraged Leena to accidentally push him off the roof.
Leena then again dresses herself as Esther and leaves the burning house after cleaning off the blood on her face.
Later, "Esther" is moved to an orphanage where she waits for a new family to adopt her.

title: Bingo Hell
synopsis: A man named Mario comes home, having just sold his bingo hall.
Seemingly in a daze...he dances around to the tune of classic Spanish music playing on vinyl.
He begins speaking to himself, and then a picture of his dead wife Patricia about the sale.
He says  he can fulfill his promise of leaving "this place".
He puts down a suitcase of money, and begins to greedily eat a serving tray full of bingo balls.
An ominous voice coaxes him on, until he chokes to death.
An elderly woman named Lupita walks around Oak Springs one morning and meets up with her friend Clarence (who owns an auto repair shop).
Lupita then goes to see her hairdresser, Yolanda, whose electricity is being fixed by Morris.
Morris is not able to fix it because he says he doesn't have the right tools and leaves.
Cut to Dolores, who is mad at her daughter-in-law Raquel for not providing proper discipline for her grandson who has been breaking into cars and getting away with whatever he wants.
She is also angry at the daughter-in-law for not doing her part and being irresponsible around the house after moving in when her husband died.
Dolores then goes to Yolanda's and meets up with Lupita who is already there.
They have a discussion about Caleb, and Lupita brings up the similarities with Dolores's son who has died and takes issue to it.
After an awkward silence, Lupita apologizes and Dolores accepts begrudgingly before Lupita leaves.
Lupita goes to a bingo game at the local bingo hall, but they finish up when they realize Mario has not paid his electricity bills.
The next day, Lupita and her friends find flyers around town saying that the bingo hall is under new management.
Lupita, Morris, Clancy, Dolores and Yolanda decide to take a look at it and realize that the bingo hall has been transformed into a casino.
While there, Dolores spots Raquel, who wins ten thousand dollars from the owner, Mr. Big.
The next morning, Caleb and Dolores find that Raquel left them with her money.
Raquel arrives at a motel, where she begins to rip off the straps of a dress.
However, standing behind her is Mr. Big, who makes her hallucinate it while in reality she is using her fingernails to rip off her flesh.
Lupita breaks into Mario's house and finds his corpse, before realizing that she hallucinated it.
They go back to the bingo hall, and this time Clarence wins one hundred thousand dollars.
That night, Clarence parties by himself next to his car, drinking a bottle of beer, not realizing that he is actually drinking motor oil.
He then sticks his arm into a car motor, violently shredding it and eventually killing him, not seeing the shadow of Mr. Big inside the car.
Lupita finds Clarence's body and sees Morris talking to Mr. Big, who gives him a stamp on his hand which begins to disintegrate.
Lupita realizes the entire Oak Springs have been lured into the bingo hall, and heads there with her shotgun and with Eric.
Caleb tries to break in, blaming the place for his mom's disappearance, but Eric catches him and chases him inside.
Mr. Big confronts him and then makes Eric stab himself in the neck with a poisoned syringe, before killing him by stomping on his skull.
Lupita tries to get the residents to leave but Mr. Big begins to crush her head against a podium, before Caleb shoots him in the back.
Lupita destroys the TV and the residents attack Mr. Big, brutally beating him, until Lupita cracks open his head with the butt of her shotgun.
Caleb sets fire to the money and they escape, leaving Mr. Big to burn.

title: Lottery Haven
synopsis: John, a battle-weary veteran and the owner of a charming, rustic lottery shop nestled in the calm surroundings of Haven, a quaint town situated in the serene countryside of Montana, increasingly feels disillusioned and restless with the routine monotony that has become his life.
His restlessness intensifies, prompting him to seriously consider selling off his beloved shop.
Before he embarks on his intended journey, he chats with the town's elder, Agnes - a delightfully eccentric lady legendary for her uncanny predictive abilities.
With a stern look on her wrinkled face, she cautions him about a long-forgotten evil that may be tied to his wooden lottery machine.
John dismisses Agnes's eerie warnings with a nonchalant chuckle.
On his last evening in Haven, John's friends organize a heartfelt goodbye party at his childhood home, a log cabin filled with the fresh scent of pine.
Amidst the unforgettable celebration, the new owners of his shop, a vibrant young couple from the city brimming with ambition, pull John aside to share unsettling news.
They've noticed eerie, cryptic messages occasionally flashing across the screen of the vintage lottery terminals at the shop.
The town is shaken by the mysterious disappearance of the recent lottery winner, Bill Hayes.
John remains firm in his decision to leave.
As John sets off on a cloudy morning, the town is further gripped by panic as more lottery winners vanish under mysterious circumstances.
The local law enforcement urgently requests John to return to Haven, given his unique and exhaustive understanding of the lottery terminals.
John is plagued by a series of disturbing dreams and terrifying visions linking back to his old shop.
Wrestling with an uncanny sense of dread and apprehension, he grudgingly admits that he might have accidently stirred a sinister entity that is now wreaking havoc amongst his familiar townsfolk.
Overwhelmed with dread and guilt, he makes the difficult decision to return to Haven.
Back in Haven, he reunites with Sam, a childhood pal who is now a dependable local cop.
Together, they form a formidable team ready to unravel the ominous mysteries ensnaring their once peaceful town.
They discover a long-forgotten secret of Haven.
The town had once served as a sanctuary for banished supernatural beings.
They find out that the malevolent spirits haunting the recent lottery winners were once imprisoned in John's old lottery machine.
By selling the shop, the balance had been disrupted, freeing the spirits.
The innocent-looking lottery balls transform into blood-curdling spectral projectiles, attacking the brave group assembled in the shop.
The missing lottery winners start reappearing, horrifyingly transformed into nightmarish versions of their most profound fears.
The death toll starts to rise.
Martha, the town's beloved baker and motherly figure, falls prey to the supernatural onslaught.

Emboldened by his sense of responsibility and the town's dire state, John galvanizes everyone around him, instilling in them renewed hope and determination to reclaim their town from the spectral tormentors.
They come face to face with the primary evil spirit, which has assumed the human form of Bill Hayes.
Relying on his vast knowledge of his store's history and the folklore surrounding it, John comes up with a daring plan to re-imprison the spirits back within the lottery terminals.
As the confrontation pushes John and his team toward their limits, they bravely fight against these formidable entities in a gripping face-off.
Amidst the ensuing intense chaos, John barely manages to trap the spirits back into the machine, restoring a temporary sense of peace in the town.
Surviving the ordeal and unearthing the depths of his resilience, he reconsiders his decision to leave and chooses to stay back in Haven.
Life in Haven gradually returns to normal, and John finds charm in what he once found mundane about the town.
But as this tale of fear and courage comes to an end, a soft, unnatural hum and a glow from John's veteran lottery machine indicate that the peaceful times might be temporary.

title: Suburban Shadows
synopsis: As the movie unfolds, we see John, a self-assured computer engineer, and Mary, a perpetually vibrant schoolteacher and newlywed wife, relocating to a delightful Victorian-style house.
Nestled in the serenity of Massachusetts's suburban landscape, their newfound residence looks every bit the charming home they'd always dreamed of.
As the couple acclimatizes to their new home, their bright faces beam with a profound sense of joy.
They look forward to cultivating their vegetable patch in the verdant backyard and inviting friends over to their quirky abode for intimate dinner parties.
However, their joyous reality slowly begins to intertwine with an unfamiliar, ominous undercurrent.
Buried beneath the façade of the picturesque home lie potential challenges and mysteries that elude the couple's knowledge.
Their excitement begins to oscillate between anticipation and unease as they meet with the house's enigmatic architect, Robert Smith.
Distinguished by his white, bushy beard and a curt demeanour, Smith imparts an unsettling presence that permeates the serene household.

Smith's peculiar behavior, accentuated by his avoidance of direct eye contact and his cryptic responses to their questions about the house, unleashes the first waves of suspicion in the couple's mind, consequently shadowing their initial enthusiasm.
A particular day turned pivotal when Mary stumbles on a newspaper clipping, aged and frail.
The piece hinted at Robert Smith's potential involvement in occult practices and his connection with a secretive, notorious society, shrouding him in an aura of mystery.
This revelation strikes Mary like a lightning bolt, triggering a whirlpool of curiosity intertwined with escalating apprehension.
John, however, brushes these allegations off as nothing more than small-town chatter, a classic case of the public's proclivity towards exaggerated tales and sensationalism.
Then follows a phase where they endeavor to retain normalcy in their enigmatic home until an antiquated wooden chest springs up amid the attic's dust.
This chest conceals antique curios and pale yellow letters, their antiquity echoing corresponding tales unspoken.
The letters, festooned with grotesque and unreadable symbols, hold an eerie gravitas.
Meanwhile, the curious trinkets bear an uncanny resemblance to the tools often associated with occult rituals.
The harsh reality of their situation dawns on Mary, spiraling her into a state of fear-stricken anticipation.

Their once idyllic house now transmogrifies into a hotbed of uncanny phenomena - inexplicable creaking sounds echoing in the dead of night, household objects migrating on their own, and fleeting shadows dashing across rooms, fostering an environment of discomfort.
As Mary wrestles with her mounting fears, John, spurred by resolve, plunges headfirst into investigating Robert Smith's past architectural endeavors.
His in-depth scrutiny into Smith's previous constructions reveals an unsettling pattern of otherworldly occurrences and riddles associated with Smith's other works.

The hair-raising accounts of Smith's past creations—events chalked up to accidents, mysterious happenings, and abruptly abandoned houses—force John to confront and reassess his initial dismissive stance.
As the narrative progresses, John and Mary develop a close bond with their neighbors, a pair of elderly folks.
This friendship unravels hushed whispers and shared fearful glances, reflecting parallel bizarre experiences in their neighbor's home.

Despite the fear clearly etched on their faces, the neighbors remain tight-lipped about their experiences, living under the constant threat of societal judgement and the possibility of social exclusion.
Accepting the supernatural presence as a grim reality, John and Mary seek guidance from Father Andrew.
A respected local priest, Father Andrew is revered for the profound wisdom he's accumulated over the years.
Father Andrew, a man of unwavering faith and remarkable spirit, agrees to perform an exorcism.
Yet, he warns of a potentially hazardous backlash, a response from the spirits at being banished from the premises.
The prospect of an impending exorcism instills a mix of fear and hope in the couple.
Yet, their anticipation is short-lived.
Father Andrew vanishes without a hint, plunging their community into a pit of shock and uncertainty.
Father Andrew's abrupt and inexplicable disappearance causes ripples in the local community, painting an atmosphere swirling with shock, fear, and insidious suspicions.
Now pressed into a corner by their circumstances, with increasing panic gripping their hearts, John and Mary engage Amelia Brown's services.
A reputed psychic, Amelia is revered for her bravery and keen intuition.
Amelia, a striking woman in her late forties with soul-searching blue eyes, arrives, radiating an aura of calmness.
Her serene presence offers a momentary respite to the harrowed couple.
Amelia's revelations force the couple to confront the alarming reality of Smith's malevolence.
He had intentionally ensnared anguished spirits within the confines of his architectural marvels, intending to weaponize them.
Amelia paints a daunting picture before the couple.
To rid their home of these long-lingering spirits, they would need to muster their deepest courage and prepare for massive psychological onslaught.
Notwithstanding the rising terror gnawing at their hearts, John and Mary stand resolute.
They pledge to rid their home of the tormenting spirits, come what may.
Moved by the couple's resolve, Amelia devises a risky plan.
Her strategy involves beguiling the restless spirit into revealing its existence.
Guided by Amelia's instructions, John and Mary recreate occult rituals, hoping to dupe the spirit into considering them part of its fold.
The spirit, intrigued by the couple's faux occult practices, reveals its presence, proving Amelia's theory to be accurate.
Seizing the opening, John and Mary doggedly continue their charade, emboldening the spirit to confide further into Smith's esoteric rituals.
Angered by their audacity, the spirit (now known to be a wrathful female specter) discloses the convoluted ritual necessary to sever its mystical bond with the house.
Sensing their duplicity, the spirits' skepticism manifests as furious tempests tearing through the house, flooding the interiors with icy gales.
The house throbs with the spirit's wrath, culminating in Amelia being forcibly hurled away by an indiscernible force, leaving a flustered John and Mary on their own.
Facing limited options, John and Mary scramble to enact the complex exorcism ritual as revealed by the incensed spirit.
Their frenzied attempts to complete the ritual, amid the relentless onslaught from the unseen spirit, form the heart-stopping climax of the movie.
Even as fear flutters in their gaze and sweat trickles down their faces, John and Mary exhibit unyielding unity, holding their ground against their spectral adversary.
Their tenacity eventually wins.
The mysterious bond crumbles with a resounding wail from the spirit, signaling her abrupt departure, leaving behind an eerily quiet house.
In the aftermath, the deafening silence fills the couple with a comforting sensation of victory as the once foreboding ambiance dissipates, replaced by peaceful calmness.
Word of their valiant stand and consequent triumph cascades through the neighborhood, creating waves of gratitude, relief, and awe among the townsfolk.
With the shadow of fear now replaced by a ray of hope, normalcy slowly creeps back into their suburban community.
Residents now feel brave enough to bask in the daylight, their children revelling in outdoor games.
Amid the unfolding events, John and Mary emerge resilient.
Their shared trials and turbulence had forged their bond, and the appreciation from their community further validated their courage.
Their lasting love took on a heroic hue after they stood undeterred in the face of the lurking terror within their home.
Their unwavering devotion to each other became their guiding light.
The journey from a naïvely happy couple to bravely confronting supernatural adversities had led them to reclaim their tranquil home.
Having emerged from their harrowing experiences, they dedicated themselves to assist others similarly tormented by Smith's malicious architectural designs.
They offered support, sharing their experiences and the knowledge they'd gained during their ordeal.
Their strength had evolved, no longer anchored in blissful ignorance, but stemming from their newfound wisdom and courage.
The dream of a peaceful domestic life they initially sought nods at them from a closer distance.
It was now a reality, albeit hard-earned through their relentless struggle against what was lurking unseen.
John and Mary now dwell in peace, treasuring their beautifully quaint suburban home.
They are ever aware of their eerie past, and the triumph they had won in claiming the house truly theirs.
While the tormenting spirits were banished, the bravery within John and Mary had sparked, equipping them to face any future challenges with a newfound resilience.
The film concludes with this resonant message: True heroes are not born pre-formed, they are molded and shaped in the fierce furnace of trials and adversities.
This couple's transformation from ordinary to extraordinary proves this ideology beyond doubt.

title: The Monster Hunter: Shadow of the Woodland Spirit
synopsis: Eldric, a revered monster slayer seasoned with thirty summers, stands at the edge of the grim and dark Dreadwood Forest.
His gaze pierces the slightest wind ruffles, attests to his readiness to hunt the elusive Voracious Viperwolf.
His eyes, fashioned to eagle-like precision from years of tireless training, are now latched onto the shadows behind the alien forest-trees.
He flickers between them, his agility akin to a panther, each stride more silent than the wind, affirming his mastery of coping with cryptic threats.
Prince Alfred rests in his affluent domain, Moonstone Nordhelm.
He indulges in a royal feast, gorging on culinary delights, gallivanting with jovial courtiers, blinded by the opulence at play.
His path intersects with that of Seriphia, a notorious Dryad spoken of in hushed whispers around the outskirts.
Drunk on his royal blood, Alfred recklessly bellows, ordering Seriphia to kneel before his noble lineage.
A gross display of arrogance, he becomes unknowingly responsible for triggering her wrath.
Seriphia's reply resonates in an echoing laughter, defying royal command.
This clash of status sparks a hostile clash, casting a heavy shroud of dread over the cheerful murals of Nordhelm.
Seriphia, in a cruel twist, turns to drain Alfred of his pride-induced energy.
A ruthless act that saps him into a pity-stricken state of physical and mental exhaustion.
On seeing the Dryad raise her arm to deliver a lethal blow, Eldric selflessly intervenes, launching his celestial Moonsteel blade against her.
An intense, whitening confrontation ensues.
Seeing a chance to salvage his honor, Alfred approaches Eldric with the olive branch of friendship and alliance.
Following this pact, Alfred endures a rigorous combat training regime under Eldric becoming adept in clashing steel, outwitting foes, and learns to coexist with Nordhelm's monstrous population.
Their combined forces successfully deter the minor beings lurking on the outskirts of Elderwood, inching closer every day towards Seriphia's wood-knotted abode.
They stumble upon an old, tarnished copper crown, stuck in the roots of a thousand-year-old Yggdrasil tree, an uncanny link to a forgotten Nordhelmian monarch.
Stoked by an overwhelming resolve to protect Nordhelm, the duo confronts Seriphia, triggering a final showdown that ripples the very essence of the kingdom.
Eldric's Moonsteel blade meets Seriphia's spectral energy, pushing each other to the brink of their combative abilities.
In an unprecedented move, Alfred swings a devastating blow against Seriphia.
Under Moonsteel's raw power, she splinters into sparks of dissolving ether.
But not before leaving Eldric with a grievous wound.
Eldric uses his waning breath to entrust the protection of Nordhelm to Alfred.
Alfred attempts to reconcile with Eldric's sacrificial death.
He pledges to shield Nordhelm from inevitable threats, honoring the memory of the brave hunter.
Alfred ushers an era of tranquility in Nordhelm.
A peaceful beginning signifying the dawn of a revitalized realm in his command.
A haunting howl slices through the serene night, spelling out the advent of a nerve-wracking chapter in the saga.
Standing atop the castle's highest tower, Alfred's shadowy presence forms a daunting silhouette against the moon.
A resounding royal decree reverberates across the dimly lit alleys of Nordhelm, rallying the kingdom folk to prepare for an impending assault.

title: The Prom (film)
synopsis: In Edgewater, Indiana, James Madison High School's head of the PTA, Mrs. Greene announces the school's prom will be canceled as the lesbian student Emma Nolan planned to attend with a girl.
Emma's girlfriend is Alyssa, Mrs. Greene's closeted daughter.
Principal Tom Hawkins supports Emma, but is powerless against the PTA's decision.
Meanwhile, in NYC, Broadway stars Dee Dee Allen and Barry Glickman are disappointed after their show Eleanor!
The Eleanor Roosevelt Story closes on opening night as the New York Times blasts their performances.

They are comforted by former sitcom star Trent Oliver, who now only plays forgettable supporting roles, and Angie Dickinson, who just quit the chorus line of Chicago after being passed over for the role of Roxie Hart.
Barry realizes they all need a cause to revitalize their careers.
Finding Emma's story on Twitter, the actors drive to Indiana with the non-Equity touring cast of Godspell and publicist Sheldon Saperstein.
At school, Emma is bullied and harassed by students Kaylee, Shelby, Nick and Kevin, who blame her for ruining prom.
The actors barge into the next PTA meeting and attempt to rally support for Emma.
Hawkins, a big fan of Dee Dee's, unsuccessfully tries to get her to back off.
The actors book a gig as the entertainment for a monster truck rally, but are booed off the stage for preaching about acceptance.
Hawkins tells them the Indiana Supreme Court has ruled that James Madison must allow Emma to attend prom.
That evening, he and Dee Dee bond over dinner.
The next day, is promposal day.
Barry visits Emma at her grandmother Bea's.
She has been living here since her sixteenth birthday when her parents threw her out for being gay.
Barry tells Emma that he ran away from home at 16 because he knew his parents wouldn't accept his sexual orientation and has not spoken to them since.

It is later revealed that the PTA has exploited a loophole in the Court's ruling by arranging for her to attend a separate prom alone while the rest of the students go to the real one at a private club.
Emma calls Alyssa for support, however she is too scared of losing her mother to come out.
Hawkins is disgusted when he learns the real reason that Dee Dee came to Indiana was to use Emma to prop up her career.
The next day, Mrs. Greene holds a press conference about the two proms.
Angie comforts a heartbroken Emma, while Barry persuades Dee Dee to get Emma on her ex-husband Eddie Sharp's talk show; in response, she insists that he call his mother Vera and make peace with her.
Dee Dee apologizes to Hawkins for lying to him and they reconcile.
Emma, upset that Alyssa won't stand up to her mother, breaks up with her.
Trent confronts Emma's tormentors, persuading them to support her with help from the Godspell cast.
Dee Dee arrives at the motel and tells everyone she traded Eddie her house in The Hamptons for Emma's slot on his show.
However, Emma turns the offer down to tell her story her own way.
She sings a song she wrote during a livestream, which goes viral.
The actors pool their finances to throw an all-inclusive prom for Emma.
Afterward, Dee Dee tells Barry she called Vera, who wants to talk to him.
Vera apologizes to Barry for her past treatment of him, so they make peace.
Kaylee, Shelby, Nick and Kevin apologize to Alyssa and Emma for their behavior.
Mrs. Greene tries to stop their preparations for the prom.
When Alyssa reveals who she really is, her mother leaves.
Alyssa and Emma reconcile.
Later that night, Emma and Alyssa arrive early to meet with the actors, Sheldon, Bea, and Vera.
Angie learns that she has been cast as Roxie Hart as Tina Louise has contracted shingles, Trent retires from acting to become James Madison's new drama teacher, and Barry is crowned prom queen.
The students and many teens from the local LGBT community show up to the prom in support of Emma.
As the event begins, Mrs. Greene arrives, apologizes, and embraces Alyssa, accepting her for who she is.
Dee Dee and Principal Hawkins share a kiss and start a relationship.
Emma and Alyssa share their first public kiss and everyone celebrates.

title: Fresh (2022 film)
synopsis: Noa, a woman from Portland, is increasingly disillusioned with online dating and the rude men she interacts with.
One day at the supermarket, a man named Steve flirts with her and they exchange numbers.
On their first date, the two quickly hit it off and have sex.
After several dates, Steve invites Noa for a weekend break away alone with him.
Against the advice of her best friend Mollie, Noa agrees to the trip.
Planning to travel early the following day, Noa spends the evening at Steve's luxury home.
Steve drugs Noa's cocktail and she falls unconscious.
Noa wakes up in captivity, chained to the ground.
Steve explains that he is a butcher of human meat, which he both consumes himself and sells to wealthy clients, revealing himself as a sadistic cannibal.
His clients prefer the meat of young women, so he regularly lures and abducts women on dates.
He says that he will keep Noa alive as long as possible in order to keep her meat fresh as he intends to surgically remove different pieces of her body over time.
Steve allows Noa to take a shower, but she tries to escape.
Steve captures her and harvests her buttocks as punishment.
Noa speaks to a woman named Penny who is being held captive in an adjacent room.
Penny shares with Noa that a woman that can be heard singing incoherently is another victim named Melissa who has gone insane.
Meanwhile, Mollie becomes concerned about Noa's disappearance and begins investigating with her friend Paul, a bartender who served Noa and Steve drinks on their first date.
After searching online, Mollie discovers Steve is actually named Brendan, and is married to a woman named Ann with whom he has children.
Mollie visits Ann and informs her of Brendan’s apparent affair.
Brendan arrives, but denies any knowledge of Noa when questioned by Mollie.
As she leaves, Mollie calls Noa's phone, which begins ringing in Brendan's pocket.
Ann, realizing he's been caught, knocks Mollie unconscious.
In a shower scene with Ann, it is revealed that she has a prosthetic leg, implying that she might have been one of Brendan's past victims.
Noa gains Brendan's trust by flirting and pretending to be interested in what human meat tastes like.
Brendan invites her to dinner and persuades her to taste a lavish meal containing human meat, which Noa eats, pretends to enjoy and later vomits in her cell.
Meanwhile, Brendan takes Mollie away for harvesting.
Brendan invites Noa to another dinner, providing her with a pink dress as a gift.
Before dinner, Brendan shows Noa a hidden compartment filled with items belonging to his victims, indicating he has abducted and murdered dozens of women before her.
While observing Brendan's trophies, Noa recognizes Mollie's phone amongst those of the kidnapped victims.
At dinner, he feeds Noa breast meat, which Brendan connotes as possibly tasting "familiar."
Following dinner, Noa persuades Brendan to have sex with her and let her perform fellatio on him; she instead, bites off his penis.
With Brendan injured, but in pursuit, Noa helps Mollie and Penny escape from their rooms.
The three encounter Brendan in the kitchen and fight him, then escape into the woods with Brendan pursuing them with a gun.
In the meantime, before she was abducted, Mollie had shared her location via phone with Paul.
When he does not hear back from Mollie, Paul follows the location and arrives at Brendan's house.
However, hearing gunshots fired by Brendan, Paul turns away fearing for his life.
In the woods, Noa, Mollie, and Penny manage to attack him again, with Noa taking the gun and shooting Brendan dead.
Ann arrives at the house and finds Brendan's body.
She encounters Noa in the woods and tries to strangle her, but Noa stabs Ann in the neck with car keys.
As Ann recovers and attempts to strangle Noa again, Mollie angrily bludgeons Ann to death with a shovel.
As she and Mollie relax at last, Noa receives a text from a man she went out with at the beginning of the film.
A mid-credits scene depicts five of Brendan's clients in a white room, seated at a table with bleeding human meat at the center.

title: Georgia Detour (film)
synopsis: Alex is a jovial and quick-witted man from Mentone, a humble Georgian village.

Employed at the village's only car wash establishment, he converts any ordinary day into an amusing one with his side-splitting observations and contagiously funny comments about the mundaneness of rural life.
This fun-loving individual was no less than a local celebrity - his lively humor and hidden intellection blending eloquently to leave an amusing impression on the community.
The serene existence disrupted one day when a poised city girl named Sophia, with a vibrant city aura, drove into Mentone, her shiny ruby-red Ferrari glimmering under the sun.
Her sudden arrival stirred a wave of surprise and curiosity among the otherwise peaceful village dwellers.
Sophia's cosmopolitan sophistication was a stark contrast to the laid-back ambiance and amicable spirit of the modest village, creating a sense of excitement among the residents.
Catching a glance of Sophia's dust-covered luxury car, Alex is left longing for an opportunity to bring back its original shine.
He welcomes this break from the usual farm trucks and beaten-up buses he typically deals with.
The first meeting between the two at the car wash made for a hilarious affair.
Their wondering eyes and contrasting worldviews of each other's lifestyles set the stage for tons of laughs.
Sophia left her precious vehicle under Alex's care while she decided to explore the countryside.
She handed him a detailed manual carrying meticulous instructions about how she wished her car to be handled and cleaned.
As soon as Sophia left the scene, Alex’s pals doubled over in laughter as they jokingly visualized the regimented city life of Sophia.
Disregarding Sophia’s meticulous guidelines, Alex, feeling mischievous, decided to use her Ferrari for rip-roaring rides around the countryside, accompanied by his equally audacious friends.

One of the most unforgettable exploits was when they decided to participate in the local county fair's hilarious tractor race, barreling down dirt tracks amid tractors and worn-out pickup trucks in a flashy Ferrari.
Despite the fun, Alex experiences a pang of guilt when he notices minor dents and scratches on the vehicle during their adventurous expeditions.
Things get even trickier when the village gets wind of Sophia's imminent return.
A wave of panicked hilarity swept over the peaceful town, residents imagining her reaction upon finding her fancy car in a less than pristine state.
Meanwhile, Sophia was quickly falling in love with the warm and welcoming nature of the country folk, a deeply contrasting experience she relished, compared to her usual detached city life.
The unhurried pace of Mentone life, along with its intimate festivals, became a source of joy for her.
Moreover, Alex's boundless, hearty laughter made her experience infinitely delightful, making her crave his amiable companionship more and more.
As time passed, a distinct romance began to simmer between Alex and Sophia.
Their love story was infused with humor at every turn, such as the time when Alex attempted a romantic candlelit dinner that quickly escalated into a wild food fight.
As Sophia’s return neared, Alex found his guilt and anxiety piling up over the thought of confessing the damage his merry rides had inflicted on Sophia’s cherished Ferrari.
In an attempt to cover up his blunder, Alex launched into a series of hilarious actions aiming at repairing the car himself, despite his very limited knowledge of automobile mechanics.
On the verge of despair, Alex decided to involve his fellow villagers, who had become invested in his predicament, to secretly assist him in the herculean task of fixing the luxury vehicle.
The whole village came together in a heartwarming display of solidarity, mimicking a clumsy, amateur yet determined pit crew.
Upon her return, Sophia was greeted with her renovated car.
The transformation left her in pure shock and disbelief.
Initially, she felt a swell of disappointment for her once pristine, untouched sports car was now irrevocably modified.
However, anger gave way to understanding as she laid eyes on her unique, handcrafted Ferrari.
The earnest attempts made by Alex in tandem with his heartfelt apology gradually lightened her mood.
Sophia found herself increasingly drawn towards the serene tranquility of Mentone and the joy that Alex's infectious laughter brought into her life.
In an uplifting turn of events, Sophia decided to shed her city life for good and become a permanent resident of Mentone, embracing the simple pleasures of rural life.
A hilarious montage followed her decision, depicting Sophia acclimating to farming chores, partaking in village fairs, and living a wholesome and fulfilling life alongside Alex.
Sophia's revamped Ferrari remains a constant, tangible reminder of the life-altering detour she had the good fortune of experiencing.
The endearing journey of Sophia and Alex unfolds, their lives filled with comic misadventures and instances of genuine joy amidst life's simplicity.
The film wraps up with a memorable scene where Sophia, Alex, and the entire village share a hearty laugh together.

title: Cosmic Sin
synopsis: In the year 2031, humanity establishes its first space colony on Mars.
By 2042, "the Alliance" world government has been formed and quantum propulsion technology allows humanity to travel beyond the Solar System.
The Mars colony fails in 2281 and the Alliance controls three colonies: Earth, Zafdie, and Ellora.
In 2519, Zafdie attempts to secede from the Alliance.
During the ensuing war, General James Ford drops a quantum bomb ("Q-bomb") on the rebel colony, killing 70 million people.
Ford is subsequently dishonorably discharged from the Alliance military and gains the sobriquet of "the Blood General."
His wife, Doctor Lea Goss, leaves him.
In 2524, miners of the Vander Mining Corp stationed on planet 4217LYA (Heracles System) encounter unseen aliens and Captain Juda Sayle reports an "FC incident" to Alliance Command.
On Earth, General Eron Ryle is notified of the incident and orders that Goss and Ford be brought to him.
At a local bar, Dash meets with Ford to discuss a potential job.
A fight between them and civilians is interrupted by Commander Marcus Bleck, who passes on Ryle's request for Ford's counsel.
Ford refuses but subsequently agrees upon the promise of him being reinstated and his military pension restored.
At McMillian Airfield military base, Ford and Dash meet with Goss and Ryle for a situation briefing.
Survivors of the FC incident are brought to the base for quarantine and questioning but quickly turn hostile and begin killing base personnel.

The survivors appear to be infected, do not respond to attempts at communication, appear unfamiliar with human technology (though they quickly learn how to operate  firearms), and "infect" several base personnel, who then themselves turn hostile.
The infected humans attempt to board a transport ship but are stopped and eliminated by Ryle, Ford, Dash, and several other soldiers.

While the Alliance Senate debates, Ryle authorizes Operation Cosmic Sin – with a strike team consisting of himself, Ford, Dash, Goss, Bleck, Specialist Braxton (Ryle's nephew), and technician Corporal Ardene (who is qualified to operate and arm a Q-bomb) – to launch a retaliatory and decisive counterstrike against the aliens.
Ardene reports that a tachyon pulse was released by one of the infected miners during the base attack, which will allow the aliens to know Earth's location in six or seven hours.
The team is outfitted with small arms, Icarus suits designed for combat and space environments, and a Q-bomb.
The team plans to travel to the Ellora colony via quantum jump, where Alliance forces have shot down an alien ship.
The team intends to recover the downed ship and analyze the cosmic radiation to locate the alien's home planet, then destroy it with the Q-bomb.

The team arrives at incorrect coordinates in orbit of planet Ellora, in the middle of a battle between Alliance and alien spacefleets, and is forced to conduct an  orbital drop through the space debris.
Ryle, Goss, Ford, and Dash go missing during the drop, and the remainder of the team comes under enemy fire almost immediately after landing, with Bleck being critically wounded.

Elloran survivors rescue the team and, after verifying the team is free of alien infection (infected persons cannot talk), the survivors reveal the aliens have invaded the planet and the area is swarming with alien troops and infected humans.
The survivors offer to treat Bleck at their outpost's medbay, and Ardene goes with them.
Meanwhile, Braxton, accompanied by sniper Sol Cantos, proceeds to the downed alien ship.
While analyzing the ship's radiation, Braxton's Icarus suit reports Ford as alive.
He and Sol Cantos recover Ford, who experiences several visions of the aliens and Goss while concussed, and the three reach the Alliance outpost.
At the outpost, Ardene views video log recordings that reveal the aliens are a hive mind that parasitically procreates by infecting victims, who then fall under the control of the hive mind.

Braxton gives the coordinates of the alien's home planet to Ardene, who reports the tachyon interference generated by the aliens means they cannot travel to the coordinates without first getting into orbit.
Meanwhile, Ford consoles then mercy kills the mortally wounded Bleck.
Dash is revealed to have survived and made his way to the outpost.
Ardene discovers the aliens have built a stabilized quantum space gate near Ellora that will allow the alien armada, currently in the Sigea galaxy, to invade the Milky Way in force.
The survivors plan to collapse the gateway with the Q-bomb by firing it via the outpost's orbital cannon.
While prepping the orbital cannon, Ardene receives a signal from Ryle, who has survived in orbit, albeit with his Icarus suit damaged and unfit for  reentry.
He volunteers to position himself on the gateway and trigger his suit's self-destruct to close the gate after the Q-bomb passes through.
The aliens converge on the outpost and speak through an infected Goss, mocking Ford, preaching the superiority of "the Sigea", and offering the chance for humankind's assimilation or death.
After Dash replies with a simple "no," the Sigea begin their attack while Goss boards a Sigea ship.
Ford latches onto the ship and later confronts the infected Goss as she prepares to cross via the completed space gate.
With the orbital gun charged, Ardene loads the Q-bomb into a missile and fires it at the gate.
Goss intercepts the Q-bomb missile in a stasis field, blows Ford into space, and crosses to join the assembled Sigea fleet, inadvertently releasing the bomb from the stasis field in the process.
Ryle positions himself on the space gate and, unable to trigger his suit's self-destruct, instead provides a target reference for the orbital gun.
Ardene, with Braxton's reluctant blessing, fires the gun on Ryle's position, killing him and destroying the gate.
The Q-bomb detonates on the other side of the collapsing gateway, the resulting black hole destroying the Sigea's fleet and home star system.
Braxton, stricken with grief over his uncle's death, kills the Sigea's field commander on Ellora.

Back on Earth, seven days after first contact, Braxton, Ardene, Sol Cantos, Dash, and Ford morosely celebrate in a bar as the Alliance Senate proudly declares that the remaining Sigea have unconditionally surrendered.
Ford takes a shot, sadly reminisces about Goss, and then abruptly leaves the bar.

title: Children of Saigon: The Attack Unleashed
synopsis: Framed by the bustling outdoor markets of Saigon, four close-knit childhood friends—Nhat, Bao, Hien, and Trang—commune together in their usual meeting place.
Their dreams, as diverse as the landscapes of Vietnam, are enthusiastically shared among them.
The harmonious chatter amongst the friends is abruptly silenced by a foreboding announcement from a nearby café's transistor radio about the growing political tensions of North and South Vietnam.
A brewing storm of war casts long, disheartening shadows over their innocent desires and aspirations.
Saigon's cityscape is quickly upended by a terrifying storm of a different kind as the North's bombardment transforms the tranquil boulevards into a hellish battlefront.
In the chaos, the friends are ripped apart, their strong bond temporarily severed - Trang is lost.
Resolute, the remaining three friends pledge to search for their missing companion.
Their crossfire-stricken exploration is interrupted when they discover Jake, an American soldier wounded in the initial bombardment.
Overcoming initial uncertainties and distrust, the group pillages the wreckage for emergency supplies.
Touched by their unexpected bravery, Jake pledges to utilize his military resources to aid their quest to find Trang.
Their journey intensifies, navigating dangerous territories and negotiating unseen threats.
Amidst their perilous quest, they unravel their respective histories, forming a bond transcending cultural and generational barriers.
They discover that Trang has been seized by a militant separatist group, sparking a dangerous detour in their expedition.
They leverage Jake's military knowledge to forge a daring rescue mission.
Their audacious rescue becomes a desperate fight for survival when Jake sustains critical injuries.
But they successfully rescue Trang, signifying their indomitable courage and resolve.
Bearing the scars of their ordeal, they return to Saigon, transformed by their harrowing encounters.
Jake, under the tender care of his new friends, recovers his strengths.
In return, he promises to narrate their tale of exceptional resolve, camaraderie, and enduring friendship to the world.
The story concludes with the group standing amidst the charred remains of their childhood sanctuary.
As Saigon continues to smolder under the threat of further attacks, the friends cling tenaciously to hope, dreaming of a safer and peaceful future.

title: Chase Dreams, Chase Love
synopsis: Liza, a resilient single mother surviving in a fast-paced urban environment, deals with the daily challenges of raising her eight-year-old daughter Emily.
After a quick goodbye to Emily, Liza rushes to the prestigious Solstice Law Firm, her employer for the past decade.
The esteemed Senior partner, Mr. Robinson, nods at her with an approving smile each time he crosses paths with her, driving her ambition further.
Their praises remind her of her long-trailed dream of becoming an attorney and fuels her passion to climb higher up the legal field.
On a frantic mid-week morning, she unintentionally bumps into Tom, a newly appointed partner staff, in the hallway.
The incident results in a perfectly brewed black coffee splattering all over his crisp white shirt.
Tom's initial irritation at the unfortunate event soon gives way to admiration when Liza maintains her composed demeanor.
They soon start interacting more often, discussing challenging case files during coffee breaks, engaging in fascinating legal banter, and exchange smiles that became more frequent and genuine.
The annual office Christmas party provided the perfect background for them to interact beyond boundaries of the office premises.
Amid clinks of champagne glasses and background jazz, they found a personal connection, a friendship that inched them closer.
This newly formed camaraderie grew stronger with time, strengthened by their shared experiences in the courtrooms and shared struggles against high profile cases.
One such evening, over a candlelight dinner at Bella Trattoria, a quaint Italian restaurant, they discovered more about each other's dreams.
Liza confessed her ambition to become an attorney, and Tom, intrigued by her potential, extended an offer to mentor her through the rigorous bar exam prep.
From then on, many nights were spent huddled over legal books in the law firm's vast library.
Civil and penal code books were sprawled across their study tables as they tirelessly practiced case arguments.
They worked together on a vital pro bono case - a challenging human rights case.
The stakes were high for their law firm reputation and this case pushed their legal expertise and resolve to its zenith.
Every late-night study session, every case analysis created a mutual attraction - an unplanned, unspoken companionship that was more than just two colleagues studying together.
However, amidst this growing relationship, Liza never let her professional ambitions be swayed; she remained resolute, allowing her relationship to exist alongside her professional aspirations.
During one archival research, Liza found a potent piece of evidence, something that could potentially undermine their entire case.
This revealing moment amplified her stress and created a moral dilemma at a time of her preparing for the approaching bar exam.
Swallowing the fear of what this revelation might lead to, she decides to speak with Tom.
She confronts Tom, revealing this potentially game-changing secret that threatened to flip the course of their case, and in an unintended consequence, their relationship.
The fallout was detrimental; their relationship, which was based on trust, took a hit.
She now found herself dealing with a postponed bar exam and a broken relationship; her world was collapsing onto her.
The court day of their pro bono case came, filled with harsh interrogations and a stern and formidable judge.
Despite their carefully crafted defense, they lost, leading to an immense blow to the firm's reputation and Liza's morale plummeted.
It felt like an end to her upwardly ascending trajectory in the law community.
Amid this disheartening chaos, Liza received the result for her bar exam.
She had passed and was now an attorney, an unexpected turn in the otherwise storm of events.
This validation of her qualification became a turning point for Liza, who decided she would not sacrifice her dream for anything, not even a romantic relationship.
Determined to rise higher, Liza drew strength from her newly acquired qualification.
She was an attorney now, and she had every skill to command respect and admiration in the legal world.
Tom, reconsidering his hard stance, decided to let his anger pass.
Reflecting on Liza's predicament, he decided to approach her.
They decided to appeal their pro bono case together.
Armed with the much-discussed evidence, they attempted to reverse the judgment once again.
Liza successfully unveiled the evidence, ultimately leading to a much-sought-after legal victory.
Celebratory joy permeated in Solstice Law Firm.
The happiness in the room felt palpable as Liza cemented her place as a strong attorney, an achiever, a survivor.
The bond between Tom and Liza solidified in the face of shared adversities.
They survived this challenge together and emerged stronger.
Liza balanced her personal life with Tom and Emily and her professional life as an attorney.
Liza drops off Emily at school.
Emily's eyes beamed with pride looking at her mom before rushing to her school bus.
Tom watched her from a corner with admiration and love in his eyes.
Emily felt proud of her mother.
Liza was not just an attorney or a loving mother; she was a real-life superhero for Emily.
With her lawyer's badge and an exceptional problem-solving skill, Liza became the go-to attorney for all high-profile cases.
The higher the stakes, the harder Liza worked.
She continued growing as an attorney, she was relentless.
The newly formed family, Liza, Tom, and Emily, often spent quality time over celebrations and food at Bella Trattoria, meticulously carving a beautiful family bond.
Tom appreciated Liza's relentless spirit and boundless courage, his warm affection reflected in his eyes.
Emily, inspired by her mother, decided to follow in her mother's footsteps.
The story concludes leaving the audience with a powerful message - perseverance, hard work, and self-belief can transform one's dreams into reality.

title: Carmen Sandiego: To Steal or Not to Steal
synopsis: While attempting to steal from a V.I.L.E.
building in Shanghai, Carmen learns that her friends, Zack and Ivy, have been kidnapped by V.I.L.E., and The Faculty threaten to brainwash them into becoming V.I.L.E.
henchmen unless Carmen steals some objects for them.
Carmen receives a tip from Player that Zack and Ivy are being held captive in a moving van outside the building.

If Carmen attempts to rescue Zack and Ivy from the van, she discovers it was a ploy and Zack and Ivy are brainwashed, and the Chief appearing onscreen and she forces the viewer to go back and agree to steal for V.I.L.E.
in order to continue the episode.
For the first task, Coach Brunt tells Carmen to steal a soldier from the Terracotta Army in Xi'an, China.
While Carmen is outside the dig site, she runs into Tigress, who has been sent to aid Carmen in the mission.
They enter an underground tunnel and fall into a booby trap, which Carmen escapes and has the choice of saving Tigress from the trap or leaving her in the pit.
Carmen enters the chamber to steal a terracotta statue, which is picked up by The Cleaners in a helicopter just as two guards enter the chamber.

If Carmen hitches a ride into the helicopter, the guards grab her feet after she has climbed up the statue and the combined weight causes the statue to fall and break, angering Coach Brunt and leading to Zack and Ivy's brainwashing.
If Carmen instead hides among the statues, she eludes the guards and escapes from the chamber.
Dr. Saira Bellum and Countess Cleo vie to direct Carmen's next task.
Carmen is allowed to choose who she steals for first, but not before being allowed to speak to Zack and Ivy and taking a photo of them in their prison.
She sends the photo to Player, who uses it to find out where their location is.
Cleo sends Carmen to Monte Carlo, Monaco to make off with some expensive Beluga caviar from a charity gala.
At the event, where Mime Bomb is performing, Carmen locates A.C.M.E.
Agent Julia Argent, who had been tipped off about the stolen terracotta warrior and V.I.L.E.
's plan to steal the eggs.
Carmen can either trust Julia with the truth that she is stealing for V.I.L.E.
or trick Julia by leading her up to the roof and then locking her on the roof of the building while she steals the caviar.
She then sees that the waiters are about to plate the caviar and is given the option to sneak the caviar out and escape with it later or to grab all the caviar tins and immediately escape with them.
If Carmen decides to stash the eggs, she is interrupted by Mime Bomb choking on the hors d'oeuvres.
She saves him with the Heimlich maneuver, but when she enters the kitchen, the eggs have already been removed from their tins, leaving them with one day until they expire.
She still escapes with them, but Cleo declares Carmen to have failed since the caviar was exposed and will only last for one day and Zack and Ivy are brainwashed.
If Carmen decides instead to grab the cart of tins and dash out with them, she successfully flies out of the gala with the caviar fresh.
Dr. Bellum instructs Carmen to travel to Hell Creek, Montana to steal a Tyrannosaurus rex bone with tissue still intact.
Once Carmen arrives and locates the bone, she can choose to either recruit El Topo or Le Chevre to help her escape.
Once inside the museum where the bone is kept, she discovers that A.C.M.E.
agents have surrounded the building and will be entering the museum in a moment.

If Carmen attempts to hide from the A.C.M.E Agents and wait for the coast to be clear, she will try to hide inside a model dinosaur, but it will collapse from Carmen's weight and Carmen is caught and forced to flee without the bone, resulting in the bone likely being moved from the museum by the A.C.M.E.
agents and Zack and Ivy being brainwashed.
If Carmen makes a run for the lab to steal the bone, she escapes through the air duct and secures the bone for Dr. Bellum with El Topo or Le Chevre helping her make a hasty escape from the museum.
After the second task, Carmen checks in with Zack and Ivy again and takes another photo.
She and Player deduce that Zack and Ivy are being held within the Arctic Circle.
Carmen can choose to either attempt to rescue Zack and Ivy or proceed with V.I.L.E.
's third task.
If Carmen chooses to rescue Zack and Ivy early, Tigress helps her into the facility where they are held if Carmen saved her from the pit booby trap.
Carmen saves Zack and Ivy, but V.I.L.E.
keeps the items that she stole for them.

If Carmen left Tigress to find her own way out of the pit, Tigress refuses to let Carmen into the facility and presses the emergency lock and shut down button and Carmen is forced to take a longer route which leads to Zack and Ivy being brainwashed.
They initially appear fine and go out for ice cream with Carmen, but then are ordered to capture her when V.I.L.E.
activates their brainwashing, forcing the viewer to start the whole story over or to help Tigress instead.
If Carmen takes up both Cleo and Bellum's tasks, V.I.L.E.
arranges for Carmen to board a ferry to the Île d'Oléron, where Zack and Ivy have been relocated in exchange for the items she stole.
At the airport, she runs into Julia and asks for her help.
If Carmen had tricked Julia in Monaco, Julia refuses to help and Carmen is forced to rescue her friends all by herself.
V.I.L.E.

captures Carmen when she gets off the ferry by shooting a knock out dart and brainwash her along with Zack and Ivy, which Carmen had surmised was their plan all along, and the faculty also keep and use the stolen items for their own nefarious purposes, causing the viewer to start over the story or to trust Julia.

If Carmen had trusted Julia, she agrees to pose as Carmen on the ferry while the real Carmen rescues Zack and Ivy and escapes with them in the same helicopter that the terracotta warrior was taken in.
Carmen delivers the items she stole to Julia's doorstep so they can be returned to their rightful places.

Upon finding either good ending, a bonus scene will be unlocked, with all of the cast members but the Chief and Carmen herself singing the theme song from the 1990s Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego?
game show.
The end credits roll over an instrumental version of the theme to another 1990s animated Carmen series, Where on Earth Is Carmen Sandiego?

title: You Should Have Left
synopsis: Theodore Conroy is a retired banker married to Susanna, a much younger woman, and they have a daughter named Ella.
Theo is a jealous husband and constantly fears Susanna, a successful Hollywood actress, is cheating on him.
The family books a vacation in Wales, but there is something strange about the house—time passes unusually fast, and everybody experiences nightmares while staying there.
The couple also discovers that neither one of them made the booking, each thinking the other did it.
One night, Ella sees the shadow of a man on the wall.
The next morning, she asks Susanna why people dislike Theo.
Susanna reluctantly explains that Theo's first wife drowned in the bathtub, and people suspected that he killed her, though he was acquitted at trial.
While in town for supplies, the shopkeeper asks if Theo has met Stetler, who Theo presumes is the home owner.
He mysteriously gives Theo a drafting triangle and tells him to measure the right angles, leaving Theo confused.
Theo wrestles with feelings of jealousy and mistrust toward Susanna.
One evening, while she is taking a bath, Theo checks the messages on her phone and laptop.
Theo has a dream that night and sees someone has written in his meditation journal: "You should leave.
Go now."
The following morning, as he watches Susanna and Ella playing outside, he texts her.
At the same time he sees Susanna look at her phone, he hears a text vibration on the kitchen counter and finds an identical phone with his messages on the screen.
Realizing that she has a secret phone, he suspects she has been cheating on him.
He confronts Susanna, and she admits to an affair with another actor.
Theo asks her to leave for the night, and she goes into town to stay at an inn.
He returns to his journal to see that someone has now written “You should have left.
Now it’s too late.” Upon discovering an anomaly in the angle between the wall and floor, they measure the kitchen and find that it is larger inside than outside.
Ella and Theo get separated; the two of them appear to be experiencing separate visions in the dream world.
Once reunited, Theo calls Susanna, wanting her to come back and take him and Ella away from the house, but her phone is turned off.
He then calls the shopkeeper, inquiring whether he knows of any cab services in the area.
The shopkeeper replies that there are none and speaks of the house cryptically, saying that the Devil collects souls from there.
Desperate to escape the house, Theo and Ella decide to go to town by foot, but see a shadowy figure observing them from inside as they walk away from it.
After some time, they find they have circled back to the house.
Seeing no other option, they stay there for the night, but Theo enters the dream world again and sees his and Susanna's past selves as they first arrived at the house.
He then meets Stetler, who has taken Ella captive.
He takes Theo's form to taunt him and says he will return Ella on the condition that Theo does "what he must."
Ella is returned, relieving Theo.
The next day, Susanna returns to the house, and Theo gives her Ella.

He finally confesses to the true circumstances surrounding the death of his first wife: he did not directly kill her, but did not help when she was drowning; he simply watched her die because he had been miserable with her for so long.
He accepts that he belongs in the house.

Theo's spirit is then seen trapped inside the house, revealing he had been the figure watching himself and Ella leave the night before, having tried to warn his past self by writing the messages in his journal.
The shopkeeper's voice says that some people do not leave the house and that "the place finds them anyway."

title: Split Lives
synopsis: Our story launches with the life of John, a recently divorced and hassled father of a demanding teenager and two energetic toddlers, who is trying to keep his head above water while handling his complicated corporate accounting job and the taxing demands of childcare that seemed to multiply every day.
John's best friends Mike and Rob suggest a solution.
They talk about hiring a professional massage therapist, Alex.
Alex turns out to be a young, vivacious, and unpredictable character with a side job of massage therapy which he does at odd hours.
Unaware of Alex's daring night profession, tired John decides to hire him.
Alex enters this new life, almost like a hurricane amidst a tornado.
The pandemonium tempers down his initial enthusiasm, and he is left questioning his decision.

From changing dirty diapers, to handling toddler tantrums in the most peculiar ways, to plain surviving in the house filled with vivacious energy, the first few days prove to be an unexpected roller coaster ride for Alex.
The comedy crescendos when Alex decides to try his hand at cooking dinner, an unplanned disaster strikes and we see an epic kitchen catastrophe with a perfectly fried calculator.
Despite the mishaps and wild tactics, Alex - with his sparkling personality and engaging nature, keeps the children engaged.
Winning the hearts of the children turns out to be a natural task for Alex, whose charm begins to seep into their affectionate hearts.
As the dynamics of the household begin to change, John also notices his stress levels reducing, thanks to the therapeutic effect of Alex's massages.
However, he can't help but start suspecting something off about Alex’s night job.
Alex's attempt to hide his wild costumes and bizarre props used for his night gig from curious kids adds to the comic tension.
The undercurrent of his secret life visible through late-night phone calls from clients, and awkward working hours begin to raise red flags for a suspicious John.
In an unforeseen turn, a close friendship slowly cultivates between Alex and the children, molded by a series of innocent pranks, shared laughter, and genuine bonding moments.
The plot thickens with a gripping twist when a curious John accidentally stumbles on a website revealing Alex’s secret night job.
Angered and feeling deceived, an explosive confrontation follows between John and Alex, leading to a hasty decision made by a panic-stricken John.
Losing Alex feels like having ripped a bandage off a wound for the house residents; children miss their play buddy and John, his stress-relieving massage.
On the other hand, Alex, having been abruptly thrown into a state of abandonment, goes back to his glamorous but solitary stage life while silently yearning for the din of John's home.
John soon finds himself grappling to balance his corporate responsibilities, alongside trying to fill the void left by Alex.
Seeing their dad struggle, the kids isolate themselves, setting the alarm bells ringing for John.
Amid all this, the craving for the stress-relieving session, the chasing laughter, the colorfully wild nature of Alex compelling John to confront his pride and prejudice.
Throwing aside societal norms and casting away his ego, John decides to request Alex to return.
Promising to navigate delicately around Alex's profession, John manages to convince the delighted Alex to return home.
With Alex back, life starts returning to normal.
While routines and chaos balance out, it's the laughter and Alex's flamboyant energy that is welcomed with open arms by children and John alike.

A family might not have formed in a traditional sense, but through layers of shared laughter, hidden secrets, and plain acceptance, we see the emergence of an eclectic group that derives joy from their drastically different lives.
As they navigate their irregular daily life, the climax presents itself in a flutter of laughter, signaling the odd yet comforting new family dynamics.
The movie reaches its end through a series of giggles from chaotic dinners, over-exaggerated bedtime stories, and shared laughter, showcasing the odd yet beautiful bonding between the characters.
The narrative ends on a broader note, reinforcing the message that families are not always linked by blood but nurtured by love, acceptance, and laughter.

title: Rosa's Escape (2020 film)
synopsis: Departing from the small town of Santa Ana in El Salvador, a brave and hopeful Rosa disembarks from her long United Airlines flight and steps foot into the foreign yet promising land of New York City.
Exiting JFK airport, she's greeted with the boisterous sounds of the city, ready for the journey that awaits her as she seeks asylum from her war-torn home country.
Rosa, her dark eyes a mirror reflecting fear and courage, is determined to leave behind the civil unrest ravaging her homeland and build a new life in the United States.
She finds solace in the immigrant community of the South Bronx, she's taken under the wing of a local community center where kind-hearted individuals offer her a chance to earn her living.
Rosa's peaceful existence shatters overnight when she becomes the newest target of 'Los Cazadores', a fearsome gang that preys upon vulnerable immigrants.
The specter of violence rears its ugly head again, cruelly plucking Rosa from her contentment, threatening her newfound freedom and stability.
Led by the cunning and merciless Gilberto Marquez, they snatch Rosa away, ready to use her lack of legal status to their advantage.
Marquez, with his cruel smile and cold eyes, presents Rosa with a horrifying proposition.
In his vile game, Marquez proposes a revolting bargain, pressuring Rosa into assisting with his illegal drug trafficking operations in exchange for her life.
Rosa denies Marquez's offer, valuing her hard-earned freedom over the deceptive promise of safety.
Her audacious refusal is met with vicious repercussions.
A careless mistake from her captors presents Rosa with a chance to escape.
On the run from the vicious 'Los Cazadores,' Rosa weaves her way through the labyrinth of concrete and steel that is New York City.
Her chase leads her into the world of Antonio Mendoza, a regretful ex-'Los Cazadores' member now leading the less perilous life as a cabbie.
Recognising the fear mirrored in Rosa's eyes, Antonio, fueled by the desire for atonement, offers to guide her through her tumultuous escape.
Together with Miguel, Rosa's steadfast friend from the community center, they form an alliance to topple their shared adversary - Marquez.
The trio hatches a high-risk plan to dismantle Marquez and his extensive criminal network.
They gather incriminating evidence against Marquez, hoping to end Marquez's reign of terror.
They manage to anonymously drop their compelling evidence at the 40th Precinct in the South Bronx.
Sensing their betrayal, Marquez retaliates with unbridled fury, turning their escape into a thrilling game of cat and mouse.
The immigrant community center morphs into their sanctuary, their final fortitude as Marquez strives to corner them.
Suddenly amid their anxious waiting, the shrill screaming sirens of NYPD patrol cars cut through the air.
Armed with their painstakingly collected evidence, the NYPD breaches their fortress, catalyzing chaos.
Amid the panic and confusion, their leaders evade capture, but their time is running short.
Amidst the frightening chaos and adrenaline-pumping action, NYPD officers maneuver through the gunfire, arresting the terrified, shocked Gilberto Marquez.
Rosa watches as Marquez, stripped of his power, is taken away by law enforcement.
Marquez's arrest sparks the systematic dismantling of his extensive criminal empire, bringing a sense of peace and relief to the South Bronx.
Rosa's asylum status is granted, securing her a permanent place in the country she risked everything to live.
United in adversity and bound by their past, Rosa and Antonio close their tormented past chapters and embrace a brighter, peaceful future.
Their survival story ends on a hopeful note, with Antonio proclaiming his newfound purpose in Rosa's inspiring fight for freedom.
Safely ensconced in their tranquil life, far from the nightmares they escaped, Rosa and Antonio work towards building a future free from violence.
Antonio's redemption story stands as a beacon of hope, portraying change, chance, and redemption, irrespective of one's past.
Their tale, ultimately, is a story of survival, change, and victory against adversity, bearing manifest to the unfaltering strength of the human spirit in the face of trials.
Rosa and Antonio's journey symbolizes a triumphant story of change, hope, and resilience.

title: Rotting in the Sun
synopsis: In Mexico City, Sebastián Silva is a depressed, ketamine-addicted artist and filmmaker contemplating suicide by taking pentobarbital.
His landlord and friend, Mateo, who is renovating Sebastián's apartment building, jokingly encourages his suicidal ideations.
Sebastián's long-suffering housekeeper, Verónica "Vero", is concerned about him and worries that the abusive Mateo might fire her, but Sebastián barely acknowledges her.
Sebastián travels to a gay nude beach, where he meets American comedian and social media influencer Jordan Firstman after nearly drowning.
A fan of Sebastián's work, Jordan is convinced that their chance meeting is a sign that the two should work together on Jordan's television project.
Jordan invites Sebastián to a party that night, where Jordan films Sebastián snorting ketamine and posts the video on his social media without Sebastián's permission.
When Jordan refuses to delete the video, Sebastián angrily admonishes Jordan for his vapidity and uninspired ideas.
Upon returning home, Sebastián has an online meeting with HBO executives, who reject his pitch.
He mentions Jordan's project, which piques the executives' interest.
He then contacts Jordan and agrees to work together; Jordan insists on moving in with him during their collaboration.
