Sebastián asks Vero to help him move a heavy couch from his rooftop storage space for Jordan to use.
As they lift the couch, Sebastián becomes distracted by Jordan's incessant phone calls and accidentally falls from the rooftop to his death.
Distraught, Vero covers his body and leaves for her niece's quinceañera in a daze, where she confesses the incident to her brother, Lalo.
Lalo insists that the police will never believe her, so the two wrap the body in a tarp and hide it in the storage space.
The next day, Jordan arrives at Sebastián's place, but is confused by Sebastián's absence.
Thinking Sebastián has ghosted him, Jordan claims on social media that he and Sebastián fell in love and that Sebastián was excited for his project and invited him to stay.
However, after finding Sebastián's phone and wallet inside the apartment one night, Jordan grows concerned and urges his followers to help him locate Sebastián.
Upon finding Sebastián's journals, which detail his suicidal thoughts and interest in pentobarbital, Mateo becomes fearful that he may be partially responsible for Sebastián's possible suicide.
Knowing that he left several incriminating voice messages on Sebastián's phone joking about the pentobarbital, Mateo expresses his concerns to his wife.
Overhearing their conversation, Vero obtains pentobarbital and plants the empty box in Sebastián's trash can.
Mateo sneaks into the apartment and threatens Vero for eavesdropping on him.
He steals Sebastián's phone and journals, which Vero witnesses.
Later, overwhelmed by stress and guilt, Vero breaks down in tears in front of Jordan, who comforts her, though the two cannot understand one another.
Sebastián's brother, Juan, sees Jordan's posts and arrives in Mexico to help figure out what happened to him.
The next day, the police arrive to investigate and find Sebastián's ketamine and the pentobarbital box.
Believing the suicide to be confirmed, the police then question Mateo about the drugs, saying that they will need to file a report.
Mateo panics and confesses that he took the journals and phone, only increasing suspicion against him.
Juan is distraught at his brother's seemingly confirmed death, and Jordan leaves at Mateo's insistence.
Mateo fires Vero for complying with the police's drug search.
In the park across the street, using a translation app on his phone, Jordan asks Vero if she witnessed Mateo steal Sebastián's journals and phone.
Vero confesses the truth into the phone, expressing remorse for her part in Sebastián's accidental death and hoping his family can find peace.
The app poorly translates her confession, leaving Jordan confused as Vero walks away with the bottle of pentobarbital in her hand.

title: West Coast Apprehension 2013
synopsis: Sarah Blackwood, a battle-hardened FBI agent based in Portland, Oregon, finds herself haunted by the aftermath of a personal disaster, having narrowly escaped death in a car bomb explosion.
On a seemingly ordinary day, Sarah receives a mysterious envelope containing a series of horrifying images revealing violent plans, marked by a cryptic wolf symbol.
Portland soon becomes a playground for unconventional crimes and high-end robberies, each marked with the wolf symbol.
She recognizes the wolf emblem tied to her past, bringing back traces of Anthony Lobo, her adversary assumed deceased.
A trusted colleague delivers the news that Anthony Lobo, the dreaded mastermind she thought was defeated, is causing the current chaos.
As fear threatens to overcome her, Sarah decides to confront it head-on, enlisting the help of Jacob Hayes, a new agent in the FBI.
They discover that Lobo plans to create widespread panic at the annual Christmas parade in downtown Portland.
The scale of the new crimes reminds her of her traumatic past, filling her with terror.
Their investigation uncovers a traitor within their ranks funneling top-secret information to Anthony Lobo.
Feeling betrayed, they decide to handle the predicament themselves.
The situation gets riskier when Sarah gets a threat over a call from Lobo, who taunts her and promises carnage at the city’s Christmas event.
Undeterred, Sarah and Jacob work tirelessly to piece together leads across the city.
At the annual Christmas parade, they spot Lobo among the crowd, beginning a high-stakes game of wits.
Sarah faces her lifelong nemesis in a final showdown.
With Lobo finally apprehended, Portland is safe.
The victory comes at a price, as Jacob falls severely injured in the confrontation.
The ordeal strengthens rather than breaks her, and Sarah promises to continue fighting against evil.
Haunted by her past, Sarah instead opts for resilience, finally making peace with her history.
Accepting her fear as part of her nature, she prepares for future trials and swears never to back down.
The film concludes with a stronger Sarah, readying herself for new challenges in her career.

title: Alien (film)
synopsis: The commercial towing spaceship Nostromo, owned and operated by the Earth mega-corporation Weyland-Yutani, is on a return trip to Earth hauling a refinery and twenty million tons of mineral ore, with a seven-member crew in stasis.
Detecting a transmission of unknown origin from a nearby planetoid, the ship's computer awakens the crew.
[14] Acting on standing orders from their corporate employers, they set out to investigate the transmission's source.

The Nostromo lands on the planetoid, and Captain Dallas (Tom Skerritt), Executive Officer Kane (John Hurt), and Navigator Lambert (Veronica Cartwright) set out to investigate the signal, leaving Warrant Officer Ripley (Sigourney Weaver), Science Officer Ash (Ian Holm), and Engineers Brett (Harry Dean Stanton) and Parker (Yaphet Kotto) behind on the ship.
Dallas, Kane, and Lambert discover that the signal is coming from a derelict alien spacecraft.
Inside they find the remains of a large alien creature whose ribs appear to have been broken outward from the inside.
Meanwhile, Ripley determines that the transmission is actually some type of warning rather than a distress signal.
Kane discovers a vast chamber containing thousands of eggs, one of which releases a creature that attaches to his face.
Rendered unconscious, Kane is carried back to the Nostromo.
Acting on improper orders from Dallas, Ash violates quarantine protocol by opening the airlock, allowing the exploratory team aboard.
After an unsuccessful attempt by Ash to surgically remove the creature from Kane's face, the crew discover that the creature's blood contains a corrosive acid.
The creature eventually detaches from Kane's face by itself and is later found dead.
The Nostromo leaves the planet and resumes its trip to Earth.
Kane awakens from his ordeal with some memory loss but no other apparent ill effects.
During the crew's final dinner before re-entering stasis, he chokes and convulses until a small alien creature bursts from his chest, killing him.
The creature escapes into the ship and, lacking conventional weapons, the crew attempts to locate and capture it by fashioning motion trackers, electric prods, and flamethrowers.
However, the Alien has grown at an unprecedented rate and is now eight feet tall with incredible strength and agility.
It attacks Brett and disappears with his body into an airshaft.
Dallas enters the airshaft network intending to force the Alien into an airlock, but it ambushes him.
When the others find no trace of Dallas, Lambert, realizing that the alien is aggressive and intent on killing the entire crew, implores the remaining crew members to escape in the ship's shuttle.
Ripley, now in command, explains that the shuttle will not support four people, and recommends that they continue with Dallas's plan of cornering and flushing out the Alien.
Accessing the ship's computer, Ripley discovers that Ash has been ordered to return the Alien to their corporate employers even at the expense of the crew's lives.
Ash then appears and attacks Ripley, but Parker and Lambert intervene, decapitating and impaling Ash, revealing him to be an android.
Ripley theorizes that the company wants the Alien for its weapons division.
Before they destroy his remains, Ash smugly predicts that the others will not survive the indestructible "perfect organism" that they are up against.

The three remaining crew members then agree to arm the Nostromo's self-destruct mechanism and escape in the shuttle, but Parker and Lambert are ambushed and killed by the Alien while gathering necessary coolant supplies.
Now alone, Ripley initiates the self-destruct sequence herself and heads for the shuttle with the crew's cat, but finds the Alien blocking her way.
She retreats and unsuccessfully attempts to abort the self-destruct, then returns to find the Alien gone and narrowly escapes in the shuttle as the Nostromo explodes.
As she prepares to enter stasis, Ripley discovers that the Alien has hidden aboard the shuttle.
She puts on a spacesuit and opens the shuttle's main door, causing explosive decompression which forces the Alien to the shuttle's open doorway.
She propels it out into space by shooting it with a grappling hook, but the gun catches in the closing door, tethering the Alien to the shuttle.
As it attempts to crawl into one of the engines, Ripley activates them and blasts the alien into space.
She then puts herself and Jones the cat into stasis and resumes the voyage back home.

title: Clandestine Affairs of the Ancient Priest (1999 film)
synopsis: Our narrative unfurls in the heart of Thebes, the magnificent ancient Egyptian metropolis teeming with life, its streets filled with chatter, swarming marketplaces, bronze statues, and towering stone edifices.

This bustling urban canvas becomes the vibrant backdrop of a royal fiesta, complete with jubilant musicians, entertaining jesters, and the mesmerizing spectacle of acrobats; it is within this lively scene that our main characters are introduced.

Power-driven King Akhenaten, a towering figure in elaborate royal attire; ethereal Queen Nefertiti, a regal beauty with sparkling eyes; and moralistic priest Amenhotep, an austere figure wearing the white robes of priesthood, are introduced in an engaging tableau of vivid colors and intricate design.

A significant subplot skilfully woven into the narrative is the burgeoning affection between Queen Nefertiti and priest Amenhotep, as their soft lingering touches, stolen glances, and secret smiles hint at feelings that dare not be expressed.

As the narrative progresses, the tension between King Akhenaten and Queen Nefertiti becomes apparent, as bitter arguments unfold within regal chambers, their cold stares and hot words betraying the growing rift between them.

The narrative takes an electrifying turn as Amenhotep and Nefertiti succumb to their forbidden emotions, initiating a secret affair that spans passionate, moonlit rendezvouses and stolen kisses in secluded corners within the grand city of Thebes.
Their incognito meetings take place in the hallowed sanctums of concealed temples under the protective cloak of night, away from prying eyes and the judgement of a conservative society.
A papyrus scroll becomes the silent witness to their love story, its fragile canvas imprinted with cryptic hieroglyphics that tell a tale of passion, desire, and an aching longing for freedom.
Their nightly assignations are kept secret under the watchful eye of towering, gold-painted pyramids, ancient symbols of power silently shielding their clandestine romance.

However, this tranquil phase shatters when a local tradesman, lost in the serpentine bylanes of Thebes, unsuspectingly stumbles upon one of their secret rendezvous, the shock and fear on his face mirrored in the couple's panic-stricken expressions.

Buzzing with the sting of a fresh rumor, the city of Thebes is thrown into disarray, as word of the secret affair spreads like wildfire, ensuring all gossip mills are generously fueled, and the tranquility is replaced by an unsettling chaos.
Intrigued by the stories wafting through the city’s streets, a seasoned royal guard, cunning and disciplined, decides to follow the amorous pair during their nocturnal wanderings.

As he witnesses the lovers in an intimate embrace, he must battle an internal conflict before making a choice – he chooses loyalty to his king and duty over his curiosity, ultimately informing King Akhenaten about the illicit tryst.

The disclosure of the affair sends a tidal wave of shock and incredulity through the intricately carved walls of the palace and into the heart of Thebes, draping the city in an unsettling hush dappled with hushed whispers and speculation.
The revelation incites a frenzied storm of disbelief and shock in the city, culminating in heightened drama and heightened consequences.
Enraged, King Akhenaten, his face contorted with the sting of betrayal, orders a city-wide search for Amenhotep, who by now has become a fugitive in his own city.

An adrenaline-charged chase scene follows, with the priest using his thorough knowledge of Thebes' maze-like streets to evade the king’s trusted warriors, turning corners with sharp agility and darting through shadowy lanes.

Simultaneously, Queen Nefertiti, shrouded in a heavy cape, sneaks out of her grandeur-filled chambers and journeys into the heart of the largest pyramid, where she intends to retrieve the encoded love letter.
She blazes a trail through the labyrinthine passages of the pyramid, deftly escaping the deadly, hidden traps that punctuate her precarious path.

As the peak of the dramatic narrative wanes, Amenhotep barely manages to escape the city outskirts, where Nefertiti awaits him with a chariot drawn by sturdy horses—an escape planned under the cover of darkness.
They embark on an exhilarating journey through the sweeping expanse of Egyptian desert, a daunting escape marked by galloping horses and roiling dust clouds.
Pursued relentlessly by Akhenaten’s formidable guards, they display remarkable horsemanship, evading their pursuers whilst also steering clear of the treacherous desert predators.
Following days of arduous travel, they gratefully find respite at an unmarked oasis surrounded by towering date palms, its tranquility a stark contrast to the adrenaline-filled journey preceding it.
Beneath the endless star-studded Egyptian night sky, they decode the inscribed love story from the papyrus, a poignant scene of shared memories and unspoken promises.
They allow a deep sleep to overcome them as they lie cocooned by the cool desert sand, the crescent moon their only sentinel.
Reinvigorated and audacious, the lovers decide to return to Thebes, unaware of the desperate orders Akhenaten is issuing for a final, thorough city-wide search for them.
In broad daylight, under the hot Egyptian Sun's ceaseless gaze, they resolutely stand together before an awestruck royal court, bravely challenging convention and fate.

In an incredibly emotional moment, they unroll their shared love story documented in hieroglyphics, reading it aloud before King Akhenaten and the entire court, causing an unexpected silence to descend within the grand hall.
A palpable pause engulfs the room as King Akhenaten, stroking his royal beard, contemplates the brave confession, his stern face softening into thoughtfulness.

In a sudden twist of events and displaying unexpected leniency, King Akhenaten defies his own raging sentiments and the societal norms, granting Amenhotep and Nefertiti a life in exile, away from the city that witnessed their love and betrayal.
With their eyes glistening with relief, the lovers humbly thank Akhenaten, each of them silently promising the other to cherish this unexpected second chance.
Back in Thebes, life slowly course-corrects to its usual rhythm, the scandal gradually being absorbed into the city’s multilayered chronology.
Distance from the city gives them the chance to create a new home in a forgotten corner of Egypt, far from Thebes’ political fervor and its buzzing populace.
As they lay foundations for their new abode, panoramic shots reveal verdant landscapes, rolling streams, and golden sunset-lit palm fronds creating an idyllic backdrop for their humble sanctuary.
In the final scene of the film, Amenhotep and Nefertiti, their silhouettes set against the setting sun, stare at their newfound haven, a beacon of peace amidst a troubled past.

Their smiles, now free of fear and harboring dreams of a better future, beautifully frame their faces as they savor the consequences of their perilous journey- a peaceful existence in the lap of nature, far from the bustling city of Thebes.
They develop a new routine of relaxed nights around the warm fire, filled with stories of past bravery, hearty laughter, and dreams of a calm future.
Their exile compels them to grow their own food, cook meals over an open flame and share responsibilities, all of which contribute to a deepening of their bond.
Overtime, what begins as a modest shelter gradually transforms into their cherished sanctuary, where they greet the rising sun on the horizon hand-in-hand.
Their love unfolds through quiet whispers, through gentle touches of reassurance, and shared moments under the moonlight marveling at Egypt's star-filled skies.
Days washed in overflowing sunlight seamlessly pass into tranquil moonlit nights with the only constant being their lives remaining unfettered of the machinations of their past in Thebes.
The concluding moments of the film portray their enduring love story, carrying a message that would echo through the golden expanses of Egypt, leaving permanent imprints in the shifting sands.

Their secluded existence goes on, oblivious to the inspiration they become and remain to this day - a tribute preserved within the walls of an aging pyramid, and engrained in the whispering winds of Thebes.

The final shot of the film features their humble dwelling, basking peacefully in the warm glow of the setting sun, symbolizing their hard-won serenity and unwavering love, reaffirming their belief in the supreme power of love.

title: Sleepwalker's Lament
synopsis: The narrative unfolds in the frost-bitten, hushed town of Eugene, Oregon in the icy grips of winter in 1995.
The narrative starts in an ivy-clad Victorian household, surrounded by a deafening silence, punctuated only by the whimpering of a child.
Here, Ethan, a blond-haired four-year-old angel, huddles helplessly under his bed late one frosty night; his limbs crippled, his voice a pained whisper.
The disturbing scene of her whimpering brother is discovered by Emily, Ethan's six-year-old sister.
Chilled to the bone with the unfolding of a horrifying inexplicability, Emily's initial shock morphs into a resolute determination to uncover the ghastly mystery of her brother's condition.
Driven by a personal quest, Emily heads towards a future with a specialized focus on sleep disorders in her formative years.

Emily's life takes an unexpected turn when she receives a frantic call from a terrified mother in Salem, whose son’s sleepwalking episodes are reminiscent of the spine-chilling narratives of Ethan's past.
Touched by the heartfelt plea, Emily feels the weight of the challenge ahead.
Yet, her resolve to help remains unshakable.
With a strengthened resolve, Emily commences her voyage of intervention and exploration.
As Emily delves deeper into the intricacies of the afflicted child's psyche, a string of terrifying episodes unfurls.
Skirting at the edge of rationale, Emily's investigation takes a daunting turn.
She contemplates the potential intervention of a supernatural force behind the terrifying sleepwalking episodes.
Moved by an overwhelming determination to protect the boy and unravel the truth, Emily decides to induce sleepwalking within herself.
As sleep envelops her, Emily experiences an uncharted realm tickling her consciousness.
Emily finds herself walking the unfamiliar, spectral terrains.
Despite the bone-chilling fear, Emily trudges forward.
As Emily progresses further, she learns about the spirit’s resentment.
Emily’s journey into the spectral realms and the downward spiral into her own family’s tragedy results in empathising with the spirit.
Inside the phantasmal realm, Emily discovers an unexpected silver lining.
She finds a channel of communication opening up between her and Ethan.
Emily begins to empathise with the spirit.

As Emily realises that the spirit's torment and curse were bound by the memories of the spirit's heinous experiences of familial betrayal and abuse, Emily and Ethan pledge to honour and remember the spirit.
As the resonance of their promise reverberates through the spectral expanse, Emily finds herself jolted awake from her induced sleepwalking.
Emily begins her mission to implement the discoveries from her spectral quests.
Each day, Emily immerses herself to apply the newfound practices and strategies.
Alongside her endeavouring to heal affected children, Emily also begins to mend her frayed bond with Ethan.
Their shared trauma, once a curse, slowly becomes the catalyst that was imperative to healing their once strained bond.
Running parallel to Emily’s growing success in her professional life, her personal life also begins to bloom.
The relationship with Ethan, once strained and disconnected, begins to flourish, marked with shared understanding and empathy.
Emily evolves into a beacon of hope.
Emily emerges with a newfound identity – a courageous healer, determined to battle the vengeful spirit and aid the afflicted children battling sleepwalking disorders.
They begin to unearth buried feelings, echoing sentiments of shared trauma that they had silently borne in their respective hearts.
Emily's unwavering pursuit of truth and healing rescues not just the sleepwalking children but also brings Ethan back from his self-exile.
Emily’s refusal to surrender to fear paves the path to peace, understanding, and healing in an otherwise tormented landscape that had only know suffering.
Emily’s transformative journey touches not just her immediate circle of influence, but reaches out far beyond.
Word of her success spreads throughout the city of Eugene, and her influence expands.
The narrative embodies a tale of empathy, resilience, and redemption from adversity.
It celebrates the raw human grit and the power of familial unity that serves as the driving forces of healing.
With her encounters in the spectral realm and her realization of therapeutic powers, Emily emerges as a hero that the afflicted sleepwalkers desperately needed.
The film reaffirms the belief that fear can only dominate us until we muster the courage to face it.
Emily's courageous confrontation with the vindictive spirit serves as a testament to this.
Ethan and Emily’s shared tale underlines the importance of preserving familial bonds through trials.
It amplifies the healing power that unity can provide.
Packed with emotional depth, fear, courage, resilience, hope, and a tale of recovery, the narrative gives a gripping cinematic experience.
The unraveling of the mystery of the sleepwalking curse, Emily's dangerous expeditions through the spectral realm, and her resilient spirit converge to sculpt a unique cinematic narrative.

title: Connecticut Crush: Smooth Moves, Tough Age
synopsis: Under the warm, inviting sun, our tale is set in the peaceful suburban neighborhood of Hartford, Connecticut.
The center of our narrative is Billy Turner - a 12-year-old boy.

We observe Billy engrossed in timeless childhood pleasures - playing fetch with his faithful Golden Retriever named Daisy, pedaling his bicycle along narrowing streets framed by towering maple trees, and spending quiet afternoons fishing by the gentle stream, his laughter rippling through the air blending with the trickling sound of water.
One sparkling Saturday, a lively block party brings the usually calm Elm Street alive with eager activity.
Enticed by the infectious joviality, Billy attends the party, his big round eyes wide with wonder.
Amid the smoky barbecue scent and loud laughter echoing through the air, he finds himself captivated by Melissa Meyer.
His gaze fixates on the gracefully elegant woman in her late twenties from the moment he sets his eyes on her.
The charisma she exudes due to her city-bred confidence engulfs Billy in an unprecedented whirlpool of feelings.
Being a sophisticated attorney straight from the bustling city of New York, Melissa adorns the quiet suburban block with a cosmopolitan aura that naturally magnetizes the naive Billy towards her.
Overwhelmed by this alien sensation, Billy dares to approach her.
He offers Melissa a marriage proposal - spontaneous and innocent.
Melissa, taken by surprise, bursts into laughter and gently declines his proposal.
This gentle refusal punches Billy's heart like a crushing blow.
Rejection washes over his innocence, and he flees from the laughter-filled party, abandoning the utopia he has held so dear.
Desperate for understanding, Billy confides in his older brother, John - a charismatic artist famed for his charm with women.
John, as a responsible elder brother, takes it upon himself to tutor Billy.
His unique curriculum centers around the art of dealing with older women with finesse and grace.
Even as Billy follows his brother's advice diligently, we see Melissa battling her stressful city life.
Her demanding corporate lawyer job, the emotional turmoil of a painful break-up, and the society-inflicted apprehension of nearing thirty hold her captive in constant stress.
On his mission to win Melissa's heart, Billy unknowingly becomes a regular visitor to her life.
His innocent antics offer her a comic respite from her cookie-cutter life, lifting her spirits in an unexpectedly delightful way.
Billy's persona, under the guiding hand of John, starts undergoing changes.
Observing these gradual changes in Billy, Melissa finds herself amused.
As the relationship between Billy and Melissa burgeons, a protective instinct awakens in her.
She looks at him fondly, more like an elder sister rather than a romantic interest, desperately wishing to preserve his innocence against the harsh light of heartbreak.
Billy, blinded by his so-called love, misunderstands her protectiveness as romantic feelings and proposes to Melissa again.
This time around, the rejection hits Billy harder.
He hangs on the event's edges, left alone to grapple with his deeper heartache.
A dejected Billy distances himself from Melissa, retreating into isolation to mend his bruised heart.
His departure leaves Melissa facing an unexpected void, which she hadn't anticipated.
Reflecting on their interaction, Melissa decides to mend her relationship with Billy.
She offers him a crystal-clear explanation of their life's significant disparities and suggests they should be friends.
Freshly hurt Billy dismisses her olive branch immediately.
In his absence, Melissa gets an insight into Billy's simplistic view of life.
As the pain of his unrequited love eases with time, Billy embarks on a journey of self-awareness.
He realizes his infatuation for Melissa was merely a stepping stone into his adolescence.
Embracing this newfound wisdom, he accepts Melissa's offer of friendship.
His acceptance comes from a place of maturity, not as a consolation prize for his lost love.
As our story gradually unfolds, we find Billy and Melissa at another lively neighborhood party on Elm Street.
Only this time, they appear as friends, no longer hostage to Billy's romantic pursuit.
They share a dance, a casual two-step - a symbol of their friendship.
Their dance subtly hints at a bond beyond societal expectations and norms, a testament to their mutual respect and adoration.
Throughout the story, we witness Billy navigating through the maze of love, overcoming the agony of rejection, progressing from the cocooned world of boyhood to the complex world of adolescence.
In contrast, Melissa manages to rekindle her connection with the youthful innocence she had misplaced amidst her adult responsibilities.
She learns to ease her overbearing adult consciousness and starts discovering joy in the simple things in life.
Our story thus revolves around an unexpected friendship that smudges the distinctive lines of societal norms, a narrative where age and maturity become blurred lines of reference.
It outlines a refreshing side of first love, imbued with the melodrama of adolescence, the poignant reality of unrequited love, and the sweet simplicity of friendship.
This story inquires into a young boy's hurried plot to steer towards adulthood while tracing a woman's journey of unlearning her engrossed adult seriousness to embrace the carefree joys of youth.
As the plot unfolds, both characters become surfaces of emotional evolution - their parallel journeys generating lessons of self-discovery, love, and the myriad layers of maturity.
Billy's transformation from being a naive boy to a well-rounded young man capable of treading life's intricacies forms a compelling arc within the tale.
Equally engaging is Melissa's transformation from an overburdened adult to a woman who finds solace and happiness in Billy's uncomplicated world.
The lives of these two characters, though separate, cross several times, weaving a fulfilling narrative tapestry full of drama, humor, and emotional growth.
The conclusion beautifully encapsulates their enduring friendship and personal growth, symbolized by a harmonious dance between Billy and Melissa.
Titled "Connecticut Crush: Smooth Moves, Tough Age,", the movie weaves an emotionally resonant narrative.

title: Dashcam (horror film)
synopsis: Annie Hardy, an American musician and conservative conspiracy theorist, livestreams from her car, creating music using comments from the live chat as lyrics.
Tired of pandemic restrictions and homelessness in Los Angeles, she flies to London to visit her friend and former bandmate, Stretch, a food delivery driver.
Stretch’s girlfriend, Gemma, clashes with Annie over politics and COVID-19.
Annie accompanies Stretch on a delivery job, antagonizing restaurant owners with her anti-mask views.
Returning home, Annie refuses to remove her MAGA hat, prompting Gemma to attack her.
Overhearing Gemma urging Stretch to kick her out, Annie steals Stretch’s car and phone and takes a delivery job for him.
She arrives at a closed restaurant, but the owner offers her money to transport an elderly woman, Angela, to an address.
Angela soils herself, forcing them to stop at a diner where Annie discovers an Ariana Grande tattoo on Angela’s stomach.
A woman enters, looking for Angela, and attacks Annie, who flees the diner with Angela.
Stretch tracks Annie down via the livestream and forces his way into the car.
They argue and pull over, and Angela vanishes.
Stretch finds her standing atop a tree in a nearby forest, falls trying to reach her, and Angela floats to the ground.
The woman from the diner returns with a shotgun and attempts to kill Annie and Stretch, who escape in the car with Angela.
They learn that Angela's mouth is stapled shut from under her mask.
Annie and Stretch attempt to flag down a passing car, which hits Stretch.
The driver is the woman from the diner, who reveals she is Angela’s mother, revealing that Angela is actually sixteen and shows a photo of her with the same tattoo.
Annie tries to drive away in the mother’s car but crashes and is attacked.
With Stretch’s help, Annie traps the mother’s arm in the steering wheel and snaps it.
Angela appears, rips her mother’s head off, and pursues Annie and Stretch.
Angela chases Annie and Stretch to an abandoned amusement park.
There, Angela kills Stretch.
Annie escapes in a car, but Angela causes her to crash.
Angela pushes the car into a lake with her powers, but Annie traps Angela in the car and escapes.
Annie finds a remote house and realizes it’s the destination she was supposed to take Angela.
Inside the house, Annie finds occult symbols and cult members who kill themselves.
Angela attacks Annie, but Annie kills her with a knife.
A creature emerges from Angela’s mouth and chases Annie.
Annie kills the creature with her keyboard.
She then collapses in Stretch’s car and starts a livestream where she raps about her experiences.

title: The Expat
synopsis: The film "The Expat - Revenge in a Foreign Land," starts within the bleak, harsh confines of Her Majesty's Prison Belmarsh, an infamous British penitentiary known for housing high profile criminals.
The film's protagonist, a man named Carter, is introduced right off the bat.
Inside the sinister confines of the prison, he withstands his release procedures after serving a lengthy ten-year sentence.
Carter, a formidable ex-MI6 agent and British Army officer, walks into the outside world.
Using clever filmmaking through a series of insightful flashback sequences during the release proceedings, the audience slowly learns of Carter's past.
Released into the world that feels unfamiliar after his decade-long isolation, Carter embarks on a journey to start afresh.
His immediate destination is the metropolis of New York in the United States.
The transition of Carter from a renowned British spy into a struggling American civilian forms an intriguing subplot.
The story takes a tragic turn as we learn about Carter's personal loss - Emma, his only daughter, had been brutally murdered during his time in prison.
Overcome with skepticism towards the hastily knitted story of Emma's death, Carter decides to investigate the case himself.
Applying his skills, Carter scrutinises the NYPD's official reports regarding Emma's death.
These discrepancies indicate an intricate cover-up.
Unyielding and supremely focused, Carter employs his intelligence prowess to methodically decipher the mysterious events that led his daughter to her early grave.
As he delves deeper into the mystery, a chilling revelation comes to surface.
Emma had somehow become tangled with the famed Bronx-Kings Cartel, a notorious criminal organization ruling New York's underworld.
This shocking revelation leads Carter down a rabbit hole of deception and danger.
Furthering the complexity, Carter uncovers his daughter's baffling relationship with Rafael Serrano, the cartel's dangerous boss.
But his tenacity encounters strong resistance from the NYPD.

With his growing suspicion about the precinct's integrity and their repeated obstructive actions, Carter’s instincts tell him that the Bronx-Kings Cartel has severely compromised local law enforcement.
Undeterred by the mounting layers of danger and intrigue, Carter's fearlessness is unparalleled as he descends deeper into the corrupt and perilous underworld of New York.
His relentless pursuit uncovers a staggering truth.
Carter's tireless investigations eventually reveal a shocking truth: Emma had purposefully won the affections of the notorious gang leader, Rafael.
Armed with newfound evidence, Carter reaches out to a trustworthy ally back in his homeland, George Sutter, a former comrade and currently an active MI6 operative.
Bolstered with irrefutable evidence, Carter plans to dismantle the corrupt precinct and wreak havoc upon the Bronx-Kings Cartel.
The plot races towards an explosive climax where the cold and calculating Carter, utilising his military expertise and keen strategic insights, takes on Serrano's Cartel.
Carter's mission becomes clear: To decimate the cartel from its roots, as a tribute to Emma's bravery.
Emotions run wild as a ruthless battle ensues.
The suspense heightens, and the pressure mounts as Carter ingeniously uses the enemy’s tactics against them, leveraging his battle-hardened experience.
Despite all odds, Carter stands firm against the barrage of violence, and in an adrenaline-filled sequence he manages to blow the Bronx-Kings Cartel a devastating blow.
The film moves towards resolution displaying the shattered remains of the once formidable Bronx-Kings Cartel.
The nefarious officers hiding behind the façade of the NYPD uniform are stripped of their honour, forced to meet the consequences of their actions.
As a result, sweeping change graces the NYPD, leading to a large-scale cleanup and overhaul initiated by righteous forces inside the law enforcement community.
On the other side of this tumultuous battle, Carter finds vindication.
Despite the emotional toll of his journey, Carter makes the decision to stay in the city he’s rid from major corruption.
Carter develops a sense of calm amidst the concrete jungle.
As the story begins to wind down, we see Carter embodying a guardian angel's role.
As the movie draws closer to its end, we find the process of Carter's emotional healing delicately blossoming within him.
Subtle details suggest his shift towards a new vocation dedicated to serving and protecting his new home from any potential threats.
Living with his invisible scars, Carter emerges triumphant, standing tall against adversity; the city now sings praises of its new protector.
Post the clash with the mafia, the metropolis starts its healing process.
Carter's tale evolves from merely a story of revenge; it turns into a promise - a promise of an enduring battle against the corruption that lurks in the city's shadows.
The final scenes capture Carter's unyielding vow to continue his vigil, his dedication towards protecting New York, his new-found home.
His transformation from an unfamiliar outsider to the city's defender is a compelling narrative of an extraordinary character's journey.
He starts to find solace in serving New York, dedicated to safeguarding it from future criminal enterprises and threats.
The final shot features Carter, standing tall and lone against the NYC skyline, now his domain, embracing his new role with stern resolve.

title: Hubie Halloween
synopsis: In Salem, Massachusetts, Hubie Dubois, a kind but dimwitted and cowardly delicatessen employee, is bullied by most of the city, and the victim of many practical jokes.
He has annoyed police sergeants Steve Downey, Blake and Father Dave for ages.
Hubie spends his Halloweens monitoring the city as the official Halloween Helper.

The day before Halloween, Hubie meets his strange new neighbor Walter Lambert, and news spreads around town about Richie Hartman, a convict and childhood friend of Hubie who has absconded from a local mental institution.
On Halloween day Hubie, working as Halloween Monitor, investigates Walter's home after hearing strange noises.
Reporting this to the police, he is "recruited" by Downey as an "AUU" (auxiliary undercover unit).
Hubie believes this assignment is genuine, but it is really just something Steve tells Hubie in hopes it will refrain Hubie from bothering him.
Hubie goes to a local Halloween party to monitor the activities, however, it soon turns sour.
He is tricked into going into a corn maze seeking a lost child.
Hubie's young co-worker Mike follows hoping to scare Hubie.
He finds Mike and watches him get pulled into the maze and then disappearing.
Hubie moves his attention to a drive-in cinema, where his old classmates Lester and Mary Hennessey scare him.
They falsely report suspicious activity in one of the cars (who turn out to be trick-or-treaters driven by Mr. Hennessey to throw eggs at Hubie).
Hubie flees into the woods and finds Walter, who thinks he is turning into a werewolf.
He chases Hubie to a haunted house in a fun fair that is overseen by Chantal Taylor.
Mr. and Mrs. Hennessey are kidnapped and Sgt.
Downey is alerted.
At the haunted house, Hubie sees a male Siberian Husky, believing he is Walter in his final form.
The dog defecates and eats his own feces while Hubie attempts to interrogate and confront him, runs into the haunted house and he chases him inside.
It is eventually shown that the Husky is Miss Taylor's dog named Buster.
Pete Landolfa goes in to scare Hubie, but is kidnapped right in front of him.
Sgt.
Downey arrives and suggests to Mayor Benson that they cancel Halloween.
Hubie thinks it is Walter, but then Blake calls Downey.
Walter has been at the police station with Richie, as they had turned themselves in.
Walter's real name is Nick Hudson and Richie had escaped to bring him back to the mental institution, which they refer to as the werewolf treatment center.
Downey, Benson, and Dave believe that Hubie is the kidnapper and is getting revenge on his bullies.
He runs away and goes to the radio station.
DJ Aurora tells Hubie that someone calls a lot more than him always requesting a song for Hubie.
They all think Sgt.
Downey's ex-wife Violet Valentine is the caller.
The burner phone that was planted when called is revealed to be in Hubie's house and he races there, hoping his mother is okay.
It is revealed that Hubie's mother kidnapped Pete, Mike, and the Hennesseys as revenge for tormenting Hubie and plans to burn them alive.
He rescues them just as the police, the news media, Nick, and Richie arrive, but they are still ungrateful.
His mother then scolds them all for the things they did to Hubie and they admit that they were jealous of him for various reasons.
Hubie's mother suddenly disappears upon using the Frankenstein trick.
One year later, Hubie is married to Violet, is the new Mayor of Salem, and his new foster kids are going trick or treating dressed like people they know.
Having earned respect from the locals, Hubie goes into town on his bicycle with Downey escorting him and prepares for the Halloween festivities.

title: The Encounter: Jazz Royalty vs. The Radio Lord
synopsis: During a time when jazz music stirred the soul of New York City, a striking voice echoed through the jazz clubs, captivating countless jazz aficionados.
This mesmerizing voice belonged to Louis Armstrong, an African American jazz musician who had uniquely cultivated an impeccable reputation for his soulful singing.
In a period characterized by racial segregation, Armstrong endured racial discrimination every single day.
He remained resilient, asserting his powerful presence in a predominantly white-dominated music industry and promoting his liberating jazz music.
In the throbbing nucleus of the WNYC radio station, Harold Roberts meticulously curated his popular radio show, "The Roberts Hour."
One evening, out of curiosity, Roberts frequented the famed Birdland Jazz Club and was utterly mesmerized by Armstrong's captivating performance.
Intrigued by Armstrong's audacious public stance on a pervasive issue, Roberts turned sinister and invited Armstrong to his radio show.
Unbeknownst to Armstrong, Roberts was plotting an on-air confrontation to challenge and undermine his beliefs, thinking this would fortify his influence.
Alerted to Roberts' less-than-noble intentions, Armstrong's friends fervently urged him to reconsider accepting the seemingly harmless invitation.
Armstrong, however, saw the broader picture.
He understood the power and reach of Roberts' radio platform and accepted the invitation.
On the other hand, Roberts meticulously plotted his tactics like a military strategist, intending to exploit the prevalent racial prejudices among his listeners.
The day of reckoning finally arrived.
Roberts' radio show started- the crackling of the airwaves symbolizing the tension that was palpable to the vast number of listeners who had eagerly tuned in.
Roberts commenced the verbal duel by probing Armstrong's music and beliefs in an unnervingly calm manner, aimed at unsettling his opponent.
But Armstrong, unfazed, parried right back.
Armourstrong responded fervently to every antagonistic question, displaying courage and resolve that left both Roberts and the critical listeners profoundly dumbfounded.
Sensing the direction of the wind changing, Roberts tried to regain control but couldn't match Armstrong's impassioned and irrefutable stand on racial equality.
However, not everyone looked at this development positively; Armstrong started receiving a torrent of threats from Roberts' followers.

In the aftermath of his impressive performance, Roberts found himself questioning his beliefs and regretting his role in fostering racial discrimination, his mind filled with a newfound admiration for Armstrong.
An internal struggle began to brew in him- should he continue to adhere to long-standing biases or acknowledge Armstrong's undeniable talent and moral courage?
In an unprecedented move, Roberts decided to issue a public apology during his live radio segment.
This bold on-air confession sparked a firestorm of negative reactions, leaving his professional reputation effectively in tatters.
Despite the crushing public backlash, a sense of relief surged through Roberts.
The radio apology turned out to be the end of an era - Roberts' entrenched radio career.
This marked the beginning of a challenging journey of self-reformation and the unlearning of deeply ingrained biases.
Roberts' sweeping broadcast initiated a paradigm shift in the radio journalism industry which changed it forever.
Meanwhile, in the wider world, Armstrong commenced a nationwide tour using his music as a catalyst for societal change.
Having retreated into privacy and self-reflection, Roberts introspected deeply on the harm he caused by wielding his radio platform irresponsibly.
Acknowledge his past transgressions, Roberts vowed to dedicate the rest of his life towards rectification of the racial biases he had propagated and towards promoting equality.
The film ends with a scene depicting a touching human moment- Roberts reaching out to Armstrong, suggesting a potential beginning of an unexpected but profound friendship.

While the road to change was just beginning and attitudes did not change overnight, the radio incident had sparked a citywide chain reaction that initiated a period of transformation in societal views.
The incident, etched in history as 'The Battle of the Airwaves,' was a turning point in music history.

It triggered fundamental shifts in attitudes towards race, music, and the role of radio journalism, and laid the groundwork for an era that would eventually lead to a breakthrough in the media industry.

title: The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry (film)
synopsis: Retired pensioner Harold Fry lives in Kingsbridge in south Devon with his wife Maureen, where he lives a sedentary life.
A letter from an old work colleague, Queenie Hennessy, reveals she is dying from cancer and is living in a hospice in Berwick-upon-Tweed.
Penning a perfunctory response, he complains that the words he has written are not enough of a response but, lacking ideas, he goes to post them anyway.

Finding himself still reluctant to release the letter he continues walking into town, passing multiple opportunities to send the letter, before finding himself in a petrol garage where the attendant tells him that her support helped her aunt fight back against her own cancer.
Inspired, he calls the hospice and asks them to tell Queenie that he intends to walk to Berwick - some 500 miles - and she must hold onto her life until he arrives.
Realising Harold is not returning, Maureen is at first worried, then when he calls her to inform her of his plan, she reacts angrily.

Eventually, she reveals to her neighbour Rex that following several years of rocky relationship, she fears he has taken the opportunity to finally walk out on their marriage - something she admits she had almost done numerous times in the past.
After several days of travel, Harold begins to suffer flashbacks and hallucinations of his son, David.
Suffering a tempestuous relationship, in his early adult years David spurned Harold's parenting and their relationship broke down.
After collapsing in the road, Harold is taken in by Martina, a Slovakian doctor who emigrated to the UK but is now unable to find any other work than cleaning.
She treats his feet, which are now covered in sores and infected blisters, and allows him to recuperate in her house for several days.
Meanwhile she reveals that her partner left her for another woman a year ago, and she still waits for him to return every day.

Though Harold does not feel himself equal to her hospitality, she tells him that his story refusal to accept bitter truths lying down humbles her, and she sends him on his way with several pieces of walking kit left by her former partner.
Harold's journey continues for several weeks, with Harold continuing to meet strangers and humble them with his selfless spirit.
Stopping for a drink in a pub, one patron asks to take his picture as a keepsake.
The photo makes its way to the media and he rapidly becomes a national sensation, though Harold has no knowledge of the story.
Shortly after, Harold is joined by Wilf, an eighteen-year-old junkie who was inspired by his story and wants to walk to save Queenie too.

As more media outlets pick up the story, several dozen more individuals join him and collectively adopt the moniker of 'Pilgrim', though Harold seems bemused by their presence and struggles to understand why they are fascinated by him.

Maureen and Rex also travel up to visit Harold, though when Harold invites Maureen to join his walk she responds in frustration that she is unable to let go of the things holding her back in the way he has.
The camp, though continuing to grow and fostering a genuine camaderie amongst the Pilgrims, slowly becomes something of a circus and is by now making barely any progress towards Berwick.
Harold's memories of his son continue, and after Wilf flees the camp after being caught raiding Harold's supplies and carrying pills, Harold recalls David's own descent into drug-taking.
In a discussion with another Pilgrim he tells her of how he watched his son deteriorate before he took his own life in their garage.
The Pilgrim helps Harold to accept that he needs to leave the camp behind to reach his destination.

Now alone, Harold's mental state declines as he fears the end of the journey will result in the same loss as he suffered with David, and he eventually phones Maureen from a phone booth to tell her that he has no idea where he is and that he wants to come home.
Maureen, having had time to come to terms with her own feelings, instead informs him that he is only 18 miles from Berwick and that he must finish his journey.
She also reveals to him that she never passed on Queenie's final message to him some 25 years earlier.
Believing that he was to blame for David's death and the resulting near-collapse of his marriage, Harold had turned to drink and had determined to engineer ways of punishing himself further.
He had therefore driven to his place of work at night and destroyed much of their stock, intending on being fired for his actions.
Instead, Queenie had found him first and had taken the blame for the damage, being dismissed in his place but allowing him to rebuild his life.
Some time later she had driven to Harold and Maureen's house while he was out to tell him that she was moving away and to tell him not to blame himself for everything that had come to pass.
Maureen, feeling spiteful for the way that he was receiving comfort where she had none and perhaps suspecting an affair, had refused to pass on the message, but finally lets him hear it.
Shortly afterwards, Harold reaches Berwick.

He initially struggles to summon the nerve to enter the hospice but when he does, then he is enthusiastically greeted by the nun he has spoken to on the phone on several occasions, who leads him in to greet Queenie but warns him that she is no longer able to speak.
Something of a taciturn man, Harold finds himself unable to say much to her but hangs up a quartz pendant that he has brought from near the start of his journey in her window.

When meeting Maureen again in Berwick, Harold confesses defeat, implying that Queenie did not live long after his arrival and telling Maureen that he doesn't understand how he thought that he could save her when he could not save David.
She responds by telling him that his devotion to Queenie has helped her remember the man she used to love and that his actions have saved their marriage.
Meanwhile, the various people who Harold and his story touched along the pilgrimage are shown looking at light reflected around them, and smiling.

title: Marmaduke (2022 film)
synopsis: Phil, his wife, and their two children Barbara and Billy live with their dog, a Great Dane by the name of Marmaduke.
The film opens at Billy's birthday party.
Marmaduke takes a cannonball dive from the second floor of the family home into the backyard pool, releasing a giant tidal wave.
Barbara records it on her phone and the video goes viral.
It comes to the attention of a world-renowned dog trainer, Guy, who offers to transform Marmaduke into a world-class show dog.
At first, the family isn’t sure about Marmaduke entering dog competitions.
When Phil learns there is a one million dollar top prize, he’s persuaded to make an agreement.
Marmaduke goes into training and, after some initial resistance, starts to make progress.
Guy enters Marmaduke into a local dog show to test his skills.
During the preliminary setup, Marmaduke encounters an Afghan hound named Zeus.
Zeus entices Marmaduke to eat prior to the competition, making him bloated.
Marmaduke does his best to conceal the matter and struts onto the field with Guy.
Before one lap around the field, Marmaduke releases voluminous clouds of noxious flatus which envelopes the entire field.
He soars through the air and lands backside down in the winner’s trophy and defecates in it, much to the horror of everyone.
Disgraced, Guy refuses to keep training Marmaduke.
Deflated and dejected, Marmaduke runs away from home.
As he runs down the street, he sees the family cat, King Tut, in the middle of an intersection.
Marmaduke saves the cat but has difficulty connecting with his character.
Persuaded by King Tut, Marmaduke embarks on a trip around the world, performing heroic stunts along the way.
His circumnavigation convinces Guy to take Marmaduke back on track for the World Dog Championship.
Marmaduke encounters Zeus again at the competition with many other dog breeds.
The competition consists of three challenges, but right after Marmaduke passes the second challenge, he lands on Guy, who is hospitalized.
Without a trainer, his owners end up stepping in to coach him, allowing him to tackle the final challenge.
In the third and final challenge, the dogs perform a unique act, with Marmaduke and Billy doing a cowboy act with King Tut, pleasing the audience.
Later, the judge's final results reveal Zeus as the winner.
However, Marmaduke uncovers that Zeus' owner rigged the scores, leading Zeus to be disqualified and resulting in the Zen-powered Japanese Chin Zhi taking the top prize.
Zeus tries to take back the trophy, but Marmaduke stops him.
He ends up knocking over a platform where a cameraman sits, causing Marmaduke to push his owners out of the way, getting crushed by the platform when saving the cameraman's life.
Marmaduke is initially believed to be dead, but it is revealed that he is still alive, and he and his family live happily ever after.
During the mid-credits scene, Zeus gets caught by security and is sent to the dog pound to get his fur shaved.
As for Henri and his twin, they are arrested and put to jail.

title: Half Brothers
synopsis: In 1994 Mexico, Renato Murguia's father Flavio has to immigrate to the US in search of economic opportunity as their country underwent an economic crisis.
Although Flavio promises to return soon, he does not.
25 years later, Renato is a successful aviation company executive based in San Miguel, is engaged to Pamela who already has a son Emilio and is planning to marry.
Renato is contacted by a woman named Katherine, Flavio’s second wife, who tells that Flavio is very ill and wishes for Renato to see him in Chicago.
Renato is still angry at his father for never returning all those years, but reluctantly ends up going to Chicago.
Renato meets Flavio at the hospital for the first time in decades.
Asher, whom Renato first encountered at a coffee shop, appears, which Flavio reveals that both of them are brothers.
leaving them displeased.
Flavio asks them to do one last favor for him, to look for Eloise, after delivering an envelope to a man named Evaristo.
However, Renato, still resentful, refuses and storms out of the hospital on his pleading father.
Flavio dies the next day.

Renato attends the funeral and leaves, despite Asher trying to convince him to fulfill their father’s dying wish, but he eventually relents and turns around to tell Asher to pick him up the next day from his hotel so they can head out.
On the road, Renato falls asleep and wakes up at a goat farm, finding Asher running toward the car with a small goat, as armed men with rifles chase Asher.
The two manages to escape, but Renato yells at Asher for stopping just for a goat farm.
To make matters worse, they are even further away from where they should have been.
After the long detour, they make it to an old factory where Flavio worked there with Katherine and is currently producing radio-controlled airplanes that Renato and Flavio used to play with.
Directed by one of the factory's employees, they meet a man at a Mexican bar across the street named Evaristo, a friend of Flavio who also immigrated to the United States.
Providing them with a key.
Evaristo tells Renato about how Flavio did everything he could to make enough money and return home.
He worked in the factory until he came up with the idea to make the toy planes, which revitalized the company with help from Katherine.

They had a good professional relationship that turned into a one-night stand, until Flavio felt guilty for betraying his old wife, so he left to try and make his way back home once he had enough money.
Evaristo then gives Renato a box with another envelope written as Mr. B, which contains a claim ticket for a pawnshop.
Before they can learn anything else, Asher forces them to run again when he picks a fight with guys he made a bad pool bet with.
The two stop at a motel where they were able to figure out the next location within the claim ticket from Mr. B's envelope to go to a pawn shop in Oklahoma City.
They reach the shop the following morning and meet Mr. B, who presents them with Flavio’s wedding ring.
Mr. B explains that Renato was mugged while on his way for the border.
Beaten and bloodied, he went to the shop and tried to pawn something off.
Unable to afford his personal effects, Mr. B said he would buy Flavio's wedding ring and keep it there until he had the money to buy it back.
After this, he attempted to cross the border but was arrested and thrown in jail.
He got sick afterward, and the guards dumped him on the side of the road to die.
Before telling anything else, Mr. B gives them an envelope for Eloise; it contains a picture of St. Mary's Convent in El Paso, Texas.
Renato, furious and impatient, grabs his bag and tries to head to the airport, but relents upon discovering that he doesn’t have his passport on him.
However, their car runs out of gas and the goat, whom Asher calls "Renatito" had destroyed all of the extra fuel supply, leaving Renato angry and the two had a fight.
While looking for help, they found an unlocked cabin, full of pure alcohol, which Renato plans to process it into gasoline to refuel Asher's car.
Renato flips out upon learning Asher got rid of his passport and locks him up in the bathroom before driving off.
However, he becomes remorseful midway through and tries to turn around but is stopped and arrested by a border patrol officer.
Renato is thrown into detention with other undocumented immigrants until he is bailed out the next morning.

Renato reunites with Asher in a donut shop, who told him that the cabin they broke in belonged to the group of rednecks they previously encountered at a gas station, which they also stole his goat and are planning to eat.
Renato and Asher return to the cabin and fill the place with ethanol vapor to knock out the rednecks and save the goat.
With the US-Mexico border drawing near, Renato decides to go to St. Mary's Convent in El Paso.
They meet a nun who takes them to a cabinet that requires a code.
Renato looks at the envelope with Eloise written on it and then, upon remembering to look at a different perspective, turns it upside down to reveal the combination mean for the cabinet safe.
They open it to find a DVD from Flavio explaining himself to his sons.

After being left for dead by the prison guards, he was found and took care by the church nuns from the convent nearby before he was able to set out to return home but felt remorseful for leaving Katherine without explanation.
When he arrives in Chicago, she had already given birth to Asher.
Not wanting to leave another son behind, he called his old wife to let her, and Renato know that he wasn’t going to come home, and that was when Renato stopped caring for him.
Flavio goes further and explains that although he did love Asher, he tried to recapture too much of Renato in him and distanced himself when he saw that Asher was different.
He explains that he loved both of them and hopes that they can not only forgive him but grow as brothers.
The nun then shows the brothers that Eloise really is an actual plane built by Flavio to pass down to his sons.
Now having a way of getting home, Renato gets ready to part ways with Asher and the goat; Renatito.
However, he changes his mind and invites them both to the wedding.
They fly away together and return to Mexico as they pass above the Sumidero Canyon.
Renato and Pamela get married, and Renato starts to make a bond with Emilio by having him fly a toy plane, which crashes into a nearby house, prompting everyone who witnesses the accident to flee.

title: Golden Gate Dreams
synopsis: Opening in a teenage Emily's quaint bedroom, the movie presents her sitting at her father's worn-out Remington typewriter.
This captivating flashback fades into the bleak present.
Emily, grappling with unaffordable student loans, reluctantly withdraws from her English Literature course at Berkeley University.
She returns home to help manage her father's struggling hardware store.
Amidst warrens of classic novels at the renowned Strand bookstore, Emily's yearning gaze betrays her longing for the literary world.
Her parents, indifferent towards Emily's aspirations feeds her need for familial emotional support.
Emily bumps into the alluring Alex in Golden Gate Park.
Alex, a bohemian photographer, embodies a thirst for impromptu adventures.
Emily's lingering financial struggles further distress her as her father's hardware store teeters on the brink of bankruptcy.
However, Emily finds solace and happiness in her budding relationship with Alex.
Inspired by Alex’s relentless vitality, Emily creates a blog, “A Tale of Two Cities”, meticulously portraying her experiences in the city.
Emily's tales pique the interest of Alex's circle.
During a get-together, Emily is introduced to these enthusiastic friends.
Her blog posts attract the notice of Maverick Publishing House.
However, Emily finds herself torn between her familial obligations and her literary dream.
Her father, George, accidentally discovers Emily's secret blog.
A sense of betrayal sweeps over George as he confronts Emily, leading to a heated argument.
The argument escalates until George dismisses Emily from the store, leaving her jobless.
The thrill of her impending book contract collides with guilt, leaving Emily in emotional turmoil.
Emily faces a critical decision: to choose the safety of the familiar or to risk for the dreams she cherishes.
Spurred by courage, Emily decides to embark on the Maverick book deal.
She then immerses herself in her autobiographical fiction, “The Bridges of San Francisco,”.
Emily's book quickly catapults to the peak of bestseller charts.
George buys Emily’s book and he begins to perceive Emily's intense passion for writing.
Feeling remorse, George suggests a reconciliation, sparking the healing of their estranged relationship.
Meanwhile, Emily’s relationship with Alex reignites, binding them together stronger than ever.
As the movie nears its heartwarming conclusion, Emily is visualized atop the iconic arches of the Golden Gate Bridge.
Her wide gaze encompasses the city that orchestrated her incredible journey.
The movie's final frame shows a radiant Emily, having discovered her authentic self and her place in the world.
She stands ready to face and author the unwritten chapters of her life story with her newfound courage and relentless spirit.

title: Storm Watcher
synopsis: Our protagonist, Amelia Thompson, is a dedicated and meticulous agent of the Boston Police Department, tirelessly examining the intricate details surrounding a high-profile murder.
Her unwavering commitment to truth and crime-solving, fuelled by an inherent obsession for cracking even the most minute details, marks Amelia as one of the most effective officers in the department.
Life introduces a dramatic twist on a murky day with a relentless downpour.
Engulfed by the roar of thunder, a devastating multi-vehicle collision occurs on Highway 93.
The unprecedented accident turns Amelia's workday on its head, breaking her steady rhythm of chasing invisible threads knotted around the murder case.
Amidst the overwhelming chaos, a softer facet of Amelia is unveiled.
Demonstrating compassion, she vigilantly attends to a critically injured victim trapped within the metal wreckage.
Jack, a grievously wounded man, witnesses her kind-hearted side as she fights his pain with gentle words.
Intrigue boils around Amelia as she starts correlating dots between the extreme weather and the unnerving frequency of the gruesome highway crashes.
The otherwise random mishap seemed to have a chilling pattern, as if each weathercast predicted a schemed catastrophe.
Strain invades Amelia's personal life when her husband, Tim Thompson, a retired police officer himself, begins to resent her increasing work obsession.
Disgruntled by Amelia's growing lack of presence at home, a trenchant conversation unveils the already tensing emotions between them.
Drawn to the bizarre nexus between a stormy day and the freeway pile-up, Amelia dives deeper into these incidents, carving time off her personal life.
Her dogged pursuit reveals a disturbing pattern - wrecks occurring exclusively on tempestuous days, a series of too many coincidences.
Hours in the day quickly blur between her official duties and an unofficial investigation into the Highway 93 accidents.
Her home turns into a secondary crime scene - maps speckled with pins, charts, and weather reports sprawled across her study, burying her marriage beneath the files.
Unravelling the pattern, Amelia stumbles upon a terrifying revelation - the highway incident wasn't a random casualty.
A closer analysis reveals an intricate scheme, a murder meticulously masked behind the storm’s chaos.
Someone was using nature's fury as a perfect screen to execute killing.
As the injured Jack recovers, he gradually becomes a vital ally.
His hazy memories of the incident provide critical insights, further fuelling Amelia's ongoing investigation.
Amelia delves deeper into her work while tensions escalate in her household.
Her escalating work obsession puts her marriage on the back burner, threatening her emotional bond with Tim.
A subplot following Amelia’s struggle to balance her professional responsibilities with her marital obligations unfolds.
It’s a war between her badge and her heart, a struggle etched beneath the dark circles under her eyes.
Faced with her sinking personal life and her relentless dedication to her job, Amelia’s mental health starts to waver.
She is torn between two loyalties - solving the case that shapes her days and saving the love that illuminates her nights.
Amelia's tireless efforts bear fruit when she uncovers evidence of a large crime syndicate operating from the shadows.
The organization didn’t just exploit storms—they used the distraction and confusion to execute their cold-blooded operations.
Probing further into the syndicate’s thrives, Amelia uncovers deceptive alliances that shatter her trust.
Her findings highlight politicians and senior officials she once respected, involved knee-deep into the syndicate’s murky waters.
The scope of her discoveries raises her threat level significantly, transforming her from an observer to a potential target.
Twisted alliances and disloyalties make Amelia a liability to those fearing exposure, making her a newfound prey.
Her newfound position on the firing line suffocates Amelia under layers of distrust.
With the multiplying threats escalating rapidly, she is unsure of which familiar face might bear a concealed dagger for her.
As the threats grow imminent, she withdraws within herself.
Even Tim, who once shared her night whispers, becomes a stranger as Amelia steps back to maintain a protective cover around her loved ones.
Consequently, her relentless pursuit of truth results in her temporary suspension from the Boston Police Department.
The shackles of suspensions only intensify her pursuit, the metallic burn fossilising her resolve.
Unaffected by her suspension, Amelia’s determination holds strong.
Freed from her professional chains, her pursuit of justice only gets more personal, paving the way toward her daunting journey of lone-wolf.
On a storm-ridden night, Amelia faces her first consequential ambush.
Masked assailants break into her home, and the raging weather outside reflects her life under threat with each thunder crack.
However, she manages to escape the assault with her fierce determination and quick reflexes.
Rather than discouraging her, the attack sparks a defiant flame within her, strengthening her determination to expose the malevolent organization destroying her city.
Her relentless pursuit leads her to uncover new evidence during her off-record investigation.
Amelia’s efforts finally guide her to the crime syndicate’s operating heart - Boston’s faceless industrial district.
With new and incriminating revelations in hand, she turns to Detective Roy, a trustworthy colleague.
Trusting her instincts over her paranoia, she confides in him, revealing her discoveries.
Together, they conspire an audacious plan to dismantle the criminal organization.
Aiming for an end to their reign of terror, Amelia, Roy, and allies engage into an intense strategizing session.
Taking their audacious plan forward, Amelia and her faithful allies throw themselves in the face of danger.
They confront the notorious organization head-on, risking their lives for the city they wear on their badges.
Their daring intervention unfolds into a high-stakes stand-off with the organization, causing significant disturbance in their underworld operations.
Their dangerous crusade results in the successful dismantling of the crime syndicate and the arrest of the shadowy authorities involved.
Despite their monumental victory, Amelia is consumed by an enormous sense of loss as Jack, the once unlikely ally, succumbs to his lingering injuries.
His departure leaves a void that no victory can fill.
The joy of justice is shadowed by the pain of losing Jack and the strained relationship with Tim.
Amelia is torn between the pride of her victory and the grief of her personal life.
As the chaos subdues and the storm finally clears, Amelia observes Boston, her city slowly stirring back to life.
The recovering city shadows her relentless spirit, casting a new day on each brick.
Boston springs back to life, rebuilding, and healing with every ray of dawn.
Despite her job's unyielding weight, she draws purpose from it.
She embraces its challenges, refusing to let it overshadow her unwavering love for Boston.
She remains the beacon of hope, the guardian of justice for her beloved city.
Prepared to shield it from all possible harm, Amelia transforms into a personification of courage and determination.
Due to her indefatigable efforts, the city begins to restore faith in justice.
Boston reawakens with a renewed trust in order, a brighter hope in a secure tomorrow.
Amelia prepares to stand steady before the storm, no matter whether it is symbolized by torrential rains or criminal organizations.
Despite enduring personal turmoil and uphill battles, Amelia's character emerges as an epitome of strength and undying determination, a reminder that every storm eventually leads to a brighter day.

title: Mid-Century
synopsis: In 1963, Joanne and Anthony Waxen live in a home built by Frederick Banner, with whom the two have had concerning interactions.
Joanne, a stay-at-home housewife is given underwear as a gift by her husband.
After Joanne leaves to change, Frederick enters the house.
Joanne finds Frederick peeking on her while Anthony has been hanged from the ceiling with a belt.
In 2022, Alice is a doctor who is harassed by her superior and is traumatized from her time working during the COVID-19 pandemic.
She and her architect husband Tom go on a weekend getaway to San Diego and rent a mid-century modern home, the same that was built by Frederick, from a mysterious man named Eldridge.
While there, strange events occur including a bird crashing into the window, doors opening by themselves, and a shadowy figure watching the couple while they have sex.
As night falls, a delivery driver tells Tom about Eldridge, stating he freaks him out.
After driving away, his tire pops and a man stabs him in the chest.
Following dinner, Alice goes to interview at a hospital for a new job.
The delivery driver is sent to Alice's hospital but she is unable to save him.
After finding the receipt for the order in his pocket, officer Raquel and her partner interrogate her, inquiring if Tom had anything to do with the murder.
Meanwhile, Tom investigates the house and Frederick Banner.
Tom searches Frederick on Wikipedia but finds a lot missing, so he calls his co-worker Hannah who he is sleeping with to find a book on him in their office.
The book reveals that Frederick lost his first wife Alice and later remarried Joanne Waxen, and that he was also interested in polygamy and the occult with a painter named Emil Larson.
Hannah hangs up but is soon-after strangled by a security guard.
At the house, Tom is haunted by a woman who, after nearly drowning Tom in the pool, leads him to a book of the occult and later to a grave in the backyard with the bones of Graham Verdin.

When Tom touches the bones he sees visions which reveal that the woman is Marie Verdin and the wife of Graham, a woman who Frederick was manipulating at the same time as Joanne whom he later kills and takes her son as his own, now named Eldridge Banner.
She reveals to Tom that Frederick killed the husbands of the couples who moved into his neighborhood and that he still haunted the house where he died.
Eldridge returns to the home and Tom calls 911 before falling into a ditch outside.
The two officers arrive at the house and question Eldridge, but do not go further as he is a top fundraiser for the police.
Tom is then possessed by Alice and talks to her son through him before he drowns Tom and buries him in the yard.
Tom however still exists as a ghost and spends time with Marie.
The two discover a recording of Frederick and Emil discussing a prophesied blood "wolf" moon in which a woman can be impregnated with a spirit.
The police discover the delivery driver was killed by an architect's compass, narrowing the suspect down to Eldridge or Tom.
Alice returns to the house after work and finds Tom missing.
Eldridge confronts Alice and sedates her, preparing for the ritual.
Tom then possesses Eldridge and digs up his own body before officer Raquel arrives and arrests him.
Tom, speaking through Eldridge, admits to everything and asks to be arrested.
The chief of police arrives and kills Raquel, revealing he is one of Eldridge's brother possessed by Frederick.
The ritual begins with sons of Frederick surrounding Alice.
Alice, and Tom possessing Alice, kill the sons together and say their goodbyes.
After Alice is transported to the hospital, Tom sees every house in the neighborhood has ghosts of Frederick's victims inside.

title: Rockpocalypse: Brigade of the Doomstar
synopsis: As the story begins to develop, we're launched into the hustle and bustle of Madison Square Garden, teeming with an ocean of excited faces.
On an elaborately set stage, the members of the iconic rock and roll institution Doomstar deliver a performance.

The atmosphere becomes electrified with anticipation, but the sense of excitement is transformed into an unexpected twist when Joshua, the charismatic lead singer, shocks the audience with the announcement of the band's temporary break to venture into a world dominated by individual audacious compositions.
After the attention-grabbing concert, the band members retreat to a luxuriously decked-out private room.
Amidst their mad celebration, a gift from a devoted fan—an antique Aztec amulet with intricate carvings, begins to emanate an ominous, dark green aura.

Suddenly, the amulet springs to life, emitting an almost blinding light combined with a swirling vortex that devours the entire room—band members, equipment, everything sinking into its inconceivable depth, until there's nothing left but a hauntingly silent backstage adorned with lonely spotlight beams.
The next moment, they find themselves in a dystopian world, devoid of any trace of music.
Their once lively instruments hang dead on their shoulders, and their voices are reduced to barely audible whispers.
The abrupt transition from being rock stars to trapped musical pariahs stirs up unrest within the members.
The internal conflicts regarding songwriting and creative moves surface more intensely, further intensifying their already extreme predicament.

Within this inhospitable world, they cross paths with a grizzled veteran, a sad relic from a time where music was the life force of humanity, who introduces them to their unprecedented enemy—the Masked Slayer.
The ominous Masked Slayer rules with unstinting severity, imposing an oppressive silence among his subjects.
He keeps a tight grip on the Harmony Crystal, the embodiment of every last melody, restraining all rhythmic expressions.
Suddenly, the Aztec amulet radiates green light, undergoing an astonishing transformation, endowing the band with unprecedented power.
Thus, they become the Brigade of the Doomstar, their rock-infused vitality morphing into a formidable force.
Realizing the potential of their music to overthrow the oppressive silence, they rally against the Masked Slayer.
Their voices, shut mere moments ago, rebound anew, coalescing their individual shock into a unified, courageous plan.
Amidst this comedy unfolds the astounding revelation that their music triggers intense magical reactions in this universe.
The third act of the story unfolds, plunging them into an increasingly intense struggle with the oppressive Masked Slayer.
Showdown after showdown transpires, each battle sequence more heart-stopping than the last.
Their path to victory is littered with setbacks and failures, threatening to shatter their resolve, but they remain unbroken.
After an anxiety-prone infiltration, they pull off a heist in the Slayer's gothic fortress, retrieving the Harmony Crystal.
As the narrative approaches its climax, inner disagreements about their tactics bubble to the surface.
The tension reaches a boiling point and threatens to disintegrate the band.
However, their shared admiration for rock music, and a newly awakened understanding of their united purpose, succeeds in pulling them from the brink of downfall, reinstating their unity.

This newfound unity crystallizes in the grand finale with a climactic concert that dethrones the tyrant and his minions, liberating the stifled rhythms and beats imprisoned within the Harmony Crystal.
With the oppressive reign of the Masked Slayer now a thing of the past, music returns to the universe.
