They sprint back to their village, navigating through a chaotic livestock blockade and meandering through vast seas of wheat fields.
Each stumbling step intensifies the urgency of their mission.
Their arrival at the scaffold sparks an electrifying wave of commotion amongst the spectators.
They hurriedly present the irrefutable evidence that they had gathered, leading to the climactic moment of Edmund's vindication.
The real culprit is exposed, and Edmund is released.
A boisterous celebration ensues.
In the lingering atmosphere of hilarity, the king expresses his indebtedness to Hugo and Dupont with the promise of a grand reward.
However, Dupont's notorious wit and tactless humor offend the pompous royal figure, leading to unforeseen consequences.
Hugo and Dupont leave the castle without the promised reward but with another amusing experience added into their memory bank.
Back at their execution grounds, they jest about their chaotic adventure.
Equipped with shared memories, the duo prepares for the next execution, armed with the refreshing levity of their humorous tales.
The seemingly mismatched trio of Hugo, Dupont, and Edmund derive joy and laughter from their daily lives, discovering humor in the face of their challenging profession.
Their unique personalities occasionally clash with each other, enriching each other.
Despite the many struggles, their friendship deepens, illuminating the potency of their bond.
They stand together at the scaffold, ready to carry out another solemn execution.
Their remarkable journey, undertaken to save Edmund from execution, punctuated by hilarious fumbles and embarrassing incidents.

title: Timmy Failure: Mistakes Were Made
synopsis: In a world where imaginary friends co-exist with humans, Timmy Failure is an 11-year-old living in Portland, Oregon with his single mother Patty.
Timmy runs Total Failure Inc alongside his own personal detective agency, and "solves" cases.

Much of Timmy's adventures revolve around himself traveling with his polar bear partner Total (implied to be the result of his father walking out on him and his mother) across the city looking for cases and outwitting the "Russians" (actually just bearded hipsters).

Among his small social group are his best friend, Charles "Rollo" Tookus, a former member of Total Failure Inc., who quit after a mission gone awry, and Molly Moskins, a perky and optimistic girl who has a crush on Timmy.

Timmy considers his arch-enemy a girl named Corrina Corrina, who is actually very friendly to him and appears oblivious to his animosity towards her, though it is implied to be due to him having repressed feelings for her.
While retrieving a dead hamster from a classmate, Timmy's Failure-Mobile, a Segway that actually belongs to his mother, is stolen right out from under him.
He cancels his other cases and recruits Rollo, who believes that the death of their class hamster and the stolen Segway are linked back to the Russians.
At the library, Timmy learns from Molly that Corrina Corrina is part Russian and believes that she is behind the theft to dismantle his agency.
Because of his unusual outbursts and behavior in class, Timmy begins seeing the school counselor, Mr. Jenkins, whom Timmy begins to slowly but surely trust with his mission.
He also learns that Patty is dating a meter maid named Crispin who is friendly and aloof, but whom Timmy dislikes as he "[doesn't] collaborate with law enforcement."
Timmy learns that Corrina Corrina's father owns a bank and believes that his Segway is there.
He and Rollo try to sneak in but get kicked out by security.

Mr. Jenkins manages to get Timmy to do his homework as part of a "mission", but while doing so learns from Patty that they have to move to an apartment, which upsets Timmy as he has a "heavy caseload."
While on a field trip to Bonneville Dam, Timmy jumps to the false conclusion that Corrina Corrina plans to shut off the power to all of Portland.
Unaware that she is still with the group, Timmy rushes through the dam to find her while being chased by his teacher, Mr. Crocus.
They end up outside the dam just as the operators open the flood gates.
Timmy tries protecting Crocus from the flood, as he considers him an intellectual equal, but it turns out that they are high above the flood gates.

Timmy receives a three-day suspension for his behavior, and Crocus quits his job and is replaced while Patty angrily tells Timmy that she was fired because she had to stay home with Timmy, and shuts down Total Failure Inc.
Saddened over his fate of having to be "normal" and moving to an apartment, Timmy lets Total go at the zoo.
Mr. Jenkins talks to Timmy and reminds him that he must learn from his mistakes so that he can be a better person.
Invigorated after discovering a "Russian bug" in his cookie, Timmy recruits Crispin to liberate Total from the zoo.
As they are driving back, they spot a purse snatcher and Crispin gives chase, catching him.
Timmy considers aiding him but decides to simply call the police.

After a passerby asks him and Total to move, acknowledging his presence, and Timmy subsequently accidentally backing up his truck into a pole, Patty comes to see Timmy in the hospital and he apologizes for his behavior.
Patty tells Timmy that she wants him to re-open his detective agency.

Soon after, Crispin shows Timmy that the Segway was impounded at the police station this whole time for being parked in a no-parking zone, convincing Timmy that the police are working with the Russians.
Timmy comes out to give a speech at an animal fundraiser set up by Molly and excites the crowd with his speech on allowing polar bears into the school.
As Timmy wishes that Crocus could be there, he suddenly believes that Crocus was kidnapped by Corrina Corrina and sets off with Total to "rescue" him.

title: Fantasy Rescuer: The Seaside Town's Hero
synopsis: Tom sits in his bustling office in New York City.
He is a 35-year-old telemarketer, often finding his eyes drifting away from his work to imagine a different life in a quiet town on the Irish coast.
One frost-kissed December evening, he stumbles upon a handcrafted pocket watch among his grandmother's leftover possessions.
The watch's Celtic symbols and shining emeralds stir a hidden flux of emotions in him.
Fatigue takes over and Tom falls asleep.
Vivid dreams take over, painting a picturesque panorama of the quaint seaside town he often dreams of.
At the stroke of midnight, the pocket watch springs to life, radiating a soft azure glow.
Tom wakes up, not in his city apartment but on the lush rolling hills of his dreams - Dunmore East.
He soon learns about the tyrant of the town, Maev.
The relentless torment of the townsfolk tugs at his heartstrings, propelling him to intervene.
Spotting an opportunity during an ambush, he swiftly jumps into action, fighting for the innocent lives at risk.
Throughout the unfamiliar journey, Tom encounters Sarah.
There is undeniable chemistry between the two.
Sarah becomes his lifeline, guiding him emotionally and strategically in the fight against the villainous rule of Maev.
Their bond deepens, fortifying his resolve against tyranny.
Desperate to dismantle Tom's escalating influence, Maev hatches a sinister plan.
The brewing storm of uncertainty hangs heavy, dampening Tom’s spirits.
Refusing to abandon Sarah and the townsfolk to the malevolent Maev, Tom strategizes a daring rescue mission.
Rallying the very people he set out to protect, Tom ignites a rebellion.
The climax of the narrative climaxes with an intense battle between Tom and Maev.
Defying all expectations, Tom vanquishes Maev.
The liberation of Sarah and the children signifies the end of Maev's reign.
As a last attempt to regain control, Maev manipulates the magical pocket watch, and Tom finds himself back in his New York City apartment.
Tom wakes up to the realization of his stark, cramped apartment.
The pocket watch lay beside him.
Its magic exhausted but its existence served as a reminder of his brave deeds.
Fresh from his adventures, Tom decides to confront his stagnant reality, tackles and fights for his professional aspirations, and earns a promotion to a managerial position.
Inspired by his dream, Tom decides to meet his fantasies halfway and books a ticket to Ireland.
As he treads lightly on the warm sandy beach, he spots a lone woman sitting alone on the beach.
As he draws closer, he is astounded by her uncanny resemblance to Sarah, his dreamed lover and accomplice.
Tom introduces himself.
To his relief and bewilderment, the woman responds with an equally warm familiarity.

As their encounter ends with a knowing smile, Tom's dreams and reality intertwine, leaving the audience to question if his dream remained a mere subconscious imagination or was it a cryptic introduction to a life he was destined to explore.

title: Everyone's Whispering About Sam (film)
synopsis: On a frosty morning in Bristol, England, Sam Bennett awakes to his sixteenth birthday with an uncomfortable truth about his sexual orientation that he procrastinates to confess.
He is a sophomore at Greenwood Academy, where rumours about his sexual orientation have him targeted by a group of bullies.
Sam is a prodigy in English Literature, and his enduring love for learning paints him as a resilient individual.
During an art class, his mind impulsively drives him to create a sketch of his crush, a male student, triggering instant whispers throughout the room.
His sketch ignites fresh gossip, leaving Sam vulnerable and exposed.
Sam's mother, Susan, discovers his intimate journal where he documents his struggles and his attraction towards people of his same sex.
Sam approaches Ms. Fletcher, his empathetic English teacher, confides his secret and pleads for acceptance.
Ms. Fletcher encourages Sam to channel his emotions into literature.
Sam begins crafting a semi-autobiographical play titled, "Everyone's Whispering About Sam."
He incorporates his emotional journey and experiences into the script.
He openly announces his sexual orientation at school.
He experiences a mix of support and hostility after his announcement.
Despite a heartbreak, Sam uses his emotions to enrich his play.
Sam proposes his play for the Annual School Drama Contest, but it is declined by the school's conservative governing body.
Susan, Ms. Fletcher, and a handful of progressive students fight to get the decision reversed.
Their campaign succeeds, and Sam’s play is approved.
Relationships are formed and perceptions begin to shift as word about the controversial play spreads.
The drama contest is highly anticipated and filled with tension.
Sam performs his heart out, delivering an emotional performance that leaves the audience stunned.
The applause is mixed with some dissatisfaction, but mostly approval and support.
Sam feels newfound acceptance and recognition wash over him.
He basks in a sense of liberation.
He is ready to challenge prejudice and silence the echoes of homophobia with his unyielding spirit.
He leads a small revolution against homophobia within the school.
Sam's play starts a dialog about acceptance and inclusivity in the local community.
His play's script is incorporated into the English literature curriculum in local schools.
Sam, now turning into an emblem of change, uses his story to inspire a culture of tolerance.
His story ends on an optimistic note, as he is ready to face new challenges and victories.
The film ends on an image of Sam: a person silenced of whispers, and brimming with unwavering conviction.

title: John Henry (2020 film)
synopsis: Berta, a Honduran refugee, is about to be raped by the Los Angeles street gang that kidnapped her.
Her brother Oscar and half-brother Emilio assault the house where she is being kept and free her, but Oscar is shot before they can escape.
Emilio, who believes Oscar to be dead, forces Berta to leave with him, then delays the police as she flees.
She hides under the front porch of a nearby house owned by John Henry, a large, quiet man.
John takes her in over the objections of his father, BJ, who reluctantly helps translate her story.
Although BJ mocks his sentimentality, John offers to help her.
Eventually, Emilio arrives at John's house, looking for Berta.
Emilio, an American, explains that he was on the way to drop off his half-siblings at a shelter when Berta was kidnapped.
Disgusted that Emilio was planning to ditch his family, BJ becomes closer to Berta.
Berta insists that they return to the gangsters' house to look for Oscar, but Emilio insists that Oscar is dead.
After Emilio describes a tattoo, John realizes that the gangsters are part of a crew run by his cousin Hell.
Back in the 1990s, John quit the gang after realizing Hell's ambition would never allow the cycle of violence to end.
John contacts Hell, who gives Emilio and Berta 24 hours to leave the city.
Hell betrays them and sends assassins to kill everyone in the house, though they are instructed to leave John alive long enough that he can watch Hell execute Berta.
BJ and Emilio both die protecting Berta, but ride-or-die chick Savage botches Hell's plans when she stops John from assaulting Hell.
Enraged, Hell leaves John for dead and orders Savage to be killed.
John reasons that Hell, who never leaves anyone alive at the scene of a crime, wants him to suffer further.
John accidentally shot and maimed Hell when they were teenagers, and John now refuses to use pistols.
After recovering, John grabs a sledgehammer and leaves to rescue Berta, whom he believes Hell still plans to kill in front of him.
John's grandmother initially refuses to give him Hell's address but finally acknowledges that Hell is beyond redemption.
John kills several gangsters with his sledgehammer, interrupting Savage's execution and leaving Hell short on muscle.
Hell grants Savage a reprieve and orders her to kill John.
Although conflicted, she confronts John, who cripples her but leaves her alive.
The final confrontation between John and Hell draws a crowd.
Taking advantage of this, Hell brings out Berta and Oscar, whose public executions he believes will demonstrate his dominance.
Although the rest of the neighborhood is scared, a boy named Deydey defies Hell and assists John.
Savage kills Hell's remaining bodyguard while John kills Hell, then collapses, as Berta thanks him for rescuing her and Oscar.

title: The Scarlet Badge of Silence
synopsis: Benjamin Mortimer, the lanky silhouette of a once vigorous detective now spends his days nestled in the serene coastal embrace of Dunbar in Scotland.
His days of solitude are harshly interrupted with the arrival of an enigmatic letter adorned with the insignia of the British Armed Forces.

The parchment bears an urgent appeal for his once-renowned sleuthing skills concerning the abrupt and seemingly implausible death of a promising cadet, Samuel King, from the esteemed Royal Military Academy.
Haunted by the spectral presence of unresolved cases and the gnawing clutches of whiskey-induced oblivion, Benjamin wrestles internally with the request.
But ultimately, the allure of the old chase wins, and he sets off on a lengthy voyage to the imposing grounds of Sandhurst, the cradle of the military institution.
Upon reaching the prestigious Royal Military Academy, Benjamin encounters blatant scorn from its dwellers.
High-ranking officers and cocky trainees alike scorn him, stubbornly arguing that Samuel's tragic end resulted from a moment of immense distress manifested as self-infliction.
Benjamin refuses to bow down to their persistent mockery.

Determined, he embarks on his investigation, meticulously collecting fragments of truth that gradually cascade into a chilling suggestion—Samuel's suicide might be a calculated homicide masquerading behind a veil of self-destruction.

As the seasoned detective dives deeper into the maze of secrets, sinister instances of intimidation surface—a menacing barrage of anonymous notes, violent encounters in underlit ghastly alleyways, and surreptitious attempts aimed at obstructing his relentless pursuit of truth.
During the ordeal, Benjamin forms an unexpected alliance with Sarah, the sharp-witted daughter of the innkeeper at The Weeping Willow, his temporary refuge.
Sarah, equipped with a razor-sharp mind, becomes a valuable asset to his investigation.
Sarah is a vivacious woman craving an escape from the mundane monotony of her village life.
She gets entranced by the complexity woven into the case and eagerly thrusts herself into helping Benjamin untangle the mystery.
As they encode the cryptic enigma shadowing Samuel's downfall, the unlikely pair display impressive synergy.
Her spirited enthusiasm serves as a torch in Benjamin's darkest days, allowing him to shrug off his addiction temporarily.
Their relentless search finally fortifies into a blood-curdling revelation—a crimson insignia, cunningly concealed among the trappings of the seemingly self-inflicted act.
The demonic emblem stirs a shadowy memory within Benjamin—he recognizes it as a macabre symbol of a brutal academy tradition, a sacrificial ritual known infamously as ‘The Scarlet Badge.'

Sarah supports Benjamin's unpleasant conjecture, adding layers of gloom to the unpalatable truth with more tales of this merciless rite that had extinguished promising lives with ruthless precision in the past.
The duo’s daring entrance into this labyrinthine secret triggers alarms within the academy, leading top brass to retaliate by placing them under stringent detention, hoping to bury the scandal.
Ensnared within the gory confines they sought to expose, Benjamin resorts to the wisdom forged in his past experiences, conceiving an audacious plan to effect their escape.
Sarah proves to be an astounding accomplice, effectively playing the distressed prisoner while surreptitiously learning the guards' daily routines—crucial data for their imminent escape.
The stakes skyrocket; their mere quest for justice morphs into an existential struggle for survival in the deadly theater of intrigue.
With a combination of on-the-fly strategy and a liberal dash of good fortune, they escape their prison just in time for one final courageous showdown.
This climactic confrontation transpires in the bustling heart of the city square, surrounded by curious onlookers gripped by trepidation and anticipation.
Benjamin, armoring himself with unassailable truths, unmasks the academy's darkest secret—the horrifying reality of The Scarlet Badge—and unearths the ethically compromised parties involved.
The explosive revelation ruptures the reputational edifice of the prestigious academy, marking a sensational victory for the unlikely heroes.
Completed with the mission, Benjamin retreats back to his serene haven in Dunbar, emerging from his hermitage not as an obscure retiree but as a nationally hailed hero.
The adrenaline-laced journey impels Sarah to break free from the confines of her village, inspired to establish her identity after playing a critical role in solving Samuel's murder.
Dunbar bids a tearful adieu to its local hero, Benjamin, even as another troubling case emerges, indicating the old detective's potential reentry into the grand theater of crime-solving.

title: Host (film)
synopsis: During a July 2020 COVID-19 lockdown in London, friends Haley, Jemma, Radina, Emma, Caroline, and Teddy join the weekly Zoom call they have been using to stay in touch.
Haley has arranged for them to partake in a virtual séance led by the medium Seylan, who emphasises that they should not disrespect the spirits, though only Haley takes it seriously.
Teddy is forced to leave the call when his girlfriend Jinny disconnects him.
Jemma claims to feel intense tension around her neck and begins to cry, explaining that she feels the presence of a school friend who killed himself by hanging.
Seylan's internet cuts out and disconnects her from the call, prompting a laughing Jemma to admit to the group that she made her deceased friend up because she was getting bored, which angers Haley.

The remaining members begin to experience terrifying phenomena: Haley's chair is violently pulled backwards by an unseen force, the legs of a hanging corpse briefly appear in Caroline's attic when she goes to investigate a noise, and Emma's wine glass shatters even though nobody is holding it.
Haley points her instant camera down the hallway to take a photo of her living room, which shows a ghostly figure hanging from the ceiling.

As the girls panic, Haley manages to get back in touch with Seylan and tell her what happened, prompting Seylan to ask the spirit a series of yes or no questions; using this method, she quickly confirms that the spirit is not a friendly one.

Seylan explains that Jemma's prank, which involved fabricating a deceased person, may have led a tulpa to take on the guise of the deceased person and wear his identity like a mask that allows the demon to pass into the world of the living.
She gives them instructions on how to close the séance, but the demon interrupts her and she is disconnected again before the girls attempt to close the circle using her advice.
Relieved that the ordeal seems to be over, the members of the group begin to leave the call.
Radina leaves the room, unaware of her boyfriend Alan's body hanging behind her.
Caroline's Zoom background, which shows a looping video of her doing chores, continues playing as the real Caroline suddenly has her face smashed into the camera.

Forgetting to switch off a filter that superimposes masks and face paint onto her, Emma turns her camera towards her living room, where the filter places a kabuki mask on an invisible figure which then turns to look at her.
She runs away and scatters flour on the floor, showing the footprints of the demon approaching her.
Her kitchen cupboards burst open before the demon attacks her, but she escapes into her bedroom.
Radina attempts to flee after Alan's body drops down behind her, but the demon kills her by throwing her into the wall.

Noticing that Caroline is typing gibberish in the chat, Haley and Jemma watch as her camera turns back on to show her being killed by the demon repeatedly smashing her head into her keyboard while she pleads for help.
Haley and Jemma argue and blame each other before Haley is pulled out of the room.
Jemma, who lives around the corner from Haley, immediately leaves her home to help.
Teddy returns to the call to see that only Emma remains, and a warning pops up to remind the group that the call will end in 10 minutes unless they upgrade to the premium version of Zoom.
Unaware of everything that has occurred, Teddy believes Emma is pranking him, but he is attacked by the demon after it takes the form of a horrifying humanoid figure.
He is chased into his garden, where he sees Jinny being lifted into the air before her neck is snapped and her body falls into the swimming pool.
He runs away and hides, using a lighter to see where he is going, but the demon distracts him with an eerie music box his brother used to prank him with as a child.
The demon then knocks him down and he drops the lighter, causing a fire that burns him to death.
Emma, now the only person still active in the call, fearfully turns her camera towards the door of her room after it opens.
She throws a blanket, which drapes itself over an invisible human shape.
She opens her window to escape, but trips and falls to her death.
Jemma breaks into Haley's home and checks the Zoom call on Haley's laptop to see that Emma and Teddy are dead.

The demon smashes a wine bottle over her head and starts to destroy the kitchen, but she recovers and finds Haley hiding under her desk, with the pair attempting to escape the house using the flash of Haley's instant camera to light the way.
The demon appears in the final flash of light, taking the form of a mutilated human, and rushes at them as the Zoom call timer expires.

title: The Ceremonial Sacrifice (2023 film)
synopsis: George Lawson, a man of 70 years with a rich past as an educator, resides in the visually stunning town of Milton.
Each Sunday, George embarks on his visit to the antique bookstore in Milton.
On one such Sunday, George discovers an unusual book concealed amongst well-established classics: a dust-clad "Pride and Prejudice" and frayed "Moby Dick" provided it shelter.
This curious volume, "Rituals of the Omarians," revealed the complex traditions of an African tribe lost to the sands of time.
George's curiosity was piqued by a chapter, decorated with the grandeur title of "The Ceremonial Sacrifice".
George procured the mysterious book, committing to conduct the cryptically outlined ritual.
According to the arcane tome, various items were required for the ritual, ranging from elusive Amazonian forest roots to a hard-to-find 'Ga Noi,' a unique breed of Chinese gamefowl.
George threw himself headfirst into the task of retrieval.
His pursuit took him through the dense undergrowth of Clearwood Forest, where he braved swift rapids of the Milton White River and tackled playful yet cunning foxes.
During his voyage, he crossed paths with Daisy, a lady selling flowers, who gifted him the rare African root he required.

In the rustic back-alleys of Milton, George found Porst, a peculiar man with a fascination for rarefowl breeding, including the sought-after Ga Noi hens, who agreed to help George, bargaining in return for his aid in tidying the yard.
George also sought consultation from Tim, a Shaman renowned for having a keen understanding of forest herbs.
Tim's knowledge was crucial in preparing the ash required by the ritual.
As George immersed himself into the intricacies of preparations, a tempestuous atmosphere began stirring in Milton, perplexing flights of exotic birds filled the sky'spelling something unusual.
As strange occurrences became more frequent, George's initial excitement was shadowed by creeping doubts.
Seeking guidance, George travelled to the grand red-brick mansion of a well-learned associate and university friend, Professor John.

After a thoughtful consultation, John shared fascinating tales concerning the Omarian tribe and their unwavering belief in their indigenous rituals, especially the Ceremonial Sacrifice that George was endeavouring to reproduce.

John emphasised the necessity of unwavering belief in the ritual's success, a sentiment later echoed by Shaman Tim during George's visit, reinforcing the importance of absolute conviction in the performer.
With renewed confidence, George took on the final phase of his journey and patiently performed 'The Ceremonial Sacrifice'.
Upon uttering the final incantation, a divine glow pierced the overcast clouds, blanketing the town of Milton.
The following morning, the town was bathed in resplendent light as the minds and hearts of the townsfolk were cleared of doubts.
As they awoke to the sight of rich fields boasting endless bounty, people's bitter disputes seemed irrelevant and forgiveness easier to dispense, notably linked to George's secret ritual.
News of the spectacular transformation spread, turning whispers of curiosity into gasps of awe for George.
Despite the increasing attention, George continued to live tranquilly, occasionally reading the ancient book, deciphering other undiscovered rites.
Recognising the significance of its power, he showcased the antique book under a protective glass casing in his study.
As our tale draws to a close, we find George reflecting on the extraordinary turn his life had taken.
He marvelled at his power to inspire profound change with nothing but determination and willpower.
Raising a glass of his cherished Merlot, George closed the book.
Yet, as George retired for the night, the ancient book had other plans.
In the soft glow of the study, the papyrus pages rustled, unfolding to present 'The Ritual of Immortal Youth', paving the path for yet another enchanting adventure waiting to unfold.

title: Miller's Mission (2023 film)
synopsis: In the dimly-lit core of a secretive intelligence agency housed within the United States, Code Delta, there exists agent John Miller.
His daily routine primarily consists of dissecting encrypted data and drafting complex algorithms, painting a monotonous picture of his life till an extraordinary assignment comes striding in.
The assignment is tricky and immensely consequential.
His mission?
Infiltrate the 'Iron Dome', a monumentally guarded nuclear research base located in the heart of the politically volatile Middle Eastern nation, Syria.
His objective is not just delicate, but groundbreaking.
He is to inject an experimental malware called 'Epsilon' into the Iron Dome's mainframe.
Next, a confidential briefing ensues with the Deputy Chief of Code Delta.
The narrative takes a pause here as Act 1 concludes, revealing the dire stakes – imminent global crisis.
Act 2 opens in an authentic Middle Eastern marketplace bustled by local vendors.
Here, Miller executes the first steps of his daring mission, carefully blending into the crowd while orchestrating critical parts of the operation.
He uses his unrivaled tech know-how to dig out crucial 3D mapped data on the structure of the Iron Dome, examining its grand layers, and revealing its protective laser defense systems.
As he laboriously mines this data, he integrates himself seamlessly into the lively local crowd, learning to speak their tongue, understanding their customs.
Agent Miller, however, does not remain in the shadows for long.
His elusive operations and enigmatic demeanor catch the keen attention of a quick-witted local detective, Leyla.
The third Act introduces a curve.

While deeply buried in his mission, trying to pierce through the layers of the ironclad 'Iron Dome', he mistakenly sets off an unanticipated infrared alarm system, infecting his mission with sudden complications.
The once-controlled atmosphere takes a drastic turn as the shrieking alarm throws the facility's calm orchestration into pandemonium.
This derailment forces Miller to abandon his initial plan of action, shaking the foundation of his strategic infiltration.
With mere conjecture about the success of the partial implementation of the Epsilon malware as his only solace, Miller finds himself racing against mechanical assassins programmed to take him down.
It's during this exhilarating escape that Miller encounters Leyla.
The two come face-to-face in an intense confrontation, fueled by mounting suspicion and tension stemming from his mission's secrecy.
Unforeseen by Miller, Leyla, intrigued by the hidden depths of his operation and moved by his sincerity, makes a decision that turns the tide in their favor.
She chooses to aid Miller, becoming an unexpected ally.
Act four is initiated with a fresh alliance.
Miller and Leyla pool their resources and skills, tackling wild jeep chases through the labyrinthine streets and skillfully executing parkour jumps off towering rooftops.
Together, they reach Miller's concealed base nestled within the walls of an old, inconspicuous brick structure.
Amidst the holographic domains and flickering computer screens in his covert hub, they pour over the fragmented mission data.
It soon dawns on them that the mission took a significant blow - the Epsilon malware was only half-implanted within the Iron Dome's mainframe.
Yet, Miller's defiant spirit refuses to back down.
He quickly identifies a potential oversight in the facility's security, possibly left exposed due to the half-implanted malware, presenting a small window of opportunity.
However, harnessing this opportunity would require a marriage of Leyla's field knowledge and Miller's techno-wizardry.
A collaboration that could either turn the tides in their favor or push them further into the abyss of failure.
Act five unleashes their audacious strategy.
Miller and Leyla devise a risky plan to exploit the loophole using a hijacked military vehicle which would bypass the facility's defenses and deliver the remaining Epsilon malware.
Leyla pledges her support to this seemingly suicidal plan, bringing forth resources collected during her long government service in Syrian law enforcement.
Their daring plan is not greeted with enthusiasm by the hierarchy at Code Delta.
Miller's boss argues for the mission's elevated risk and the possible ignition of global conflict, threatening to shut down the entire operation from his secure office in Washington D.C.
He stresses the potentially damaging fallout of Miller's audacity.
Despite facing severe backlash and witnessing the crumbling support from his superiors, Miller and his newfound ally, Leyla, stand their ground.
Act six leads Miller and Leyla down the path of rebellion.
Defying the orders from their superiors, the pair rally their resources, bolster their intelligence, and launch a daring assault on the Iron Dome.
Audience hearts skip a beat as Miller cautiously navigates through complex laser security, confronting cybernetically enhanced operatives tasked with halting his progress.
Simultaneously, Leyla holds her own battle in a local marketplace.
With swift thinking and calculated movements, she diverts attention, buying Miller crucial time for his operation.
As the Act reaches its climax, in a breath-taking sequence, Miller manages to implant the remaining Epsilon malware data packet into the Dome's control room.
Act VII charts the duo's dramatic escape.
The implementation of Epsilon malware creates chaos inside the Iron Dome, providing Miller and Leyla the perfect smoke screen to escape the facility.
Leveraging the prevailing pandemonium, the duo skillfully dodge security and make a headlong dash towards the exit, leaving behind the Dome in a cloud of impending doom.
Once out of the danger zone, a bond that goes deeper than mere comradeship blossoms between Miller and Leyla.
Under a star-veiled Syrian sky, Leyla assures Miller of her allegiance and promises to protect his mission from bureaucratic interference.
Miller’s arrival back to Code Delta agency is severely met with outrage and disbelief from his director, furious at Miller's insubordination which put the agency at risk.
Opening the final Act, we find Miller distanced from his parent agency.
Alienated and unphased by the hostility from his superiors, he resolves to go lone-wolf, pledging to put his irreplaceable tech skills to use to aid those in need, globally.
The movie nears its end as the concluding drone shots show Miller's silhouette dissolving into the desert horizon.
Thus concludes the thrilling eight Act narrative of "Miller's Mission".

title: A Babysitter's Guide to Monster Hunting
synopsis: Kelly Ferguson was plagued by nightmares as a young child.
She is still nicknamed Monster Girl as a high school freshman in Rhode Island because she had told people a monster had attacked her at five.
Although planning to attend a senior's Halloween party that night, Kelly's mom has told her boss Ms. Zellman that Kelly can babysit her son Jacob so she can attend their office party.
The single mother gives her pages of information, of dos and don'ts.
Once they're alone, Jacob tells Kelly about the monsters that plague him, showing her drawings of them.
Kelly tells him that he'll stop dreaming of them in the future, like she did, then she checks for monsters under the bed and in the closet before handing him a little lights to ward off dark things.
A few  minutes later she hurries back, only to find three small monsters abducting him.
While Kelly calls 911, Liz Lerue shows up.
She is part of a secret society of children-protecting babysitters, and she calls the small monsters who carried off Jacob toadies.
They go on a mission to find the boy, who has been kidnapped by the Boogeyman.
Liz uses the infant she cares for to lure out the toadies, after tracking them down.
However, the shiny object she offers it for Jacob doesn't tempt it as it normally would.
The toadies deliver Jacob to the Boogeyman, who gleefully explains how he plans to collect an army of monsters, thanks to Jacob's ability to imagine a large variety of them.
He sets up Jacob in a bed, hooks his head in a helmet designed to extract his nightmares, and tries to lull him to sleep.
Meanwhile, after Liz returns the baby to her home, the girls go to Brown University to the Rhode Island Order of Babysitters headquarters.
The vicepresident, she tasks the trainees (SITs) with emptying the pouch of the toadie they've captured and searching for Jacob.
Using a magic dust to recover memory, Kelly recalls the Boogeyman telling her at five that she has the ability to bring her dreams to life.
She realizes he's the Grand Guignol, a stealer of dreams and bringer of nightmares.
All of the SITs share scars from their own run-ins with boogeymen as small children.
They will have to imbed Angel Hair potion in the Boogeyman with a monster punch.
Curtis searches the globe for the ingredients.
In the meantime, he provides Kelly with a few tools to help her on their quest.
Feeding the toadie a tracker, they let it escape in hopes it will lead them to the Boogeyman.
The toadie finds the tracker and informs the Boogeyman, who sets up a trap.
Led to the Halloween party Kelly had wanted to attend, Liz and an unenthusiastic Kelly enter, seeking the tracker.
A shadow monster awaits them in the basement.
Chasing it around the house, they eventually realize they were led to a dead end.
Next, the girls try to prevent the cat's eye amulet from being used by the Boogeyman, but are unsuccessful.
Kelly escapes, but he captures Liz.
Simultaneously both Curtis is concocting the Angel Hair potion while Kelly finds and breaks into the condemned lighthouse where Jacob is being held and the nightmares are starting to be extracted.
The toadies try to cage Kelly, but she outwits them.
A hypnotised Liz locks her up, but she uses a multi-functional tool from Curtis which knocks her down and snaps her back to normal.

In the chamber where the nightmare creatures are about to be released by the Boogeyman, Kelly knocks the Angel Hair given to her by a SIT into him with a monster punch and an awakened Jacob dissipates the nightmare monsters.
Getting Jacob home before Ms. Zellman arrives, Kelly is commended for getting Jacob to sleep.
Not only is she asked to babysit the next night, but Liz tells her she's going to recommend her to the Order of Babysitters and her crush Victor asks her out.

title: The Ledger (film)
synopsis: The cinematic journey commences in the hushed atmosphere of a deserted office, bathed in the sterile light of the late evening.
Amid the ocean of empty seats and lifeless screens, we find our protagonist, Paul Smith from Essex, England.
He is seated at the corner desk dealing with a swarm of paperwork, working tirelessly.
Paul serves as a stoic and highly principled accountant at Gold Leaf Bank, a globally renowned banking powerhouse stationed at the resounding heart of London's financial district.
As a classic introvert, Paul finds solace in the methods and precision of financial calculations.
One fateful evening, while scrutinizing the myriad ledger entries of the annual financial documents, he is pricked by an anomaly, an anomaly that forcefully grabs his attention.
The irregularities point to financial transactions tethered to offshore accounts.
This unexpected discovery intrigues him, and he finds himself modifying his routine, shifting his professional priorities to scrutinize every inch of the unusual books.

Paul, a seasoned accountant with over two decades of experience, channelizes his sharp eye for detail and analytical prowess in tracing the origins and final destinations of these inexplicable transfers.
As he plunges deeper into the labyrinth of financial documents and complex transactions, the conspiracy starts shaping itself into a grandeur, as confounding as it is shocking.
With each passing night, Paul peels away the layers of a massive internal conspiracy, a sinister plot that implicates the very core of the esteemed Gold Leaf Bank he had devoted years serving.

His tireless pursuit of truth leads to a shocking revelation; the mastermind behind this elaborate ploy is none other than his immediate superior - Mr. Arthur Henderson, a figure revered for his pioneering financial acumen and steady leadership.

This revelation sends shivers down his spine and casts a looming shadow of paranoia over his regular routines, but his steadfast moral compass impels him to amass irrefutable evidence before taking any sudden steps.
As Paul ventures further into this perilous journey, he realizes that the fraudulent trail thickens with every step, casting a dense net of corruption and deception.
Mr. Henderson, feeling the pressing heat of scrutiny, grows increasingly paranoid, threatening to detonate this volatile situation.
Despite the mounting sense of danger, Paul's resolve crystallizes, surrounded by a singular mission of exposing this pervasive scam.
On his path, he discovers an ally in Emma Thompson, a fellow accountant whose cynical demeanor about the organization's dealings mirrors his own.
Finding camaraderie in their mutual contempt for the virulent corruption poisoning their profession, Paul and Emma gradually form an unwavering alliance.

Working silently like covert operatives, the unlikely pair collaborates, assembling indispensable evidence against the scheming superior whose actions have morphed Gold Leaf Bank into a center for underhanded operations.
Bolstered by strength from their newfound bond, Paul and Emma orchestrate a bold confrontation against Mr. Henderson, the monstrous puppeteer of their once trustworthy organization.
Their quiet expose escalates into a hair-raising climax when the local authorities barge into the confrontation, acting upon an anonymous tip-off most likely orchestrated by our heroes.
The authorities quickly apprehend the shocked Mr. Henderson, thus triumphantly concluding Paul and Emma's venture.
In the aftermath of the scandal, independent financial auditors engulf Gold Leaf Bank.
Paul's unwavering courage and commitment to truth are rewarded with a much-deserved promotion, now the Director of Compliance.
Standing tall beside him, Emma too reaps the fruits of their shared victory.
Her promotion to Senior Auditor paves the way for a more accountable and transparent Gold Leaf Bank.
Their bond, forged in the searing heat of their shared ordeal, motivates them to establish an organization advocating for transparency and upholding employee rights.
Transparency Watch, their nascent organization, resonates with their harrowing experiences.
From an inconspicuous accountant to a celebrated whistleblower, Paul's transformative journey beautifully intersects with Emma's resilient spirit.
Their tale leaves viewers with a profound sense of optimism and a renewed faith in the extraordinary power of truth and integrity.

title: Theft and Desperation
synopsis: John Travers, a battle-hardened journalist formerly employed by The New York Times, grapples with the burdensome weight of financial hardship.
The unanticipated downswing of the market instantly erodes his entire life savings, propelling him into a pit of looming credit card bills and burgeoning mortgage obligations.
He stumbles upon a dilapidated barn housing a hidden gem – a weather-beaten stack of photos chronicling a 1959 Ferrari 250 GT in its prime.
The classic car, worth millions in the collectors' world, belongs to Mrs. Reid, an elderly woman of fading recollection and uncomplicated demeanor, who lives tranquilly with her only daughter, Gwen.
Stricken with desperation, John hatches a grand plan to secure the priceless automobile.
He initiates a rapport with Gwen Reid, a compassionate woman in her mid-thirties entirely dedicated to caring for her ailing mother.
John introduces himself to Gwen as an out-of-work reporter facing financial hardship, and volunteers to help with domestic duties.
As he delves deeper into Gwen’s world, John begins to appreciate the earnestness of her existence.
Gwen and John unknowingly create a unique bond of mutual respect and affection.
One night, unable to resist the material allure of the Ferrari, John attempts to acquire the classic car, but his conscience makes him abandon his plan midway.
He leaves the Reid household without an explanation.
Struggling with John's inexplicable disappearance, Gwen discovers his initial intentions, leaving her feeling profoundly betrayed.
Yet, upon uncovering that John had ultimately abandoned his plan to steal the car, Gwen is overwhelmed with a complex mix of sympathy towards his plight and disappointment in his deception.
Gwen rationalizes John's actions, attributing them less to malign intent and more to desperate circumstances.
With forgiveness, Gwen decides to auction the invaluable 1959 Ferrari 250 GT with the local automobile collector’s association and plans to pass on the proceeds to John.
Gwen finally locates John, surviving amidst squalid conditions in a shabby, low-rent flat in Brooklyn.
She shows up unannounced at John’s doorstep, presenting him with a check bearing the substantial amount raised through the sale of the Ferrari.
As he processes the circumstances leading to Gwen's unexpected arrival, a tearful reunion ensues, with heartfelt confessions of love and remorse.
John consents to Gwen's persuasion of returning to the Reid household.

title: Crimes of the Future (2022 film)
synopsis: At an unspecified future date, significant advances in biotechnology led to the invention of machines and (analogue) computers that can directly interface with and control bodily functions, which have become the norm.
Simultaneously, humankind itself has experienced several biological changes of indeterminate origin.

Most significant among these changes is the disappearance of physical pain and infectious disease for an overwhelming majority (allowing for surgery to be safely performed on conscious people in ordinary settings), but other humans experience more radical alterations to their physiology.
One of them, an eight-year-old boy named Brecken, displays the innate ability to consume and digest plastics as food.
Convinced that he is inhuman, Brecken's mother smothers him with a pillow, leaving his corpse to be found by her ex-husband Lang.
Saul Tenser and Caprice are a world-renowned performance artist couple.
They take advantage of Tenser's "accelerated evolution syndrome", a disorder that forces his body to constantly develop new organs, by surgically removing them before a live audience.

The syndrome leaves Tenser in constant pain and with severe respiratory and digestive discomfort; he is consequently reliant on several specialized biomechanical devices, including a bed, a machine through which Caprice performs surgery on him, and a chair that twitches and rotates as it assists him with eating.

Tenser and Caprice meet with bureaucrats in charge of the National Organ Registry, a governmental office designed to uphold the state's restrictions on human evolution by cataloging and storing newly evolved organs.
One of the bureaucrats, the nervy Timlin, becomes captivated by Tenser's artistic goals.

At a successful show of Tenser's, she tells him that "surgery is the new sex", a sentiment that Tenser and many other characters appear to embrace as repetitive cutting seems to be replacing traditional sex and masturbation as the preferred means of sexual gratification.
A governmental police unit seeks to use Tenser to infiltrate a group of radical evolutionists.
Without telling Caprice, Tenser meets a series of contacts through other biological performance art shows that lead him to the evolutionist cell.

One of them, former cosmetic surgeon Nasatir, creates a zippered cavern in Tenser's stomach, which Caprice uses to access Tenser's organs in an oral sex act where she fellates his zipper wound and presumably his internal organs while he moans in erotic pleasure.
Caprice continues to network with other performance artists, eventually choosing to receive decorative cosmetic surgery on her forehead.
Tenser meets with Timlin, who reveals to him the agenda of the evolutionists: they have chosen to modify their digestive system to make them able to eat plastics and other synthetic chemicals.
Their principal food is a purple processed "candy bar" of toxic waste, fatally poisonous to others.
Lang is the leader of the cell; his son Brecken had been born with the ability to eat plastic, proving the inaccuracy of the government's critical stance on human evolution.
Timlin tries to initiate sex with Tenser, but he says he is not good at "the old sex".
Tenser is eventually approached by Lang, who wants Tenser and Caprice to reveal the cell's anti-government agenda through a public autopsy of Brecken that will highlight his evolved digestive system.
After some deliberation, Tenser agrees.
With Timlin, Lang, and many others watching, Tenser performs the autopsy, but it is revealed that Brecken's natural organ system has been surgically replaced.
Lang flees the show in tears.
Outside, he is approached by two agents who supposedly work for the corporation that manufactures Tenser's biomedical machines.
Mimicking their earlier killing of Nasatir, they assassinate Lang by driving power drills into his head.
Tenser's connection within the police unit admits that Timlin replaced Brecken's organs to keep the deviation in human evolution secret from the public.
Saddened by Brecken and Lang's deaths, Tenser informs the police that he will no longer serve them, approvingly mentioning the cell's beliefs on evolution.
Tenser struggles to eat in his chair.
He asks Caprice to give him a bar of plastic.
As Caprice records him, he eats it, looks into Caprice's camera, and sheds a tear.
His mouth twitches into a smile as the chair finally quiets.

title: Holiday Hustle: Northeast Edition (2023 film)
synopsis: Portland, Maine, dons a celebratory aura during the holiday season, to the point where pulchritudinous twinkling lights and cheery garlands pervade the quainter Old Port and the tranquil Back Cove.

The culmination of this merriment lies within the sprawling corridors of the annual mega-market, the Portland Mall, replete with holiday decorations and exuding vibrancy, which is known for its annual post-Thanksgiving bonanza sale.

The coterie of enthusiastic shoppers attending ranges from Jake, a film studies student at the local university with an inherent curiosity, to Maria, a diligent single mother of two working tirelessly as a nurse, Frank, the retired detective with a sharp intellect, the quiet and introspective Ellie from the city library, and Roger, a citywide famous real-estate tycoon.
Equipped with pre-prepared lists of desired items, each shopper plots their trajectory to exploit the grand sale to its fullest.
A large digital clock positioned above the entrance ticks down the seconds until midnight, at which the automated glass doors promptly swing open and inaugurate the event.
A carefully choreographed chaos engulfs the mall as folks dash in, quickly grabbing everything from the latest electronics to high-end clothes off the painstakingly arranged shelves.
The bustling scene, however, soon devolves into horrific pandemonium as a harrowing scream reverberates throughout the multi-storey complex.
The source of the chaotic screaming is the gruesome discovery of a mutilated body in the linen department, nestled candidly next to a shipment of festively scarlet tablecloths.
The response is swift, with city law enforcement closing off all egress points and transforming the previously free-roaming shopping center into a foreboding containment area.
Avid mystery enthusiast Jake, piqued by the gruesome turn of events, steps forward to provide his layman investigative nous to the incident.
Jake's resolve is not without fear as he stumbles upon more victims strategically hidden amid the retail spaces and service corridors labyrinth, their grim sight inducing a sense of looming dread.
Fear and chaos coalesce; the excited chatter and elation are replaced with terrified pleas and declarations of innocence as people realize their precarious position.
Amid the burgeoning tumult, the seemingly unrelated group of Jake, Maria, Frank, Ellie, and Roger find common ground and unite to unveil the murderer's identity.
The team's sleuthing leads them to suspect the mall's Santa Claus, who has maintained an unsettling stillness at his lavishly decorated grotto since the lockdown began.
They decide to question the costumed figure, despite his seemingly innocuous demeanor.
Their plan takes an unexpected turn when a moment of confrontation snowballs into a breathless pursuit through the jumbled maze of shoppers and merchandise.
The chase extends unexpectedly, through frozen aisles and carries them to the snowcapped rooftop of the formidable structure.
With few viable alternatives remaining, they venture into the dimly-lit, labyrinthine underground service tunnels, illuminated sporadically with emergency light.
Each person draws upon their individual talents, converting their deadly pursued-pursuer duel into a high-risk team campaign.
Frank's experience in law enforcement proves crucial in planning their strategy and Ellie's knowledge of the mall layout, acquired from numerous visits, proves invaluable.
Maria’s ability to think on her feet helps them maintain a steady pace while Roger, with his authoritative personality, helps the team remain focused and engaged in the daunting task.
Their collective efforts allow them to corner the suspicious Santa Claus amidst the colorful, toy-laden section of the mall.
An intense confrontation unfurls amidst rows of gleaming, dancing elves and the red-and-white clad figure.
With their backs against the wall, they are galvanized by the raucous noise of the police swat team forcing entry into the mall.
Their relentless efforts finally bring the murderer to justice, returning a semblance of calm to the vast, resplendently lit shopping complex.
The mall’s doors are reopened; a collective sigh of relief vibrates through the chilled December night air as the ordeal concludes.
Jake, Maria, Frank, Ellie, and Roger, having been bled dry mentally and physically, are reunited with anxious family members who had been waiting on tenterhooks outside the mall.
Despite parting ways after the experience, the bonds of shared trauma etch an unspoken understanding onto their faces, forever linking their shared nightmares.
The Portland Mall, with its dazzling holiday illuminations and festive decorations, now stands as a chilling reminder of the horrific incident.
Its once lively storefronts now deserted, its food court lit eerily by stubbornly remaining Christmas lights, the re-opened mall casts a lingering, gloomy shadow over their festive spirit.

title: Leased Misunderstanding
synopsis: Jack, a meticulous and hardworking architect from New York's ever-busy Manhattan, receives an electrifying job offer.
He is overjoyed when a leading German real estate developer presents him with his career's ultimate challenge, to design a 50-story, stage-of-the-art office skyscraper in Berlin, Germany.
He perceives this as the opportunity he's been dreaming of, the final chance to carve his name in the annals of skyscraper architecture.

Brimming with anticipation, he secures a lease for a stunning, artistically-decorated loft apartment in Friedrichshain, an East Berlin neighborhood renowned for its spirited graffities and unique urbanscape.
With hopes simmering in his heart, he sets foot aboard a Lufthansa flight from New York to Berlin.
Jet-lagged though excited, Jack lands in Berlin and drags his luggage, filled with designer clothes and precision drawing instruments, up to the fourth floor of his rental apartment.
But in the Altbau apartment, stamped with Berlin's distinctive architectural flavor, a complete stranger sprawls comfortably.
Eric, a local German rocker with unruly dreadlocks, has already made Jack's new home his own.
Caught off-guard, Jack whips out his freshly-printed lease papers, explaining that he leased the property just before leaving New York.
Eric, entirely unmoved and nonchalant, presents his own contract, revealing he had secured the apartment just a month prior.
Their heated debates about rightful ownership evolve into an exhausting three-hour dispute.
The documents clash, yet neither of the adamant men is ready to withdraw their claim.
Stricken with a lack of extra housing options and pushed by desperation, they concede to a tense agreement of rooming together temporarily until a solution is reached.
The rigid space allotment helps keep interactions to a minimum.
Jack, an OCD-ridden planner who cherishes pristine environments, starts grappling with the misplaced musical instruments and the constant wave of Eric's musician friends flooding their shared space.
Jack misses an all-important Skype meeting with his German clients, courtesy of Eric's deafening late-night drumming practice.
The repercussions of this unfortunate event threaten to jeopardize Jack's monumental skyscraper project, risking his professional credibility.
Seeing the strain seeping into Jack's demeanor and realizing his error's magnitude, Eric extends peace offert by offering his creativity.
He pitches in his artistic flair to infuse unique aesthetic elements into Jack's preliminary skyscraper layouts.
Their forced collaboration then blossoms into a creative fusion.
The redesigned model, a testament of their newly-fused artistry, is shared with their clients, who, to their relief and mutual surprise, welcome this refreshing architectural approach.
Their cohabitation gradually changes them.
Their shared struggles and triumphs start to shape their characters.
At the pinnacle of their newfound friendship, a shocking notice arrives from the real estate agency.
It announces Eric's lease to be null due to a simple clerical error in his documentation.
Betrayed and disheartened, Eric begins to suspect Jack of pulling strings to override his lease.
Jack, equally baffled by the development, shoulders the blame.
The pressure cooker of stress multiplies for Jack.
He has to juggle between meeting the final deadline for the skyscraper project and wage a passionate legal battle, all in favor of Eric's housing rights.
Using Jack's influential contacts and his lawyer's incisive legal defense, they succeed in overturning the unjust eviction notice and securing Eric's right to the apartment.
With the intense legal battle vanquished and their collaborative skyscraper beautifully erected in Berlin's skyline, they decide to celebrate.
The unique bond they have cultivated becomes apparent over shared laughter and clinking glasses.
Embracing the colorful rhythms of their merged lifestyles, they agree to continue their unusual living arrangement, preserving the harmony they have established amidst all odds.
The picturesque loft stands in the heart of Friedrichshain, representing their journey of unexpected friendship, acceptance, and personal growth.
On a casual Sunday evening, while lounging in the living room, they share a hearty laugh looking back at their past petty quarrels about cleanliness and noise levels.
The chaotic fusion of architecture and music reflects two contrasting worlds coming together in harmony.

title: Along for the Ride (film)
synopsis: Eighteen-year-old Auden West, a recent high school graduate, goes to stay with her father Robert in the small beachside town of Colby, wanting to spend a carefree summer reinventing herself before she leaves for college.
A daughter of academics and an exemplary student, her mother objects to her wanting to spend time with her father.
An absentee dad for years, locking himself away in his office to work on his studies, he has an infant and is remarried to Heidi.Upon Heidi's suggestion, Auden goes to the Tip on her first day.
As she's experimenting, she makes out with a guy, later regretting it.
Heidi takes her in to her shop the next day, where she's to look after the receipts.
She comes face to face with three girls she'd seen at the Tip (Maggie is the ex of the guy she made out with).
Now they all work together.
A loner and night-person, Auden roams the streets after everyone else is asleep.
Ten days after her arrival she meets fellow insomniac Eli.
A BMXer, he takes her on nightly adventures and he challenges her to a quest to do all the things she missed out on in her childhood.
On their first outing, they go to a secret pie shop, and he introduces her to Connect Four.
On the next, they play mini golf and she admits she never got to wear her prom dress.
Auden's mother turns up on a rainy day, taking her for lunch.
She's obviously envious of her ex and Heidi.
Auden gets closer to the girls, being invited both to watch Maggie do cross-country BMXing and to a Conch House party.
There she finds out about Eli's accident where a drunk driver killed his best friend Abe.During an outing to the drive-in to see The Princess Bride, Auden and Eli talk about being night-owls.
She admits that it started when she was a child, from trying to prevent her parents from fighting, but as usual, he doesn't share.
That night she finds videos of him and Abe on YouTube.
Another evening, Auden says yes to the quest, so they break into the lighthouse.
Later, talking in Eli's truck, he pushes the idea of learning to ride a bike again, and she tries to bring up his BMXing, but neither want to talk about it.
A night when he is wheeling her around in a shopping cart, it falls over and, although she's OK, he apologises profusely.
When Auden brings up the HDP (hot dog party) annual July 4 party, Eli tells her to have fun, refusing to go.
Hours later he actually shows up, surprising everyone.
To get everyone to forget about it, she and Eli start a food fight.
Soon afterwards, a night swim is invoked by all, and Auden and Eli kiss for the first time under the fireworks.
On a coffee run, Auden gets side-tracked.
Seeing her dad with a suitcase in front of the café, he complains that all new mothers are nuts.
She calls him out on his mistakes, that he quits the moment things get hard.
Auden checks in with Heidi, who explains she lost it because he wouldn't even go out as a family on the 4th, her favorite.
Calling her mother for support, as she's an advocate for women's rights, she drives to the house to give moral support.
Between that talk and Auden calling him out, her dad comes back and starts helping out with the baby.
Auden and Eli have a temporary falling out over biking, she because she won't admit she never learned and he because he's mostly abandoned BMXing because of Abe's death.
She asks Maggie to teach her and he gets back to training.
Some days later, Auden's called to the skate park to see Eli compete.
After his win she congratulates him, and they make up.
Eli shows up, wearing a tux, so Auden comes out wearing her prom dress.
She bikes with him to the beach, their friends join them also dressed for the prom, and they have an impromptu party.
The closing scene is of Auden rereading a postcard from Eli in Barcelona before she and Maggie, college roommates, head to lunch.

title: Beast Beast
synopsis: In a suburban town in the Southern United States, a high school student named Krista is a member of her school's theater program.
In her childhood, she produced short videos with her next-door neighbor, the recently graduated Adam.
Adam has since started a YouTube channel to which he uploads videos of himself providing demonstrations on using various models of firearms that he owns.
However, his videos are receiving little attention online, and his father disapproves of his focusing on his YouTube presence rather than finding a job elsewhere.
Nito, a skateboarder, attends the same school as Krista.

One day, while idling outside the apartment where he and his apathetic guardian live, Nito meets a fellow tenant named Yoni, who invites Nito to a party that night after seeing him perform a kickflip.
At the party, Nito interacts with Krista, who earlier that evening had watched videos of Nito skateboarding online.
Later on, police officers arrive to break up the party.
In the commotion, a male partygoer tries to grab Krista, and Nito fights him off.
Krista escapes but Nito is arrested.
After being released from jail, Nito is picked up in a car by Yoni and Yoni's friends Lena and Jarrett.
Yoni, Lena, and Jarrett convince Nito to help them steal items such as Hot Pockets and perfume.
During school, Nito and Krista grow closer; he tries to show her how to skateboard, and she teaches him how to imitate being slapped and choked for stage purposes.
While working on a performance inspired by a past experience Nito had with a parakeet, he and Krista share a kiss.

In an effort to attract more viewers and subscribers to his YouTube channel, Adam produces a dramatized video of himself detailing an experience he claimed to have had wherein he fended off an attack by a wild warthog using a firearm.
When the video receives a number of negative and insulting comments, Adam becomes infuriated and records a video of himself angrily responding to and threatening the commenters.
Lena drives Nito, Yoni, and Jarrett to the house where her boss lives, and demands that they break in and retrieve her vape pen, which her boss confiscated from her.
Her boss is Adam's mother, and when Nito, Yoni, and Jarrett enter the house, Adam hears them from his upstairs bedroom.
Jarrett begins to ascend the stairs leading up to the house's second floor, and Adam fatally shoots him from the top of the stairs with a rifle.
After Adam proceeds to shoot Yoni, Nito attempts to flee, but is shot and killed by Adam after running outside.
Krista, walking home from school with a friend, watches Nito die and sees an armed Adam standing in the doorway to the house.
The incident is covered by the news, prompting Adam's YouTube channel to receive a surge of popularity.
Online commenters and local police officials refer to Adam as a "hero" for standing his ground against the three intruders.
Adam continues to make firearms-based videos that prove successful with his online followers, while Krista becomes an emotional wreck at school over the loss of Nito.
When Adam is invited to speak at a conference about firearms, Krista attends and follows him into a restroom to confront him.
She forces him to put his hands around her neck and she screams, drawing the attention of police officers in the building.
Adam is detained, and the video he made in which he threatens his YouTube commenters is leaked to the public.
Meanwhile, Krista returns to her theater classes with a sense of closure.

title: All the Hidden Corners
synopsis: John Thompson and Lily Smith, born and bred in the picture-perfect town of Laramie, Wyoming, had been the best of friends since their sandbox era.

They spent the bright sunny Wyoming mornings attending their final grueling year of Laramie High School before surrendering their afternoons to high-spirited discussions about dreams and aspirations lurking beyond their quaint little town.

Amidst the monotonous humdrum, Old Tom O'Brien, an enigmatic figure with crinkled skin and twinkling eyes, held the town captive with his gripping tales of 'hidden corners' that reportedly lay dormant within Laramie's unseen realms.
On a particularly dreary Tuesday, after surviving an excruciatingly dull algebra class, the notion of exploring the unreal corners of their small town ignited newfound vigor within John and Lily.
Despite apprehensions, they succumbed to their curiosity and embarked on an audacious journey to unfold the veiled mysteries of Laramie.
Their pursuit began with tireless hours spent within the hushed stacks of Laramie Public Library, surrounded by a labyrinth of dusty records and faded maps.
The initial lead directed them towards the dilapidated Baker grain mill – a forgotten relic on the eastern fringe of town, which allegedly concealed the first of the hidden corners.
The sight of the ruined mill, up until then a mythical entity, stood as a concrete testimony of Old Tom's tales, challenging their perception of their beloved hometown's history.
With each corner they unveiled, they encountered disruptive revelations that impacted their once-affluent friendship and transformed it into an emotional battleground.
Through this rollercoaster journey, they discovered the enduring strength of their friendship that now bore deeper roots than mere high-school companionship.
Unbeknownst to them, the townsfolk began to notice subtle alterations in their once predictable demeanor, fueling suspicions around their peculiar activities.
Ignoring the brewing storm, the adventurous duo delved deeper into their quest that led to a mindboggling revelation at the fifth hidden corner, nestled amidst the wildflowers at Cricketer's Hill.
The unearthed secrets evoked such a profound emotional reaction that it prompted an unforeseen showdown between John and Lily and their once secure town.
The confrontation led to exaggerated differences among the community, echoing the unresolved discord within their seemingly tranquil lives.
Despite the wavering sentiments, they vowed to reveal the final corner.
They believed it held the power to reconcile misaligned relationships and mend differing perspectives.
The last corner, located beneath the beloved town gazebo, revealed forgotten fragments of Laramie's history, challenging their self-identities and the essence of their existence.
However, their ground-shaking discoveries were abruptly interrupted by Mayor Walter Freeman, who staunchly opposed their venture and attempted to terminate their quest.
The narrative took a chilling twist when it was revealed that one of the hidden corners concealed secrets throwing light on the Mayor's dubious past.
A gutsy confrontation ensued in the town hall wherein the knowledgeable friends, the disgraced Mayor, and the indignant townsfolk were entangled in a heated discourse.
As they dug deeper, they exposed Mayor Freeman's extensive manipulation of public opinion to veil the town's rich past beneath an artfully woven web of lies.
With courage and firm conviction, they unveiled Mayor Freeman's guilt, banishing him from his respected stature to wearing the disdainful crown of a town villain.
This unexpected development sent seismic waves of disbelief throughout Laramie, threatening to shatter its peace.
Amid the ensuing chaos, John and Lily found solace and love in their shared trials and tribulations.
The whirlwind of untangled mysteries, coupled with their quest's resolution, kindled a deep affection between them – an emotion they had never anticipated.
Embracing their newfound romance, they decided to plant their roots in Laramie, seeing it no longer as an obligatory stop but as a cherished home.
With this poignant realization, they felt an overwhelming sense of responsibility: leveraging their unique knowledge to lead the town towards comprehensive transparency.
Their new label as Laramie's 'truth seekers' propelled them to mend their fractured community and advocate honesty, essential for the town's resurgence.
They devoted countless hours strategizing effective ways to nourish their beloved town that once lay beneath their childhood fantasies for capricious adventures in far-off lands.

The narrative concludes with the silhouette of John and Lily set against a mesmerizing Wyoming sunset, their familiar Laramie town now standing proudly under a hopeful gleam of light, marking an end of their unforgettable journey and the beginning of several exciting adventures.

title: Coastline Chronicles (1940 film)
synopsis: Our protagonist, Jane Doe, is a reflective woman residing in the picturesque county of Sussex, England.
As she walks, her mind paints a vivid tapestry of thoughts for her highly anticipated column in 'The Sussex Chronicle', a local newspaper that values her commentary and insights.

The peace is promptly shattered by the crackling radio broadcasts from BBC, projecting alarming news of the escalating World War II, and the crisp headlines of 'The Observer,' underscoring the tension-filled climax of the 1940s.
Jane observes an anomaly—a worn-out leather-bound diary, skilfully camouflaged among the beach pebbles.
Upon closely examining the roughly textured cover and the yellow-stained pages within, Jane begins to read.
Each entry reflects the raw, unabridged experiences of a soldier named Thomas Hawkins, who spelled his indomitable spirit and gruesome war recollections across these yellowed pages.
Ensnared by the brazen honesty and the raw expressions of fear, loss, and warm camaraderie drenched in alternating shades of hope and despair, Jane feels a torrent of emotions.
Jane begins to live the atrocities of war through Thomas's unsweetened perspective, where daylight and darkness morph into indeterminate stretches of time.
Armed with her journalistic persistence, Jane feels a compelling urge to uncover the chapters of Thomas's life that went beyond the worn pages of the diary.

Jane spends countless hours invested in municipal libraries and provincial record offices, pouring over registries, shipping logs, and military records in an attempt to trace the soldier whose diary told such a gripping tale.
She reaches out to everyone who might have crossed paths with Thomas or might have heard his story.
Her relentless pursuit leads her to Robert Griffiths, a war veteran.
Jane and Robert, through their rigorous efforts, encounter individuals with fragmented memories of Thomas and the war.
Their collective narratives paint a vicarious, terrifyingly graphic tale.
Their mutual sojourn forms a sturdy bond, their personal traumas forming a common strong thread that now binds them as allies.
After relentless sessions enveloped in age-old letters, sleepless nights, and disappointments leading to breakthroughs, they finally manage to complete the puzzle of Thomas's life.
Moved by this profound journey, Jane, with invaluable contributions from Robert, pens an enlightening yet touching tribute to Thomas for 'The Sussex Chronicle'.
The homage is a biographical tribute, outlining the life of soldier Thomas Hawkins, marked by his courageous endurance during a ruthless era.
Clutching the printed column, Jane and Robert pay their respects at Thomas's memorial located within the secluded Commonwealth War Graves.
Standing in front of the memorial, they pledge to keep Thomas's memory alive and honor his contribution to the world.
Jane continues her writing, now unfolding unknown and forgotten war stories and tragic heroes.
Following their shared journey, Jane and Robert's kinship flourishes, budding into a precious friendship.

The narrative concludes with Jane, standing solitary against the captivating backdrop of the Sussex coast, her focused gaze aimed at the horizon, symbolizing the numerous war tales still concealed, waiting to be rediscovered and shared.

title: The Offering (2023 film)
synopsis: An old man conducts a ritual by slaughtering a chicken and hurriedly spreading ash in a circle.
His sickly wife appears at the door and tells him to stop, to which he replies "Burn in hell".
He starts reading from a book and the letters start to bleed.
Then a little girl whispers his name, Yosille, and asks him if he wants to see his wife again, to which he replies negatively.
He steps outside the circle, swallowing a dark smoke as his sclera turns black.
He then stabs himself with a knife from his back pocket.
The demon tries to remove the amulet around his neck to no avail.
Arthur (Art) and his pregnant wife come to Brooklyn to visit his father, who runs a Jewish funeral house in a Hasidic community.
He and his father, Saul, became estranged after he married Claire, a non-Jewish British food journalist.
Saul is welcoming to Art and Claire, wanting to establish a relationship with both of them.
Art has an alternative agenda for the visit.
He needs his father to mortgage his house to help his failing real estate business.
Art volunteers to help his father with a new suicide body that has come in.
The funeral home is the basement of their home.
Art has a run in with Heimish, who works with his father.
Heimish cares for Saul and is suspicious of Art's visit.
As Saul and Heimish speak, Arthur prepares the body of Yosille.
While preparing the body, the amulet around his neck falls through a drain, releasing the demon which immediately begins to haunt Claire.
Saul comes across the knife that Yosille used to commit suicide and becomes suspicious.
He calls Reb Chayim and asks about the inscription.
Reb Chayim tells Saul that this, in conjunction with an amulet is used for a binding spell.
But as there was no amulet found, Chayim dismisses its importance.
Meanwhile, Art and Heimish go to pick up another body.
It is the body of Sarah Scheindel, a missing girl from the community.
Heimish picks up Art's phone and discovers Art's money problems and his intention to ask his father to mortgage his house.
Heimish exposes Art in front of Saul and Claire.
When Claire confronts Art, he opens up to her about his loss of faith after the death of his mother.
That night, while Saul is in the mortuary, the demon attacks and kills him.
Art wakes up the next day to see men praying around his father's body.
Heimish blames Art saying he died of a broken heart and gives him the paper that Art needed Saul to sign.
During the funeral both Art and Claire have disturbing visions.
Claire has visions of Sarah Schneidel.
Art sleepwalks and draws a sigil.
He wakes up on a carpet and thinks he was dreaming.
Art struggles to wrap up his father's business as Heimish has quit.
He is told that Yosille needs a police clearance before he can be buried or a next-of-kin must sign off on it, even though it was a clear suicide.
He goes to Yosille's house where he finds a video tape.
He discovers Yosille was attempting to conjure the archangel of life, Martiel, so that he could bring back his dead wife Aida.
He used Sarah for the ritual.
But the ritual killed Sarah and conjured the demon Abyzou instead.
Meanwhile, “Aida” comes to visit Claire and tells her she wants to see her husband's body.
When Claire tells her husband Aida is here to see Yosille's body, Art realizes his wife is in danger.
While Claire is on the phone, “Aida” burns Yosille's body, which releases the Abyzou.
Art tries to rescue his wife, but is unable to.
Art turns to Heimish and shows him Yosille's video.
Heimish brings in Chayim for help.
They discover the sigil and Chayim says that the demon gains strength and is fed when a child steps in it.
Chayim explains the binding ritual and explains that Abyzou has to be trapped in a body.
Art is willing to sacrifice himself for his wife and child.
Abyzou kills Chayim, so Art and Heimish rush to begin the ritual.
Heimish tells Art not to step outside the circle, but Heimish is taken by the demon.
Art begins the ritual, but he sees his wife who is taken and threatened by the demon.
He leaves the circle to rescue his wife who is being held against a high window.
Unable to do anything else, Art finishes the inscription to force the demon inside him, but he is unable to kill himself.
Heimish crawls to him and Art begs Heimish to stab him with the inscripted knife.
Heimish reluctantly stabs Art, then tells him that he should have stayed in the circle.
Heimish alludes to the amulet that has been taken off and flung across the room.
Art then sees the real Heimish's dead body in the next room, and dies helplessly.
Claire wakes up under a table.
She rushes to the demon masquerading as Art, but looks down to see she is standing in the sigil.
Abyzou appears and takes her.

title: Wings of Valor
synopsis: The film gets off to an adrenaline-filled start, showcasing an aerial battle of epic proportions between sophisticated F22 Raptor jets.
